It seems, most of her college roomies have gone vegan, like her, *lol*, so it's getting used quite a bit too.In any case, I just wanted to let people know that this steamer has staying power. It just keeps on running.

I am reviewing the Pink Lift / Rose #703, (this is what is printed on the back of the case), of the L'Oreal Paris Visible Lift Color Blush.Now then, when I say 'perfect for me', I mean exactly that. 'Colour' is such a subjective thing, one just has to try, and try, and try so many makeup colours before they find the right shade, tone, blah, blah, blah for them.This pink, with a very hint of 'bright' rose undertone, is lovely for me. This is not a 'mauvy' or 'lavenderish' pink. It is definitely on the brighter-side of pink. Think 'Queen Elizabeth Roses' pink only 'paler'. It's not a 'bubble-gum' pink either... so don't get that idea in your head. Sheesh. Trying to explain colour is nigh impossible!Anyways, I'm old-school. I come from 'rouge' world. For years and years, dare I say 'decades', blush was 'powder'. And I hate that. First of all, you can't get a really proper colour match to your lipstick. Second of all, the texture of powder is, well, in-a-word, 'horribly dry'. UGH UGH UGH.A 'rouge' is always cream-based. And what's so great about this particular blush is that it goes on 'creamy', but dries enough so that it is no longer 'creamy' to the touch. It's 'dry', but doesn't 'feel' or 'look' like 'powder'. Total brilliance as far as I'm concerned.It has a slight 'shimmer' to it. And I don't like shimmer-- I like matte. But, I cover this blush with my loose face powder anyway, so any hint of shimmer goes away. BUT, here's the fantastic thing: the colour stays!... even after applying your finishing powder. More brilliance!Okay... back to the colour. As there are about a million shades of pink out there, finding the right one is both costly, time-consuming, and frustrating. Let it be stated that I have been searching for YEARS for this colour. Make no mistake, like others have said, it's pale. But that's what I like about it. So many blushes are just a waste. You spend more time wiping most of the product off because the colour is so saturated. Now, while you want a saturated foundation to cover your skin, giving you that flawless palette., you DO NOT want your blush to have that same kind of saturation... else you end up looking so garish and, like I said, having to wipe so much away.Which is why I LOVE this product so much, that I turned around and bought 3 more online the very next day, cuz, dontcha know, just when you find something you love, it's discontinued. So, yeah, I'm stocking up big time on this blush.Back to the colour. Because it's creamy and dries powdery, it can be built upon. You WILL get a deeper, darker colour if you put on additional applications. For me, this is dictated by my lipstick. If I wear a pale shade of pink, I use one application of this blush. If I wear a darker shade of pink, I use two applications of blush. But never have I used more than three... and that's only when going out in the evening or to a dimly-lit formal affair.While others have stated that they use their fingers to apply this blush, I never use my fingers for any makeup application. I use a cosmetic sponge for this blush.I'm sure when all is said and done, I will have purchased at least 20 of these Pink Lift/Rose #703 blushes, (not to be confused with the 'Rose Lift' blush). And, yeah, you heard me right, *lol*. I do the same with my lipstick. Another item that is so difficult to find the right shade of. Well, I found mine and it matches so perfectly to this blush... (Maybelline 'Hooked On Pink', but, shhh, don't tell anybody I said so, *lol*). You can purchase it on Amazon as well.

I'm a professional Astrologer, and long-time student of 'Alchemy'. While Astrology is easy for me, Alchemy has been written of in such an obscure manner that I have had a difficult time understanding the 'bottom-line' of its philosophy.Well, NO MORE! This book, in one fell swoop, explains Alchemy so simply that I am shocked at the obscuration in previously written tomes. However, looking at the time-period of those writings, I can see why... for, what Alchemy actually is, would have been construed by the 'Church' as absolute heresy... punishable by death.Imagine that... instead of 'GOD' fixing what ails you, you can heal yourself using the 'brains' GOD gave you and the knowledge required of attaining true health, (as is explained in this book)... hence, who needs the 'Church'? No wonder they claimed 'Alchemy' as heresy. If people today knew of the information contained in this book, they, (the 'Church'), and the pharmaceutical companies would be out-of-business forthwith. I shudder to contemplate all of the needless suffering over the ages because of the Church's denouncement of Alchemy, and all so they could keep their stranglehold on humanity. Shameful.Anyway, I was so pleased to get not only the 'bottom-line' of Alchemy, but the more esoteric links of Alchemy to Astrology. This, alone, is worth the price of admission in being able to delineate a Chart more deeply... especially in terms of 'health'.The only negative comment I have about the book is the lack of explaining just how to diagnose, using one's Astrological Chart... nor, what dosages of the Cell Salts one should use, or for how long. Alas, being a dowser myself, I am presently using a Pendulum to determine such. Almost all books on Pendulums will have a 'Bio-Chemistry' chart contained therein for such purposes.In the final analysis, I cannot say enough about this book. It wraps up, in a perfect package, the Etymology of words, (with fabulous Bible references--Chapter & Verse); the Astrological linkages for a deeper understanding of the Bible, and the Philosophy of Alchemy in plain English.Buy it... you won't be disappointed.

I wrote the following in response to so-called book critic 'Dana Kennedy's' review of Sondra's book:Dana Kennedy: "I had a frightening premonition about the future of celebrity autobiographies... Everyone from Carmen Electra to the Olsen twins will be penning detailed and increasingly superfluous Hollywood memoirs. Lacking the rich anecdotes about classic movies, legendary directors, and passionate love affairs that the real stars of old wove into their bios, the tales told by also-rans like Locke are frequently padded with lengthy analyses of forgettable films".I have no idea who Dana Kennedy is; but, the obvious conclusion I draw from this person's analysis of Locke's book is an unevolved wannabe in the world of 'being noticed'. Those that can, 'do'. Those that can't, 'teach'. Those that can neither do nor teach, 'criticize'... and not very well at that.Dana Kennedy's 'frightening premonition' is based soley on that fact that he/she is impervious to the actual meaning behind these kinds of books. That meaning being breaking the bonds/shredding the veil of 'celebrity'. They cause us to realize that celebrity isn't all it's cracked-up to be. Dana wants to be regaled with 'rich anecdotes, legendary directors, passionate love affairs'... in other words, he/she wants to remain mystified, spellbound, enchanted with celebrity. Well, Dana THAT's what 'fiction' is for... not biographies.Sondra Locke did not settle for 'almost nothing' in her first suit against Clint Eastwood. She walked away with $450,000-cash, a director's deal at Warner Brothers, and Gordon's house. She accepted the low-cash settlement and Gordon's house precisely because of the Warner Brothers' deal so that she could continue her career pursuits of directing. She already had two critically-successful debuts as a director and felt confident that she could both feel satisfied creatively, while also turning a profit for both herself and Warner Brothers.That the Warner Brothers deal was a sham from the start is the crux of her book. I suspect you take her to task here because she dared to expose the 'man behind the curtain', and the machinations thereof, to the rest of us.While reality frightens Dana Kennedy, I, for one, was pleased that Sondra Locke had the courage to not only fight 'the powers that be', but also the courage to write about it. For every successful movie/acting career out there, there are 10,000 starving artists. This book clearly shows the hazards one is very likely to run into when stepping into this arena. How many people-- so nave, so innocent, so taken also by the 'fantasy' of Hollywood such as Dana describes-- have been crushed under the wheels of the morally corrupt and tawdry underbelly that truly runs Hollywood?Personally, I found Sondra Locke's book written from the heart of someone who is honest, decent, and morally intact. That her own naivete caused her downfall is neither here nor there. She fell in love, and that love blinded her to the truth, (of a very sick man, and a very sick industry), much the same as Dana Kennedy seems to want to fall under the same spell when reading bios of celebrities.As for Sondra's and Gordon's 'mystical' experiences, only those who have experienced the same kinds of things can relate. Those who have not, can do nothing but scoff. I, myself, attained Samadhi at the age of 20. With no one to turn to because such things rarely happen, especially in our Western Culture, I was left both ecstatic and devastated. I'm 60-years-old now, and it took me the better part of my life to find out just what 'had' happened to me way back when.And, much like Gordon's and Sondra's journey into the mystic, I, too, experienced frequent signs, omens, and breadcrumbs along the way. For Dana to pooh-pooh these kinds of experiences is to reveal oneself as not only ignorant, but of closed mind and closed heart. More's the pity.As for Clint Eastwood, there is no question this man is one sick, narcissistic sociopath. Any man who wants his woman to call him 'daddy' has the mark of a man whose psychology takes the shape of 'paternalistic power' expressed lustfully. In other words, he doesn't sexualize children, he 'childrenizes' his sexual partners. His sexuality does not express love, it expresses lust.. a predatory lust for power over the targeted prey.In the end, Sondra fell in love with his soul, but found that his present incarnated personality was far from the ideal. Still, she needed this experience... and so did he. She needed it to grow-up, to become an adult. He needed it to become aware of his abuse of power and transcend it. Which he still hasn't done to date. Again, more's the pity. Let's hope he does better the next time around.All-in-all, this is a very good book. It's well-written, informative, and an enjoyable read. It's well-worth one's time engaging it.

I bought this book for my son who is an executive with a very lucrative salary, but whose heart is in the kitchen. He caters small parties at present and has had rave reviews of his food and many referrals. He especially wanted to know the basics of cost-analysis and pricing-out his food per person. This book, so he tells me, has been extremely helpful to him in this particular regard as well as informative across-the-board. His confidence in pricing his catering has risen exponentially for, while he's always happy cooking for these soirees, he feels he's now being adequately paid for his services. This book absolutely helped him to achieve his new-found confidence in pricing and has made him even happier to profit properly from his culinary labours of love. Buy with confidence.

I can't say enough about this heated eyelash curler. I love the fact that you can turn it on, and it stays on. I was previously using an Ardell curler, but you had to keep the mechanism depressed at all times otherwise it would turn off. This one is so much better... turn it on, use it, then turn it off.It takes about a minute for the curler to heat-up enough. I curl my naked lashes for 30-seconds, apply Mascara, let that set for another 30-seconds, curl again for 30-seconds, and apply a second coat of Mascara. My lashes look fabulous.I will NEVER be without one of these Le Angelique curlers... I bought a second one as a back-up cuz, dontcha know, just when you find something you like, they discontinue it! Buy it with confidence... you'll be glad you did.

Both my husband and I LOVE these pens. You get lots of ink on the paper... a 'thicker line' is, I guess, the way it should be described. They are comfortable in hand, and the smoothness when applying pressure to paper is flawless. Unfortunately, we can't find these at our local office stores anymore, and are so pleased we can still get them thru Amazon.

While I don't suffer from oiliness, I got this product for those times when I must be absolutely sure my makeup won't budge... like weddings, etc. where many pictures are being taken.The first time I used it, I was attending my niece's high-school graduation. I knew we'd be sitting in the bleachers for two-hours, baking in the sun, and was relieved that the product worked just as described. My makeup was just as perfect as the moment I applied it, holding all through the graduation ceremony and the additional three-hour formal dinner celebration afterwards.I'm sorry that I can't speak to how well this product will work for those who suffer from oily skin. But, for my purposes, it was well-worth what I consider an extravagant price... but, only having to spritz your face a couple of times, it will last me for quite awhile. Buy it with confidence.

My husband finally wore-out his old Birks after something-like 15-years of use, so, I bought him these and he loves them even better. He suffers from flat feet and found the cushioning in these newer Birks even more comfy than his last pair. I got him the Mocha Suede and they're very smart looking. I think they're actually dressier than the leather Birks. He wears a 10-1/2 shoe and I was a little worried about the European-sizing, but got the recommended European 43 and they fit him perfectly. He's extremely happy with these sandals and wears them all the time.We went on vacation to California recently, walking all through Huntington Library and Gardens, Bowers Museum, and Disneyland, and his feet didn't hurt him at all wearing these sandals. I can't recommend them highly enough. Buy them with confidence... you'll be glad you did.

I just love this colour. It's what I would call a medium-pink... not so deep as 'Cherries in the Snow' by Revlon that appears practically 'red', and not so pale or pastel to be a cotton-candy pink either. No, it's got just enough saturation to give a rich, ritzy pink colour that says, 'zowie'! There's no mistaking 'Bachelorette Bash' for anything than a totally pink statement. In fact, I'd actually call it a 'power pink'... it's much more a 'womanly' colour than a 'girly' colour.The polish itself goes on smoothly... and I was surprised by this. I'm so used to Orly polishes, that I wasn't sure how another brand would do. Well, it applies just as well as the Orly. It's not thick and bulky, but thin and wet with a wonderful spread... if that makes any sense to you. LOLI'm was so impressed with this polish that I immediately purchased two more cuz, dontcha know, as soon as you find something you like, they discontinue it. Buy it with confidence... you'll be glad you did.

4.5 StarsThis book is my favorite kind of romance...second chance, military hero, strong heroine, missed opportunity...Logan Park is the haunted soldier and Savannah Hale is the girl he could never have. She belonged to his best friend, who did not return from Afghanistan. He can't compete with a ghost...especially not his friend's. It's a risk that he just can't take.Savannah has returned to Maple Cove, Georgia because of her mother's death. She is trying desperately to hang on to the family Bed & Breakfast. Logan is there to buy it. Well, that's not good circumstances for their reunion. Let the fireworks begin.Logan is everything you could possibly want in a book boyfriend. His ability to keep Savannah on her toes makes you love him that much more. Savannah gives as good as she gets. They are truly a cute couple.Melissa West knows how to spin a romantic tale that will keep you flipping pages as fast as you can. I couldn't wait to see what would happen next with these two. A very entertaining and sweet read. I really enjoyed it. I think you will, too.*An advance reader copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

I adore the All-New Kindle Paperwhite! This purchase was my second one! I keep one at home, one at the office (to read during lunch). I carry my second generation Paperwhite in my purse. This way I'm never without my Kindle Paperwhite. I love the convenience and the features of the All-New Paperwhite. It's the perfect e-reader!

Words I would use to describe this book:  stunning, beautiful, captivating, heart-wrenching, soul-searching, and magnificentthose are a few to start with. I just cant describe how much I loved this book! It had all the things I lovesecond chance romance and Christmas! A Christmas themed amusement park?!? I couldnt wait to get there.This book brings forth a tsunami of emotions! I laughed, I cried, I even laughed and cried at the same time! I LOVE books that make me feel the characterstheir pain, their joy, their sadnessand Maggie McGinnis possesses this ability. She rips your heart right out of your chest, shatters it, and then puts it back together again! An emotional roller coaster ride, if Ive ever been on one.Returning to Echo Lake, Vermont with Josie was like coming home.  You feel like you are a part of the family, and have just been away for a while. It feels good to be back, and reacquainted  a chance to catch up. This is the story of Josie Kendrew and Ethan Miller  and what a story it is! Ethan is CEO of Snowflake Village  the Kendrews family year-round Christmas theme park. Josie is a therapist, residing in Boston. When her father has a stroke, she returns home. There is more for her to face than her fathers illness. Echo Lake harbors many ghosts from Josies past.Maggie McGinnis captivates with Forever This Time. The evolution of Ethan and Josies relationship makes enduring love believable. The story is poignant and heart wrenching. It is a layered, powerful story of love, loss, hope and redemption - a brilliant and epic family drama  it fills the senses...courtesy of the authors amazing narrative. The characters are complicated, flesh and blood real. You relate to them. You feel their pain, their joy, their sorrowFOREVER THIS TIME is a phenomenal book! I highly recommend!*An advance reader copy was generously provided by the publisher, St. Martins Press via NetGalley.

Once again, Scott Hildreth has captivated me! I loved Stevie when I met her in the first book in this series. Getting to know her better and meeting Wilson was an experience I won't forget. Talk about opposites attracting! I know this to be true because my husband and I are total opposites - but not to this extreme! Stevie has got to be the most colorful character I've met in a book thus far - literally and spiritually. She is a beautiful soul with a tough exterior. Wilson should be cloned so we can all have one!I am now of the opinion that if Scott Hildreth writes a phone book, I will be compelled to read it! I highly recommend for those with strong intestinal fortitude, a love of tattoos, smart-mouthed heroines and erotic escapades. I'll never eat another donut without thinking of Stevie and Wilson!

First, let me say that this is a beautifully written book. It is a stunning story. Grab your tissues. You will need them.The emotional intensity and true-to-life characters that jump off the page made this book completely satisfying. Emily March is simply a great storyteller. HEARTSONG COTTAGE is well-written, nicely paced with appealing characters that you want to get to know better. It was intense and full of emotional torment. The array of unfortunate circumstances and secrets make for a riveting read. Fate was not kind to Daniel Garrett and Shannon OToole. Now, there seems to be a light in the endless tunnel that their lives have become. Could there possibly be a second chance to love for these two? I became totally immersed in their story. As we know, anything is possible in Eternity SpringsThe authors descriptions of the small town setting, and the people who reside there and their surroundings is unsurpassed. You feel like you are there. Her writing style is exquisite. You feel what is happening, rather than having it told to you. This book is an exploration of so many things  grief, family dynamics, romance, lies, deception, betrayal and mysterya gripping read - and oftentimes heart-wrenching. Emily March created well-developed characters and an emotion-packed story. The dialogue is easy to read and flows well. I love that the characters were human. They talked, felt and reacted like real people that you know.Set aside some reading time before you pick up this book because it really is hard to put down. You will find yourself thinking about it even when you are not reading it. It kept me riveted to the pages after the introductory chapters. It grabbed me and didnt let go. Emily March ably draws us along to search for the answers right along with the characters. Its a beautiful soul-grabbing storyI highly recommend!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

A southern version of Romeo and Juliette with a happy ending! What could be better than that? As a Shakespeare fan, I loved all the references to the bard's work in the content of the story. Romy Satterfield and Julian McElroy's families do not get along. They have a secret romance and inevitably a secret marriage. Sound familiar?If you read the previous book, The Happy Hour Choir, you met the townsfolk of Ellery, and have already grown to love them. Bittersweet Creek gives you a chance to revisit them and their quirky community. That's a huge bonus.  The creek that divides the property of the Satterfield and McElroy properties is aptly named. The result is the bittersweet romance between their children, Romy and Julian.There are many twists and turns in this story. It is fraught with pain and mystery. I very much enjoyed the journey - and the destination. I think you will, too. I highly recommend Bittersweet Creek. Get to know these people. You won't regret it.*An advance reader copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

I made a decision after reading this book. If Sarah Castille writes it, I'm reading it. She's a 1-click author for me! If it's about the Sinner's Tribe Motorcycle Club, SO much the better! I love these guys, and I love this series. Each book is as good as the last one - if not better. There are no cliff hangers. Each book is about a different couple, while still keeping up with past characters - my favorite kind of series!Zane "Tracker" Colton and Evie were a pair to be reckoned with. Friends since they were nine years old, they developed romantic feelings for each other when Evie was just finishing high school. You never forget your first love. This was true for both of them. Due to circumstances beyond their control, they were separated and didn't see each other for years. Evie waited for Zane to return for her. She felt he had abandoned her, so after three years she moved on with her life. Hind-sight is 20/20.In the two previous books, Zane made reference several times to his reason for avoiding relationships, stating "women will rip your heart out, rub it in salt, and then stomp on it.' His brothers all knew that someone had done a number on Zane. Turns out he was referring to Evie. Now, here she is - and guess what? She's dating the president of their most hated rivals. This is a total mess!Sarah Castille has the ability to grab you by the throat at the beginning of her books, and hold on until the end. The characters are real. I found myself laughing out loud several times while reading this story. The banter between the characters is downright funny. You fall in love with each and every one of them - even though they are all so different.I thoroughly enjoyed getting to know Zane and Evie and following their journey back to finding each other. I know you will, too! I highly recommend.

I loved reading the book from Christian's point of view. It made some of his actions more understandable and really revealed how confused he was about the relationship with Anastasia and his feelings for her. I hope E.L. James does the other two books from his point of view, as well - especially the second book, which was my favorite in the series. I felt it was definitely worth the read.

I LOVED THIS BOOK! I hate cliffhangers, and yes, this book has one - but knowing that the rest of the story is following shortly, is a relief. Now I can take a short break to digest the story and get ready for the conclusion. As this is not a serial or short story, you do not feel manipulated or cheated. It feels like the author has taken the time to fully develop and flesh-out the characters - even though they remain a mystery to the end - you are getting to know them slowly, as they are getting to know each other. Each character has a story to tell and it keeps you riveted.Annie and Dylan are an unlikely pairing, but as their story develops, you see a lot of parallels. Their chance encounter has lasting consequences - both good and bad - for both of them. The fact that they got to know each other and developed feelings before ever physically meeting each other was fascinating. Dylan's loneliness reverberated throughout the book, and made my heart hurt. This is not your typical romance.(Yes, there are plenty of hot, sexy, steamy moments). You feel like you are living in the story. M. O'Keefe is a masterful, talented author!I highly recommend as I impatiently wait for the rest of the story (coming next month)!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.

I have been looking for the perfect purse/travel bag, and this was it! Be aware that this is a BIG bag! It's not going to slide under the seat in front of you on an airplane. It definitely has to go in overhead storage. It is the perfect size for taking essentials on short trips. You can put the larger tablets inside with room to spare. It is attractive and has lots of little slots to stow smaller objects that you don't want to lose in your bag. It seems to be very durable. I look forward to getting lots of use from my London Fog Phoebe Tote Shoulder Bag.

Read this book description (if you can take your eyes off the cover). It says it all! I LOVE military romance stories! This one definitely does NOT disappoint, and has a fresh and new plot-line that keeps you turning the pages just to find out what will happen next. Neve James is a dancer. She has been a pen pal to Rory McRoy for months. When he is on leave from his deployment in Afghanistan, she decides to surprise him when he arrives in Boston  but she is the one who gets a surprise. It seems that Rorys fianc is there as well! Oops! I guess he forgot to mention that during all those heartfelt letters...Rory has to return to Afghanistan before he has a chance to fix things between them. He is determined to set things straight with Neve, so after four agonizing months, hes going to New York to prove to her that he is not the man she thinks he is. He does not give up easily, and this is a war he is determined to win.ALL I NEED IS YOU by Wendy S. Marcus is romance at its finest. I dont have the words to describe how much I LOVED this story. I did not want it to end. Rory McRoy and Neve James have an explosive relationship that kept me on the edge of my seat throughout. This author is unsurpassed at writing page after page of hot, sweet, humorous banter between her characters that keep you glued to the pages. Neve definitely kept Rory on his toes. I couldnt get this story off my mind after I finished it. Rory and Neves intense connection and fiercely passionate romance will keep you hooked. It is an excellent read that I simply could not put down.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

4.5 StarsCelebrate Christmas on Sanctuary Island, where the love light gleams. There will be snow and mistletoe...and two lonely hearts yearning for love, family, and above all, home.I love reading Christmas stories when its still hot outside. It puts me in the Christmas shopping mood, and cools me off from the inside out. HOME FOR CHRISTMAS will have that effect on you. It will put you in a Christmas mood no matter when you read it, and who cant love that idea?Libby Leeds is a magazine columnist. She shares heartwarming stories from her perfect life on Sanctuary Island. The problem? She hasnt been to the island since childhood. There is now a wounded war hero returning to the island and Libbys editor insists she cover the story. After all, she knows the island so well no one could be better for the job.Army Ranger Owen Shepard is a sexy single father  now a media hero, who only wants to reconnect with his daughter Caitlin. He has lots of lost time to make up, starting with giving her a Christmas to remember. Thanks to her editor, it is up to Libby to provide a perfect Christmas setting for Owen and his daughter at her fictional home on Sanctuary Island. Hmmwhat to do?This is a sweet read about a second chance at love, but there is also a story here. Both characters have demons to fight to get to their HEA. The best part was getting to return to Sanctuary Island! I LOVE this place. Home for Christmas gave me all the good feels. Romantic and poignant, the journey of love and acceptance lingers long after the book is closed. It is beautifully written and sweetly emotional. I loved it! Fresh, sexy, and romantic, this book will leave you wanting more. I didnt want to leaveand there is just something magical about a kiss under the mistletoe!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

This is the 6th book in the outstanding Caribou Crossing series by Susan Fox and it is simply stunning! As the book description proclaims, this is a spell-binding tale of romance and healing. The author, Susan Fox is herself an artist, in the way her words paint the picture of this story and the setting. This family drama, filled with past horrors and possible salvation, tugs at the heartstrings. LOVE SOMEBODY LIKE YOU was an incredibly memorable story and I know it's going to linger with me for a while.Sally Ryland is focused on her business and wrestling with the ghosts that haunt her. Ben Traynor, a sexy rodeo rider has always been attracted to Sally, but didnt move fast enough. Now that he has returned to the ranch to recover from an injury keeping him from his next rodeo, he has the perfect excuse to right past wrongs and explore possibilities with Sally. The characters are intense, the situations and topics even more so.This heartbreakingly beautiful story is one to keep and read again.  LOVE SOMEBODY LIKE YOU is touching, and poignant. To say I loved this book is an understatement. From the first page to the last, Susan Fox had me spellbound and lost in her beautiful, heartfelt, writing. I didnt want it to end. I didnt want to leave Caribou Crossing or these characters..If you want a beautifully told romantic story about loving, losing, healing and in the process, finding yourself, then be sure to read this story.  I guarantee you won't be disappointed.*An advance readers copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley for an honest review.

What do you get when you put a beautiful female firefighter and a mayor that is up for re-election together? Fireworks! PLAYING WITH FIRE is a sexy and fun, drama-filled romance. Alexandra Dempsey and Eli Cooper are electric. Whenever they are together, there are sparks flying. They are drawn together like magnets, but falling in love could be deadly for them both. He is her boss, after all. Just because she saved him, doesnt mean she should save his campaign, but that seems to be whats happening. This is a hot sexy romance with plenty of chemistry and intensity. You wont want to put it down until it comes to its satisfying conclusion.This is the second book in the Hot in Chicago series by Kate Meader. The author grabs you from the first page and pulls you in. The writing style is crisp and descriptive. You are right there with the characters. The secondary characters add much to the enjoyment of the story. They captivate and titillate. Its not all romance, though. There is family drama, fun and sexy banter, and rules to be broken.You will love, love, love the secondary characters! Of course they are setting us up for their future stories in the series, but that is fine. They add so much to the story that you cant imagine life without them. You will be hooked and impatiently waiting to spend more time with them. They have no respect for personal space, which makes them more endearing than they already are. They are a team. They are a family.This series has gripped me from the beginning. Eli Cooper is the match that strikes the fire in Alexs soul (and body). The chemistry between the two of them is scorching hot. I kept expecting my Kindle to start smoking. Be sure you are well rested before you start this book. It WILL keep you up into the wee hours. I look forward to reading more of this series in the future.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

This is the third book in the K2 Team novels and let me just say, I LOVE THIS SERIES! This book is about Jamie "Saint" Turner and Sugar Darling. He is a serious soul. He doesnt curse, drink or smoke. He seldom, if ever, smiles. He has demons from the past that are keeping him from living a normal life. He functions, but is not really living. That is how it should be. That is what he deserves.Sugar Darling is filling in as receptionist at K2 Security for two weeks. She is the polar opposite of everything that Jamie looks for in a woman. He has recently started looking for someone to settle down with. Someone that could be the mother to his children. Someone, prim, proper anddare I say, boring? So why is he inexplicably drawn to this woman who is totally inappropriate and opposite of everything he wants. Like a moth to a flame, even though he knows she is dangerous to him, he cant seem to stay away from her.There is much more to Sugar Darling than meets the eye. Something is stirring under the surface. There is more there than what she projects with her ditzy dumb blond persona. What is she hiding? Why does Jamie feel this innate and overwhelming desire to protect her?There are interesting plot twists and drama in this book. I found it impossible to put down. I just had to keep turning those pagesso I pretty much lost a day while I was immersed in this story. There is a LOT of plot development in this book  in the form of drama, mystery, intrigue, suspense, disquiet and upheaval. After all theyve been through, Jamie and Sugar certainly deserve a happily ever after. They still have demons to fight, but their love holds strong.An intriguing exploration of love and redemption, FALLING FOR HER is captivating and passionate. You wont be disappointed in this volume of the series. Grab a drink and find a comfortable place to sit, because you wont want to get up!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

To say that I loved this book is an understatement! Scott Hildreth is my new favorite author! I am reading everything he has written. BLURRED LINES is not a typical romance. Blake West is a complicated mess! That is all I'll say about that. With that said, you will fall in love with him. He is an enigma wrapped in a mystery. Riley Campbell has no idea what she's getting into when she decides to get her first tattoo. Stepping through the doors of the Blurred Lines tattoo shop was almost like stepping through the looking glass. WOW! What an emotional roller coaster ride it was!All I can say is, READ THIS BOOK! It is one you won't forget! Thanks for another great read, Scott Hildreth! You never disappoint!

This book is a suspenseful romantic drama with a cliff-hanger ending. The story of Madrigal and Trenton draws you in from the beginning. There is definitely a May to December element going on, but I finally managed to get past that and was immersed in the storyline. The plot is interesting and holds your attention from beginning to end - and leaves you wanting more. There are some loose ends that I assume will be tied up in the next book.SHATTERED VIRTUE is a good start to a promising new series. I look forward to "the rest of the story."*An advance review copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

Kate Regnery has very quickly become one of my favorite authors. I have loved every book she has written, and CRAZY ABOUT CAMERON is no exception. I love her ability to build a relationship between the characters that is believably paced and always realistic. You can literally feel the chemistry between Cam and Meggie as they are pulled deeper and deeper into a passionate romantic relationship..Every book in the Blueberry Lane series is a delicious and delightful read that you don't want to leave when it ends. There is definitely enough "naughty" to make it nice. Cameron Winslow is a hot and sexy panty-melting alpha-male with a sweet side. There is nothing better than a macho man that can be gentle. Ms. Regnery has perfected the genre! Each book seems to be better than the last. How is that even possible?CRAZY ABOUT CAMERON was a winner in my playbook. I highly recommend!*A review copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley.

4.5 StarsThis book was so much fun to read. Through mixed up numbers and crazy text messages, May Wexler is thrown directly in the path of Ozzie, a hairy guy in a biker bar. Fate must have a hand in this.Elle Casey writes a gripping story, making use of every word. The main characters are well developed. You care about them. You find yourself wanting them to get together from the beginning. Mays Chihuahua is an adorable addition to the story. They are taken with each other almost immediately - SO cute Ozzie is a swoon-worthy heroand he really IS a hero.  Turns out under all that hair he is smokin hot and a total sweetheart. You cant help but fall in love with him.Elle Casey pulls out all the stops in this highly enjoyable, insightful, and funny look at self-sacrifice and romantic entanglement. It is a sweet story that will make you laugh. I really enjoyed it, and highly recommend!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

As a physical therapist thats had her heart broken in the past, Jessica Hart has made a vow to never date a professional athlete. Shes been there and done thatand doesnt want a repeat. Enter Gavin King. Hes an all-star hot and sexy slugger thats been traded to the Sonics because of a knee injury. Now his future is in Jessicas hands  literally. To Gavins credit, hes trying to stay on course to recover and get his old life back. Hes trying to keep his distance from the gorgeous red-headed physical therapist. Hmmthis should be interesting.Baseball! I am a sucker for it. On television or live at the ballpark, it truly is one of my favorite sports. Nothing is better than a sports romance! The characters are believable with just enough baseball and romance thrown in to make it a great read.This story captivated me from the very first page. Once I started, I couldnt put it down. Gavin and Jessicas chemistry is so scorching hot that you cant help wishing for them to get their happily ever after. Katie Rose wrote a home run with THE HEAT OF THE MOMENT. I recommend this book and this series!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

4.5 StarsAlyssa Hampstead is an eighteen year old virgin when sexy cousins Sebastian De Loren and Shane Connor storm into her life. She spent three months of sensual bliss with them before it came to a screeching halt. Eight years have passed, and Alyssa has been living a quiet and safe life. She is the daughter of a senator, and in the political spotlight. She knows that she will never again experience the passion that she had with Sebastian and Shane. When they left, she closed her heart. She never wanted to have and lose that kind of intensity again. She couldnt survive it.There is mystery and intrigue to this story. There are things that you do not discover right awayand sometimes not at all. Alyssa first met the cousins at a party, and there was definitely chemistry between them. Five months later, while vacationing in Spain, she encounters them again and three months of sensual pleasure between the three, ensue. Yes, this is a M/M/F romance. While this is not my normal genre, Lora Leigh made it seem like a natural progression of the story.I liked the suspense and mystery of the plot-line. There was a story that kept you riveted to the pages. Of course there was plenty of hot, steamy romance to satisfy even the most voracious romance reader. Sebastian and Shane were the very epitome of sexy hotness. How lucky can a girl be to have not one, but two alpha men ready to grant your every erotic fantasy? Alyssa was a sassy heroine, and was able to hold her own with the two of them. Too bad that all good things must come to an endor do they?When the cousins come back into her life, they are there to protect her  but the passion between them re-ignites and burns hotter than ever. Whoa! Hang onto your seat! Lora Leigh knows how to grab you with her story, and doesnt let you go! Be sure to set aside plenty of time to finish this book when you start it. Its not one that you can put down and come back to. She knows her way around erotica and M/M/F relationships. She holds your interest from the first chapter until the last. You really hate for the book to end. Keep them coming, Ms. Leigh! I cant wait to see what you do next.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by St. Martins Press and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

4.5 StarsHe's her weapon of choice.What could be better than a new motorcycle club series? I was very excited to get my hands on RIDING DIRTY by Jill Sorenson, the first book in the Dirty Eleven Motorcycle Club Series. It did NOT disappoint!Psychologist Mia Richards wants revenge. Her new client, tattooed Cole "Shank" Shepherd, provides the perfect means. She just has to manipulate the felon-turned-informant into eliminating her husband's killersmembers of Cole's rival motorcycle club. The first step, seducing Cole, is simple. As for walking away before she falls hardit's already too lateI loved Cole Shepherd. I wonder what he might have been if hed been given a chance to reach his potential. His story really makes you stop and think about thatand what a vicious cycle our penal system creates. Prison really is a level of society all its own. Scary when you are confronted with what really goes on. Sadly, its still scary when you get out.I really liked Mia Richards. She was a strong woman on the outside, but embraced her inner vixen better than any heroine Ive read in a long time. I liked that she acknowledged her weaknesses and owned them (even her propensity for peeing her pants under pressure). Ms. Sorenson has written a sizzling romance that is impossible to put down. The chemistry between Cole and Mia is undeniable. It is definitely a hot and deliciously steamy read.This is a raw, gritty, story that keeps you guessing about the outcome. Jill Sorenson does not sugarcoat the life in the Dirty Eleven Motorcycle Club. Her characters are real  and flawed  even the good guys are represented as real people who have their own problems, inner turmoil and demons. I loved that. The secondary characters for the most part were people that you love to hate. I was hooked from the very beginning and was held captive until the end. It was a gripping, emotional and intense roller coaster ride that I didnt want to get off of. Ill be impatiently waiting for the next book in this delicious new series!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

WOW! I am really LOVING Organic Argan Oil! You need to try this just to see how wonderful it feels on your skin. It's hard to describe. It feels like warm silk. I can't attest to it performing miracles...yet! I haven't used it long enough to assess its long-term effects, but I can say that during the two weeks that I have used it, my hands have never felt so soft. I also no longer have bleeding cuticles, which is a real score for me! I have even been putting it on my feet. Such a luxurious treat! The Argan Oil is not heavy - it's light and does not clog up your pores or feel thick and heavy like so many oils do. I am already a fan and will continue to use this product!*Product was provided by the vendor for an honest review. My opinions are strictly my own.

Words I would use to describe this book:  stunning, beautiful, captivating, heart-wrenching, soul-searching, and magnificentthose are a few to start with.This book brings forth a tsunami of emotions! I laughed, I cried, and Im still thinking about it! I LOVE books that make me feel the characterstheir pain, their joy, their sadnessand Lisa Kleypas possesses this ability. She rips your heart right out of your chest, shatters it, and then puts it back together again! An emotional roller coaster ride, if Ive ever been on one.I have to say that Joe Travis is just the most perfect hero youll ever hope to meet.  It takes him no time at all to have Avery Crosslin questioning which end is up? Who can blame her? He IS irresistibleand Averys not very good at resistingbut she wont ever let that happen again! Nope! It will NOT happen EVER!or will it? I dont think she considered meeting a man like Joe Travis when she made that vow.Lisa Kleypas captivates with this installment in her Travis Family series. The evolution of Joe and Averys relationship makes enduring love believable. The story is poignant and heart wrenching. It is a layered, powerful story of love, hope and redemption - a brilliant and epic family drama  it fills the senses...courtesy of the authors amazing narrative. The characters are complicated, flesh and blood real. You relate to them. You feel their pain, their joy, their sorrowBROWN-EYED GIRL is a phenomenal book! Do I recommend it? I absolutely do!*An advance reader copy was generously provided by the publisher for the purpose of an honest review. I was not compensated for this review. All conclusions are my own.

"What wants your attention will always find a way to capture it. This town has magic. I hope you will allow it to feed your soul."Who knew that eating a baguette could be such a sensual experience? I've got to find a French bakery - pronto!THE BILLIONAIRE'S SECRET is the second installment of a sexy new serial by Ava Miles. This one takes place in Paris. Romance is definitely in the air as Margie Lancaster arrives in Paris to begin her baking apprenticeship in the city of love. Finally she and Evan can be together with no boundaries between them. Margie is excited to get to know him on his home turf. With no vows of celibacy or landlord/tenant relationship to hold them back, they have time to really explore their feelings for each other. The chemistry between them seems preordained...a destiny neither of them imagined...but things aren't always what they seem...It is obvious that the author has spent time in Paris, and this adds so much to the story. You feel like you have had a guided tour of the city - not the tourist attractions, but the heart and soul of it...the Paris that the people lucky enough to live there, enjoy and love.Another cliff-hanger has me on the edge of my seat. I kept trying to turn more pages on my Kindle when I got to the end...more, more, MORE! Please? I cannot wait to see what happens next!I received an eBook copy from the publisher for the purpose of an honest review. I was not compensated for this review. All conclusions are my own.

Tracker's End is the third book in the Wind Dragons MC series by Chantal Fernando.  I was SO looking forward to reading Trackers story. He seemed to be "the rogue" of the MC in the two previous books and was my favorite character in the club. He did not disappoint - well maybe a little with his actions and behavior in one particular situation... Tracker has been teasing us in the first two books in the series  and now we finally get to know more about him.Tracker and Lana are a very unlikely combination. You certainly don't expect Anna's friend Lana to be the type of girl you'd see hanging out in a biker club - much less being with one of its biggest players. Hmm...there is a side of Lana that surprises everyone - and in a very erotic way. Who would have guessed?Chantal Fernando can take you inside the biker world and make you feel like you are a part of it - getting to know the characters, understanding their love and devotion to each other, and never wanting to leave them. She does not sugar-coat - there are raw and intense emotions and page-turning suspenseful situations. There are instances when the characters behave badly and you want to shake them - but not too many! The sex scenes are smokin' hot and let's just say that Tracker has a VERY active libido! This book is gritty, raw, and incredibly sexy.I strongly recommend this series to those that crave their bad-boy bikers and the women who love them. You will NOT be disappointed. I can't wait to hang out with them again.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

4.5 StarsMinnesota Glaciers starting defense man Henrik Grenick is good at two things: hockey and sex. Hes got it allthe career, the biceps, the babes. But the steady parade of women through his bedroom just leaves him wanting more, hunting for the next distraction. Until he meets Jacqui, who awakens a hunger he never knew he craved.That intro says it all. The first paragraph of the book description made me want to read this book. I love it when a playboy meets his match. Henrik Grenick is definitely a hotttie. I dont know how in the world he could play hockey without literally melting the ice! Whew!Jacqui Polson is a very strong heroine. Both she and Henrik are fiercely independent and have never needed anyone to make them feel completeuntil they meet each other. Now all the rules of the game have changed! I cant say that Jacqui is my favorite heroine in the series, but I didnt hate her. As her character develops, you come to understand her a little better  and why she acts the way she does.Let me just say that I LOVE Henrik! There were so many contradictions with that man. He was complex with a side of vulnerable. It turns out thats the perfect combination. Lynda Aicher has a talent for writing real characters that you enjoy getting to know, and you definitely have a difficult time leaving. This book is no exception. It is the third book in the Power Play Book series, and as its predecessors, it does not disappoint. Lynda Aicher is a very talented author who manages to keep each book fresh and exciting to read. She held my interest and kept the pages turning throughout the story. Im looking forward to meeting the next player in this very intriguing series.  Ill definitely be back to catch up with the Minnesota Glaciers!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

"The city's famous lights obscured the galaxies beyond Earth almost as if Paris were a woman who could not stand the competition to her beauty."The Billionaire's Gamble by Ava Miles is an epicurean delight. It is the beginning of a 4-part serial featuring residents of Dare Valley. What makes this one special and fun is that it takes place in two locations - Dare Valley and Paris, France - a te dit?!Evan Michaels is a self-made billionaire inventor living in Paris, France. He loses a bet with Rhett Butler Blaylock when he and Jane are there gambling. He must live in the small town of Dare Valley as a "normal" guy, on a small budget for one month - AND to mend his playboy ways - NO relationships during that time. Can he do it? Sure he can! No problem! Well, not until he meets his new landlady, the delectable Margie Lancaster. Uh-oh! How will he navigate this minefield? Living in the same house for a month with this beautiful woman will test his will like nothing has before. Meet Evan Murphy, wandering artist on sabbatical for a month.Ava Miles never fails to delight with her crisp, well-paced, descriptive style of writing. She does not tell you a story - she shows you the story - as if you are right there in the middle of it - living it through her characters. They become real as you read her words. I feel like I know all of the residents of Dare Valley. They are like family members and old friends. The Billionaire's Gamble is no different. It is a delightful and enchanting start to what promises to be a wonderful story. Ava lets you know up front that there is a cliff-hanger ending, so that you can be prepared. I can't wait to read the next installment of Evan and Margie's journey. Is that cinnamon rolls I smell?*I received an eBook copy from the publisher for the purpose of an honest review. I was not compensated for this review: all conclusions are my own.

I LOVE anything to do with New Orleans, and anything about motorcycle clubs - so this was definitely the book for me. Let me just say that his book is HOT, HOT, HOT  as in VERY erotic! I think my Kindle is still smoking. Ajax is my new favorite MC bad-boy. This is the first book in a new series, so there is more goodness coming our way!Megan Crane has the most unique writing style. Its like reading erotic, sexy, raw, gritty, dirty poetry. You just have to read this book to understand what Im trying to express  but she has an amazing way of character expression. They are real, they are raw, and they are laugh out loud funny at times.Ajax and Sophie were a fun couple to get to know and getting to hang out in New Orleans was icing on the cake. The development of their relationship was hard for both of them. Neither of them wanted it, but there was no stopping it  definitely a runaway train! There is not a lot of dialog between the characters. Their relationship is physical. I guess bad-boy alpha bikers dont do a lot of talking. That would make them house cats. There is quite a bit of inner dialog going on with them. There were secondary characters in the story, but they were not the focus. There was also an underlying mystery about the club and the death its president that were not solved in this book  merely mentioned. Im hoping we will get more details in forthcoming books.MAKE YOU BURN is an engaging story about loss and love. The writing is crisp and well-paced  a raw story about overcoming your demons and opening yourself up to love. I devoured it in one day, and had a huge book hangover.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

4.5 StarsFantasy is not my usual genre, but something about the description of this book, just pulled at me. I had to read it. I am so glad that I did. It is a magical story  a gothic romance with elements of magic sprinkled throughout, make LAMP BLACK, WOLF GREY an enchanting reading experience.Artist Laura Matthews and her husband Dan have given up city life to move to an ancient longhouse, high in the Welsh Mountains. It is a place of tales and legends, myths and fables. She is hoping that the beauty surrounding her will inspire her to produce her best art yet, and will give them the chance to have they baby they have both longed for.There are so many magical characters in this tale. You just cant wait to peek around a tree to discover who you might meet next. The mystery and intrigue of all of these elements keep the pages turning at a rapid pace. There are two stories that converge to make this book have a fairytale quality that I loved.  It goes past to present as the tale progresses. In the past, Megan loves Merlin and in the present, Laura loves Dan. If I say more, it will sound confusing, so I will stop, and encourage you to read the book. It is magical and mystical.Paula Brackston delights with her unique writing style. The story is poignant and heartwarming  it fills the senses...courtesy of Ms. Brackstons amazing narrative. Reading her words is an experience all its own. The characters are complicated. You relate to them on some levels. You feel their pain, their joy, their sorrowI highly recommend LAMP BLACK, WOLF GREY. Its charming, enchanting - and not to be missed!*I received an eBook copy from the publisher for the purpose of an honest review. I was not compensated for this review: all conclusions are my own.

First, let me say, I LOVE this series! I cannot wait for each book! I have been looking forward to Bretts story. I was kind of feeling bad for him in Plain Jayne and was hoping for a book about him. Who can resist a man in uniform? Apparently Ellie Palmer can. Him pulling her over doesnt make her feel the love, eitherand this isnt the first time! Now she has to take a safe-driving course with him. Let the fun begin and the sparks fly!This was a cute book, but also had an interesting plot line that moved at a good pace and kept you turning the pages. Of course theres plenty of angst in the story of Brett and Ellie. I kept wanting to flip to the back to find out what happens! I didnt  but I wanted to! Ellie was a fun character in the previous books  very feisty and opinionated. Shes really a perfect match for Brett. I love it when opposites get together! Ellie finds out that there is more to Brett than you might thinkI mean besides his rock hard body and commanding presence. Whew!This was a fun read! It was also extremely entertaining with an interesting plot that moved at a fast pace. Throw in some sexy romance and you have a book that cant be missed. I highly recommend you pick this one up!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.
If you have not listened to this song, it is a MUST! SO cute. I guarantee you'll find yourself singing it throughout the day. It's my new favorite! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

I was listening to one of my favorite Tammy Wynette songs on YouTube when I say this one in the line-up. I'd never heard it before, and I thought I'd listened to every song Tammy ever sang! I LOVED it and had to have it. Rest in peace, Tammy - your voice lives on!

4.5 StarsCammie Laroux has returned to her home in Alabama to help out after her mother has back surgery. Since she is between jobs and because she has wicked chef and organizational skills, she is the perfect candidate to help get the family catering and event venue business, Evangeline House, back to its former glory. She does not know that on this mission of mercy she will be slapped in the face with her devastating past.Grey Harrison broke Cammies heart ten years ago, and she has just recently put her life back together, gotten engaged and put the past in her review mirror. On her first day home, she is face to face with Grey. He has been hired by her mother to renovate the declining family home. Will she be able to hold it all together and face the past that she has spent ten years running from? The result of his betrayal with her best friend is standing right in front of her in the form of his daughter, Samantha. How is she supposed to deal with this? Why should she have to?I am a sucker for second chance romance. I love the angst that goes with past misunderstandings and righting the wrongs from bygone days  especially when the protagonists are older and wiser. That is the case with AGAIN, ALABAMA  but the betrayal by Grey was hard for me to accept at the beginning of the book. I HATE cheating  for whatever perceived excuse, so I spent the first half of the book not feeling the love for Grey. Cammie has enough going on in her life right now. She should not have to have to deal with this. She is engaged to Jason and is moving on with her lifeor is she?The story of Grey Harrison and Cammie Laroux is heart wrenching and poignant. After finishing this book days ago, Im still thinking about the story. I loved the opportunity to meet Cammies family. The secondary characters are so much fun. They make the reader feel like you are there and a part of the family.Cammie and Grey both have very real issues that make it hard for them to pursue a relationship. The chemistry between them is strong, but the obstacles seem to be stronger. Cammie is a very engaging heroine. I also loved her siblings. They were so loving and protective. I hope they get their own stories someday.Susan Sands writing style is powerful. She pulls you into the story, and doesnt let go until the last wordactually, not even then. You will still be feeling it days after the story ends. AGAIN, ALABAMA is a heartwarming story of family and a second chance at love. It was a sweet narrative of love and loss and loving again. I liked it  and recommend!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

Kristen Ashley has been one of my top five authors for a long time, and that status never changes. With that said, I have to say that she surprised me with this book. DEACON definitely takes things a step further into erotic, no-holds-barred sexual exploration between the characters. Of course she does it in her "KA way" and it works! Oh, Deacon! I think he is by far the most broken man I've come across in quite some time.Cassidy Swallow has got to be my favorite heroine - bar none! I usually find the heroine to be the weakest link in most stories, but that was not the case in this book. She was strong, she was funny, and most important to Deacon, loyal and forgiving. Their relationship was l-o-o-o-o-ng in developing, but when it did - my Kindle started smoking! WOW! That's all I can say about that!Nobody writes an ALPHA macho male better than Kristen Ashley! Don't miss this one - but remember, it's not for the weak at heart. VERY explicit, hot and sexy.

Im working through the guilt. Guilt that Gina died and I didnt. Guilt she didnt have her seat belt on and I did. Guilt I didnt take a different route home. Guilt I didnt get the chance to tell her one more time that I loved her before she diedSawyer Bennett introduces a deeply emotional contemporary romance with ZACK, the third book in the Carolina Cold Fury Hockey series. Punctuated by heart-wrenching dialogue and fascinating glimpses into the tough world of hockey, this romance also delivers true heart and emotion, and a story that will stay with the reader long after the final page is turned.Kate Francis is so easy to relate to. College girl, working on her masters degree, struggling financially, the job as nanny to Zack Granthams son, Ben, is a solution to her own situation, as well as providing the support that Ben and Zack need to carry on. The secondary characters were fun to get to revisit  especially Zacks fellow team members and friends. They were loyal and supportive during a difficult time in Zacks life.Let me just say that I LOVE ZACK! There were so many contradictions with that man. He was complex with a side of vulnerable. It turns out thats the perfect combination. Sawyer Bennett has a talent for writing real characters that you enjoy getting to know, and you definitely have a difficult time leaving. This book is no exception. I look forward to reading the next book in the series. I just cant seem to get enough of the Cold Fury hockey team, and the ones they love. I think this was my favorite book so far. They just keep getting better.*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

Now is the perfect time to read LOVE ON A SPRING MORNING by Zoe York. Its a perfect time to return to Pine Harbour  a place you look forward to returning to  and a place you will never want to leave. This is the third book in the series, and author Zoe York does not disappoint in delivering everything you could possibly want in a great romance.Ryan Howard is just trying to hang on after losing his wife. His focus is his children. He is completely unconcerned about the movie being filmed in Pine Harbour. The only good thing about it is Holly Cresinski, an intern working on the set. He enjoys conversations with her  shes down to earth and easy to talk to. He enjoys the distraction she provides. He is not looking for a relationship. Sometimes things happen unexpectedly. What Ryan doesnt know is that Holly Cresinski  is really Hope Creswell  star of the movie. Let the deception beginwhen Ryan finds out who she really is, what will his reaction be?There are twists and turns, angst and intense and heart-wrenching moments that keep you riveted. Those who have dealt with death and grief will identify with Ryan and how he handles his emotions. I loved the interaction between Ryan and his kids. He is such a good dad in the worst of circumstances.This book grabbed my heart from the beginning and refused to let go. I fell in love with Ryan and Holly. They are real. Zoe York has the ability to make her characters live and breathe. You want to know them. They were both broken, but found a way to heal each other and rid themselves of guilt. They risked hurt to find true love and overcome their fears. The sexual tension crackles off the page. The love that unfolds is tender and beautiful  a romance that goes straight to your heart. Im still smiling.It is a stunning contemporary romance. It will break your heartbut in a very good way. If you want a beautifully told romantic story about loving, losing, healing and in the process, finding yourself, then be sure to read this story. I guarantee you wont be disappointed. I LOVED the first two books in the series, and the goodness just keeps on coming! I highly recommend!
So much fun and easy mind exercise!

I admit that I had a little self-preservation in mind when I decided to try this product. My husband has always had a beard, so I'm accustomed to whisker burn - but lately his beard seemed rougher than normal. Since there's significantly more grey in his beard these days, I attribute it to that. I thought he would be the perfect candidate to try Mr. Rugged Bold Beard Lotion Conditioner. I LOVE that name by the way! No reason for him not to feel like a "macho man" while he conditions his beard!In all seriousness, this is a great product. It does exactly what it says it does. My husband's beard is significantly softer and just looks better. He says it feels better and is less "itchy" - which I think is caused by the dry skin underneath. I highly recommend this product! It works!*Product was provided by the vendor for an honest and unbiased review. My opinion is my own.

4.5 StarsSarah Castille introduces a deeply emotional, raw and gritty motorcycle club experience with BEYOND THE CUT. Punctuated by blistering-hot sex scenes and fascinating glimpses into the tough world of motorcycle club life, this romance also delivers true heart and emotion, and a story that will stay with the reader long after the final page is turned.Let me just say that I LOVE Cade "Ryder" O'Connor! There were so many contradictions with that man. He was all HOT alpha male with a side of vulnerable. It turns out thats the perfect combination. Cade is a traveling man, never one to settle down with one woman for more time than absolutely necessary. But Cade has faced his own demons, and he's learned a lot about himself, and about the life he knows he's meant to live. He has commitment issues and is very clear and honest about it to his women. In other words he doesn't lead them on.Cade is a study in accepting people for who they are. Although I may not have agreed with the way he decided to live his life and his approach to relationships, when you find out his story you can completely understand why he is the way he is and that if Dawn Delgado had handled him in any other way things would not have been able to work between them. I just love a tough, brooding sexy as sin, heart-melting alpha male like Cade. Dawn is a strong heroine  which makes the sparks fly!The secondary characters were fun to get to know  especially Cades friends in the Sinners Tribe Motorcycle Club. Who doesnt like to hang out with a bunch of outlaw alpha bad boys? Sarah Castille is a very talented author. Her characters are real  you feel them. You are in the story all the way, from beginning to end.  It was a raw, steamy, sexy, haunting and a powerful romantic roller coaster ride. I LOVED this riveting story. This was one hot book packed with action, suspense and passion that burns through each chapter between these two. Sarah Castille definitely has an automatic reader with this reviewer. I like her style!  I consider this one a must read. You wont be sorry, and you wont forget it. I highly recommend!*An advance reading copy was generously provided by the publisher and NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

This  beautiful ceramic utensil holder and caddy is both decorative and functional.  Each canister is beautifully painted with autumn colors.  The containers have a raised, embossed design and is fire glazed.  They nestle neatly into a wrought iron caddy.  This is old world design with a modern twist.The containers are not only nice enough to leave on your counter with your cooking utensils but it makes a great addition to your buffet table.  It will keep your cutlery organized and also add a pop of color to your serving table.  I plan to use this for my Holiday dinners and parties.  This set of three come nicely packaged which makes it ideal for gifting as well.I received the containers at a discount for testing, evaluation and review.  Based on my experience with the product, I would definitely recommend it.  It is a beautiful addition to my kitchen, is multi functional and priced right, so I will probably order again for a gift.

The ESK Collection Set of 6 Bamboo Kitchen Tools consist of three types of spoons and 3 spatulas.  I like this set because I can use them on my nonstick cookware.  Prior to getting these, I used plastic or silicone and wondered if any pvcs were leaking into our food.  The wood is elegant and looks good on my counter where I keep them in a utensil caddy for easy access.  Another reason why I prefer the wooden utensils is that we have well water which seems to discolor any metallic pieces.  As far as this particular set goes, I did feels some rough spots as indicated by another reviewer but can easily be sanded or some steel wool should take care of it.  The known durability of bamboo assures me that these will last a long time.  This is a great price for a 6 piece set.I received the kitchen tools for testing, evaluation and unbiased review.  Based on my personal experience, I am giving 4 stars.  I really do like them and think they are gorgeous.  Had it not been for the small splinter I got while removing them from their bag, it would have been 5 stars.

In todays world, we are dealing with a new kind of thieves; electronic pickpockets!  They can steal your identity as well as credit cards and bank accounts.  This type of thievery is the worst kind and can ruin you personally and financially.  There are several ways to protect ourselves and the RFID blocking money belt and neck stash wallet from Dromedar, provides an affordable functional way to do that.I defy any pickpocket to get my valuables while wearing the hidden money belt or neck stash wallet. The money belt and wallet are designed to wear under your clothing to conceal your belongings. It is made of thin but durable parachute material and has a soft mesh backing which would go against your skin. It is very comfortable with an adjustable elastic belt and easy closure. Of course you can also wear it outside your clothing as a fanny pack but then you would be defeating its true purpose.The zippered compartments can keep your money and checks separate from you documents such as ID and passport in addition to a couple of smaller pockets, with RFID blocking technology, for credit cards. When I travel, there are certain things that I dont want to leave in my room, like cash and passport. I still keep a purse with me when sightseeing but it only has a small amount of cash or what I know I need for the excursion because lets face it, you wouldnt want to raise your shirt every time you want to get at your money.I received the money belt and neck wallet at a discount from Dromedar for testing, evaluation and unbiased review. Based on my experience, I would definitely recommend this product. This value pack included both money belt and neck wallet and as an added bonus a nice silver toned money clip.  They are both well designed to be thin and lightweight to remain hidden under your clothing.  Both under garments are very comfortable, affordable and last but not least, protects my identity and valuables from thieves.

The polarized sporty sunglasses, with 5 interchangeable lenses from Ponosoon is the most versatile, uniquely cool pair of sunglasses that I have ever seen or had.  The uni-lenses come in a variety of rainbow colors and also includes a clear one.  Thats right, a single lens for two eyes!  They remind me of ski glasses except they are much more stylish.  They are great for cycling, they keep the sun and glare out of your eyes, protect your eyes from wind and debris as well as giving you a little swag.I have had several pairs of sunglasses from this company and have not been disappointed by any of them.  I think they out did themselves with this particular design.  These are my favorite.  They come in a very nice hard case with zipper closure and belt hook.  Inside the foam lined case is the glasses and the extra lenses, along with a cleaning cloth and soft drawstring pouch for easy transport.  The quality of the sunglasses is quite evident in the detail and accessories.  Another nice feature is that they can be comfortably worn by both male and female.  There are several colors available for the frames.  I have the white with red accent.  They go great with almost everything.  They are curved to block peripheral sunlight and are quite comfortable, hugging the contour of my face.  I had thought about giving these as a Christmas gift but I dont think I can part with them.I was given the glasses by Ponosoon for the purpose of testing, evaluation and review.  Based on my personal experience, I would definitely recommend them.  I have not worn them for sports yet, however I did wear them to a soccer game and was the envy of some of the moms.  I have also worn them in the car when driver and they do a great job blocking out that blinding sun glare when you are driving into a sunset. I definitely recommend them.  They are priced right and would make a great gift.

The small wireless FM transmitter from Kollea works remarkably well.  I can tune into my favorite Amazon Music album and play it through my car stereo.  It is like having a free subscription to Sirius radio.  This is a great little device because you not only can play music through your car radio but through any radio.  Back in my party days, we would bring our music to a party or friends house in the form of a cassette tape.  Now, your music is all accessible from your smart phone and this little gadget helps you to broadcast it.The sound, is crystal clear, however it did take some patience and trial to get the right frequency but now that I have it, I am quite pleased with the results.  As an added bonus, I can talk on the phone thorough my cars speaker.  I long drives, it kind of makes me feel like I am not alone.  Even when I am not talking, I am listening to all my favorite songs.  As far as the device, I dont have anything to compare it to since I have never had anything like this before but I can tell you that it does everything that it says, is easy to use, small enough to carry in your pocket.I was given the Kollea wireless transmitter for testing, evaluation and unbiased review.  Based on my personal experience with the transmitter, I would definitely recommend it.  It is a marvelous little device.  It is packaged nicely which also makes it giftable.  I dont know anyone that would not appreciate getting a gift of technology such as the Kollea FM wireless transmitter.

The Eco Friendly stretch lids from Kitchen Genius are just that.genius!  The 6 silicone covers can stretch to fit a variety of sizes.  These are very convenient to use instead of plastic wrap which also saves money since they are washable and reusable.  I also like the fact that I dont have to transfer my leftovers into plastic containers.  I can never find the right lid for the right container and when I open my cupboard where I store the containers, they tumble out in disarray.  These covers on the other hand can be used right over the serving bowl or dish and creates a good tight seal.  They are soft and collapsible so they take up very little space.  These silicone food and bowl covers are clear so you can see what is inside without removing the cover.  Included with the set are two pretty blue, bonus suction lids which actually are my favorite!  They can be used over a drink in the fridge or on a mug.  They are great when heating soup in the microwave to prevent spatter.  The lids are FDA approved and can be used in the freezer and are dishwasher safe.I received a discount on these lids so that I can test, evaluate and give an unbiased review.  Based on my personal experience with them, I would recommend them.  Granted, they are not for everyone because there is some wrestling and getting used to them as one other reviewer put it, but once you get a feel for which lids fit on what containers, then you have it made.  I like them!  I think that they are a marvelous addition to my kitchen toolbox.  You can save money on wraps and reduce your carbon footprint!

There are three potent active ingredients in this all natural remedy.  Fish Oil which is known for joint lubrication as well as heart health, cats claw root which is popular for an array of illnesses.  It is an anti-inflammatory which help with arthritis.  It is also good for the digestive system and has anti-cancer properties.  I actually had not heard of it before getting these joint supplements for my dog.  I researched it before administering it to her and was surprised at all the ailments that cats claw root is said to alleviate.  The third active ingredient is Willow bark, sometimes called natures aspirin.  It is used to treat pain, inflammation, and musculoskeletal conditions.  So there you have it, three all natural ingredients combined to provide pain relief and repair of sore arthritic joints.I had been giving my 15 year old Labrador retriever, Glucosamine tablets as well as a popular prescription canine anti-inflammatory tablet for her arthritis and pain.  It helps with one ailment and causes other issues like upset stomach and diarrhea.  I was so happy to come across this natural alternative.
