I had no problems pushing the top of the little guy onto the pants for a secure seal. The guys arms fit well on my smaller cup and it allowed the pants to sit low in the hot water. I tried my bigger Starbucks mug at first and the pants didn't sink as low in the water, so I didn't feel that it infused as well as it did in my smaller cup. I also noticed that some of the smaller tea leaves escaped into my water, so I try to use longer tea leaves, if I can. There weren't a whole lot, so it didn't really bother me. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy this infuser was to clean. I was able to discard most of the tea leaves into the trash with no problems. I thought for sure they would get stuck in the legs, but that didn't happen. I was then able to rinse the rest out in the sink. These little guys would make a great gift for tea lovers. I received these infusers at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

These non-stick silicone baking mats work very well. I really like the size (16.6" x 11") because they fit well on my baking sheets. I also like how thick they are. They feel very well made and durable. I have used these mats to cook chicken wings, French fries, pork chops, and cookies. Everything bakes very evenly. My cookies don't burn on the bottoms. It's nice not have to use aluminum foil all of the time to line my baking sheets or to have to spray them with cooking spray. I love that the mats don't absorb any flavors and that nothing sticks to them. They are easy to clean and they don't stain. I store mine rolled up in a rubber band, but they stay flat as soon as I lay them on the cookie sheets.  I received these mats in exchange for my honest review.

I have always loved the taste of matcha green tea in smoothies, so I was excited to be able to make them on my own with this powder. I like that this powder is 100% pure organic matcha tea. I know exactly what I am putting in my body. I was happy to see that this powder contains over 1300 antioxidants which is even more than what is in a cup of green tea. I have never liked drinking hot tea, so I am glad that I can get my antioxidants using this in a cold drink. My favorite way to use this powder, is in my protein shake. I mix protein powder, almond milk, and a teaspoon of this powder in my blender bottle. I do have to shake it quite a few times to get the powder to fully mix in and not have any lumps. The taste is amazing and totally worth it though. This powder doesn't have any sweeteners in it, so I would not recommend drinking it on its own unless you are okay with a more bitter taste. It's perfect for adding that green tea taste to smoothies, lattes, or protein shakes though. I like the energy that this powder gives me without giving me the jitters which I tend to experience if I have too much caffeine. I am looking forward to seeing if I experience any weight loss after using it for a while longer. I received this matcha green tea powder at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I love this weather station. I have been using a different indoor/outdoor temperature monitor, but it is not as near as nice as this one. This one is truly a whole weather station. The first thing that I love about it, is its large display. I have it sitting in my living room and I can easily see all of the information just by glancing over at it. I was able to place the outdoor sensor a good distance away and it was still able to communicate with the console. There are some things that I needed to set up before using this weather station, but the instruction manual is detailed and very easy to follow. The diagrams that are included in the instructions also helped me a lot. After installing batteries (not included) in the sensor (2 AAA) and the console (2 AA), I had to select the channel that I wanted to use for them to communicate to each other. Again, this is explained in detail and I had no trouble setting this up. The channel indicator is displayed in the top right hand corner above the outside temperature. As soon as I placed the sensor outside, the temperature started to adjust on the console. The temperature can be displayed in either Fahrenheit or Celsius. I was then able to set the time and date. There is also an alarm feature, if you want to use this as an alarm clock. I love that the display shows the outdoor temperature, indoor temperature and humidity, current weather, date, and time. It's nice to be able to get all of that information from one console. I like the design of the console and I think that even though the display is large, it fits nicely into any room. I received this weather station at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

We bought this Roomba 880 robot vacuum cleaner to help clean our family vacation apartment. The apartment is only about 700 sq feet and is occupied for about 3-4 months of the year, so lots of dust accumulates between visits. I have a very severe dust mite allergy, and I usually sneeze for most of the time we are in the apartment, even if we damp dust and HEPA vacuum it with our Dyson canister vacuum cleaner soon after we arrive. I was very curious (and skeptical) to see whether Minnie (our Roomba) could alleviate these symptoms and reduce our cleaning workload while on vacation.The apartment has mixed surfaces. About two thirds of it is tiled and the rest is carpet, including the bedrooms. The floor plan is fairly open, except that the 2 bedrooms and bathrooms are separate along a corridor. This is important when considering how to use the robot most efficiently. Now that we have had Minnie for around a month, I have to say that she (has to be a she - the error messages are all given by a female voice!) does a superb job. My husband is an efficient demon with the Dyson, doing a VERY thorough job. However, he insists that Minnie does a better job than he can. My allergies have improved hugely. So much so, that we are going to have to buy a second Roomba for our home.Now for some nitty gritty:Pros1. Does a fantastic job, probably better than most humans2. Happily goes under beds, eliminating those dust bunnies which make me sneeze all night3. Very easy to use4. Very easy to empty the bin and clean the filter - takes about 2 minutes, maximum. Good idea to clean the HEPA filter with a handheld vacuum like the Dyson models, to prolong filter life5. Virtual wall lighthouses work very well, once you understand their intricacies6. Can be left unattended or scheduled to clean while you are away, once you have Roomba-prepped the area to be cleaned7. Massively reduces the dust load in a home, far more than human vacuuming can reasonably do. Be aware that the first few times in a carpeted room, you may need to empty the bin every 15 mins or so. It really is that good at picking up dust. Be prepared to babysit the robot constantly at first!8. Much quieter than a standard manual HEPA vacuum, but don't expect to be able to hold a telephone conversation with someone on a bad cellphone connection when you are 3 yards away from it9. Decent battery life. Probably about 3.5 hours on our machine. We can now clean the whole apartment in less than 2 hours - no need to recharge. However the first few cleanings, particularly on carpet areas, took much longer than this, and required an overnight charge to finish.10. I have long hair - about 4 inches below the shoulder. Minnie picks it all up, even from carpet. It can wrap around the rollers, but simply removing the rollers and tugging on the hair pulls most of it away in one neat coil. Much easier than brush vacuum cleaners!Cons (most of these are minor design niggles, and I have tried to suggest a way to work with them)1. Instruction manual leaves a lot to be desired. It is fairly brief, and tells you most of the essentials, but it doesn't help you to understand how to use your Roomba most effectively. The iRobot web site doesn't fill in the gaps. You either have to learn from experience, or Google and hope that you find the answer2. Some of the information in the manual is misleading. For example, the cleaning patterns illustrated are not how the 880 works. If you start cleaning from the Home Base, the Roomba does a sort of random straight line scribble over the whole room, not a spiral and straight edge clean as displayed in the manual. It will pay special attention to edges, but the cleaning pattern is not as illustrated. I am certain that many engineers who own Roombas may be on the verge of a nervous breakdown if they watch this apparently random pattern. Having said that, our Minnie does pick up >99% of "bits" that I have noticed before starting her. This includes bread crumbs, hairs, lint, onion and garlic papery skins, grit from drilling the wall, etc. Just be patient and don't obsessively watch - she will get it.3. Virtual wall light houses are essential for an efficient clean, and their use is very poorly described in the manual. From a combination of experience and reading, I have come up with the following:a) Virtual wall lighthouses (VWLH) supplied with the 880 (2 of them) can be used to divide up a complex shaped area to clean it more efficiently. When you start Roomba, it counts how many VWLH are present (seems like it may only be able to count to 3 though!), then immediately starts cleaning the starting area where you first pressed the Clean button. All of the VWLH devices go into Virtual Wall mode at this point, penning the Roomba into the area you designated. According to iRobot.com, the Roomba will clean that first area until it is clean, or for a maximum of 25 mins. With Minnie, this is NOT true. For the first few uses, she would clean an area for over 45 mins, so the online info is not necessarily accurate. Once Roomba has finished the first area, the closest VWLH will then go into "lighthouse" mode, allowing Roomba to cross into the next area. Once she has passed into that area, it becomes a virtual wall again, keeping her in the new zone until Roomba has finished cleaning it. It then reverts to lighthouse mode, allowing the robot to exit the area and proceed to the next area protected by a VWLH, if any. This process is repeated until the segregated zones are cleaned, at which point the Roomba returns to its home base.b) Light house placement is somewhat critical. The VWLH and the Home Base both emit a kind of "halo" of a no-go zone around themselves, so that the robot can't nudge them out of position. It seems to be about 8-10 inches in radius. This means that you must not place the home base too close to a doorway where you intend to use a VWLH, or the two will interfere, and the robot may not clean the room. We have found that the best placement is on the far side of a threshold, behind, but level with the door frame. Experience will teach you what works best for you.c) If you are cleaning a narrow hallway, do not put the home base on one of the long walls, as the robot may get confused and stay down one end of the hall for much of the cleaning cycle (yes, I have done this). The halo effect can block a lot of the corridor and make it hard for Roomba to navigate along it past the home base or VWLH. You will know this is happening if Roomba keeps pirouetting on the spot before moving on to an area it has already cleaned. Happens with VWLHs as well as Home base - so place them both thoughtfully!4. Blinking lights are not well explained. For example:a) A blue starfish light on top of Roomba means that the side brush is slowing down. If the robot is on a deep pile carpet, it may just be friction from that. If not, you need to stop it and untangle any accumulated crud from the side brush under the robotb) A flashing blue magnifying glass usually means that Roomba has detected extra dirt. This light will usually change to the signal described in c), but if it doesn't you may need to clean the counter-rotating rubber rollers as described in the manual, and wipe out the channel under those (when the machine is upside down) to the collector bin. The dirt detector in the 880 is an optical sensor (not acoustic as in older models) above the rollers in the channel to the bin - if it gets very dirty, it can give false signals.c) A solid blue magnifying glass means that Roomba is in intensive clean mode. Now this gets confusing... If it goes into this mode itself, it will do a fan-shaped back and forth motion over about a 1 yard area. If it is showing this icon after you pressed the Spot clean button, it will spiral over about the same area, unless it hits something, at which point it will go back to normal cleaning mode. Don't stress, it is cleaning!  :)5. We have never heard a full bin warning. It would be helpful if it was either used, or nice and loud! The machine does not stop cleaning when the bin is full, so you may want to clean again if you find it with a full bin, as it is obviously not very efficient in this condition.6. It is hard to get error messages replayed. The manual says to press Clean once to replay them, but when we have done this, the robot just starts cleaning again. Oh well, I guess it fixed itself?7. If you do have severe allergies, you don't want to be anywhere near this when it is cleaning. I sneeze constantly and get red itchy eyes if I am in the same room. Hardly surprising when you see the side brush spinning - it must throw dust and hair/fur up into the air. Having said that, it is really no worse than a manual vacuum cleaner, which throws up dust mechanically and also from the exhaust disturbing the floor layer. In my case, my husband is the lead babysitter for Minnie when she is cleaning. Nice for me!8. Some room prep is really needed for a MUCH better clean. Common sense stuff. Roomba will not suck up thick power cords, but it will tangle on the thinner iPhone/iPad/MacBook charging cables and similar. Also socks, small toys etc. can block the rollers. We lift dining chairs and place them upside down on the dining table (like restaurants) to get the best crumb patrol in the dining room. Light furniture needs to have delicate items moved - Roomba can hit it quite hard the first few times, and your smashed fine porcelain vase may end up in Roomba's collection bin.OK, apologies for the long review, but I wanted to convey accurately just how good this device is. The supporting documentation needs extensive reworking, but the vacuum cleaner is outstanding. When it finally wears out, we will certainly buy another. We can't imagine living without Minnie, now that we have seen what a great job she does. If you follow the instructions for user maintenance, regularly empty the bin and clean the rollers, brush and filters (and wipe down the machine), you may be as amazed as me at how much your allergies can improve with a Roomba in your home.  Goodbye Kleenex, hello Roomba!

We bought these covers for our Tesla remotes after we had dropped them once or twice. The remotes scratch easily, and we were worried that they may even chip or shatter. The neoprene-like fabric of this cover offers decent protection.A few comments:1. They come as one per package. Tesla gives you two remotes, so you will need to buy 2 Kotes if you want to protect both2. They are pretty expensive for a little piece of fabric, but hey, we are Tesla owners! Doesn't compare with the price of the vehicle! Also, every 40 miles we drive, we save enough in unused gas to buy one of these covers...  :)3. They are a VERY tight fit. It works best if you put the remote into the inner part of the Kote first, then stretch the outer pocket over the other end (see photos)4. I put the flat side of the remote against the overlap of the fabric, to make it easier to feel which part of the remote you are pressing. That way you don't open the frunk when you meant to open the trunk, etc.In summary, these remote covers do the job well, although they are expensive. It would be nice if they shipped in packs of two as well.

We have a modern freezer with a plumbed in icemaker. However we disconnected the water to the icemaker for several reasons. First, the connections leaked after a couple of years, second the ice always glued together, third we never used ice fast enough for it to taste good.This tray is a perfect replacement for us. The first thing to understand is how it is non-spill. Remember that experiment in high school where you fill a glass with water and then place a dampened card on top? You can turn the glass upside down without any water leaking (for a while). This works the same way - air pressure and surface tension holds the water in the wells, so fill the wells up to the top with water, and expel all of the excess air and water under the silicone mat. Then you will be leak free, up to a point - just like the glass of water in school.Second brilliant design point is the shape of the ice cubes. They are half moons. As water freezes, it expands initially. This means that at normal freezer temperatures, the ice cube occupies more space than the initial water-fill did. So what? Well, now the ice cube develops a little lip and virtually pops itself out of the tray! Fantastic - these are the easiest removal ice cubes I have ever made. The counterpoint to this is that once frozen, the silicone lid no longer seals well enough to protect the cubes from freezer odors, so use them fast, or store them sealed in another container within a day or two.Very happy with this tray and recommend it without reservations.

These are exceptionally good value for money, and work very well with an iPad Air. The tips are a great size and glide very smoothly. The stylus barrel feels substantial and is very nicely weighted. My disappointment is that on two of the styli, the clip is loose and constantly rattles and taps against the barrel. It doesn't seem possible to loosen the cap and reshape the clip or tighten it to stop the rattle. Otherwise a very good purchase.

I finally found these after Lands End stopped supplying my favorite underwear. I have also tried Fruit of the Loom and Orvis, but the Jockey garments are far superior. They are comfortable all day, have good quality stitching and they stay put. the tops never roll over, and the legs do not cut into the skin. They wash well and seem durable, despite the softness. Everything else is going to be thrown out - Jockey is my new best friend!
Smells a little sweeter than store bought Kouros. It may be that YSL have changed the formula, although I doubt it. Not sure I would buy this again.

Excellent Skype-compatible headset. Call answering button and mute are very useful. Very comfortable, even when worn for several hours. Sound quality is fine for speech, but not exactly HiFi for music. Very good product.

Great products and a fair price. The carry case is very low quality - would not survive many trips to the range. As the contents are great, the case is not important, but it does convey a negative impression of the quality of the kit.
Sturdy non-slip bags. They fit perfectly in our old 18" Kitchenaid Trash Compactor. Very pleased with them and would certainly order more when we need them.

This seal shipped in an envelope and arrived with several kinks in the rounded surface, due to being folded by the packaging. I hoped that these would straighten out, but even after several weeks, they remain visible. A bigger issue we are having with it is getting it to stick to our shower door. We bought the recommended hi-bond adhesive tape and cleaned everything thoroughly with a recommended solvent (isopropyl alcohol) before we started. The tape sticks beautifully to the shower door, but the seal seems to be too slippery for the tape to fix in place. We left the seal undisturbed for 3 days, but it still didn't stick properly. We have tried 3 fresh applications of tape now, and we cannot get it to hold. We are now trying another seal product with pre-applied tape on the back of the seal.If we find a better adhesive for this silicone seal, I will revise this review. However, I remain disappointed with the kinks. One star is all I can give for now.

This is a fairly...but strictly for the young...cute necklace.  I can see teenagers wearing this.  The look on the manikin is kind of deceiving as to the size.  It's more of a choker look than a collar look, and it won't be as wide as pictured.  That sure is a tiny manikin.  Certainly not a replica close to an adult size.  If it is, that is one tiny person.  It's obviously not an expensive piece of jewelry.. but just for fun.  I actually like it better than how it's pictured here... but not for me... for the two teenagers (yes, I ordered two). I'm not thrilled with it, but I'm not sorry about ordering it.

This necklace arrived and I could hear it screaming from the bag as I picked it up... "cheap  plastic!!!  What you're seeing in the pictures as the black markings, is actually paint on a backing.  The red plastic  form is  obviously over the top.  Does not look like the black is inside the plastic gem.  You can clearly see that it's painted underneath.  This and the earrings have ridges running up and down.  Those ridges remind me of those old school cafeteria plastic glasses with the ridges running around the top.  The ridges detract rather than add anything.  The gold colored caps are not touching the plastic gemstone and, instead, flare out which gives it an unfinished look.  Note that those earrings are short.  It clearly shows that, so that's not their fault.  Just a little odd with a massive piece of costume jewelry.  he cap. The gold coloring isn't nearly so "elegant" as the picture.  The larger gem and the earrings are some type of see thru plastic (which is very obvious), and those are ridges that run up and down... if you look close to the picture you can see them (wish I had looked closer).  And look at those caps on the earring and the the piece hanging down.  To add insult to injury, they actually smeared the reddish color that's on the leaves, onto the gold or brassy chain.  And it's glaringly obvious.  I can't believe anyone looked at that and let it go.  To be fair, it's only smeared on the one.  I knew it wouldn't look as good as the picture when I ordered it.  I just didn't know it would be this terrible.  I actually ordered two because I had two teenagers looking at it.  I can't wait till they see this.  They might wear the necklace...maybe they'll cut off the big plastic glob hanging down which would improve it.  But I would bet my next paycheck that there's no way on earth they will wear these earrings.  I just have my limits"...  I know you can't expect a lot for the price...and the shipping included (I could've purchased locally), but this set just wouldn't be admired by me on an adult.  I would expect to see this necklace set on a gothic teenager with mascara painted all around her eyes like she'd been in a bar fight.

Kudos to the photographer on this one. The earrings are not even close to being as pretty as what's pictured.  I don't remember if I paid shipping with this.  If I did, I got suckered.  If not, I still paid too much.  This is typical  1950's "Dime-Store" and "Flea Market"  costume jewelry.  These earrings scream "I am soooooo cheap!  The fake gemstones are not evening shiny.  They're fairly cloudy. They look dirty peach colored.  Nothing on these earrings is remotely close to gold colored, it's all closely tarnished looking.  It isn't worth sending back.  I don't see how anyone could like these who's over 5 years old.  Even if you're poor (and I am not rich), I wouldn't wear these even for fun as they are really cheap looking at any distance.  I don't think I would even wear them in the dark.  I promise you, you will be sorry.  These are going in the garbage, I wouldn't even put them in Good Will... that would be so mean spirited of me.

I ordere two for two friends of mine who have long  beautiful hair (and in their early 20s) and like to pin it up behind their heads.  I have to say that this particular broach is one of the most beautiful ones I've gotten.  I think I've gotten them all, but I love this one the best.  It's much more beautiful than the pictures.  Although you'd have to be wearing beige, brown, tan....  or a green to match it to anything.  Absolutely beautiful color and arrived must quicker than expected.  Wasn't supposed to be here for two more weeks and arrived yesterday!  Note they are large, but that is part of the uniqueness.

I don't know why we even use soup spoons as our version is so messy and they're not deep enough to get more than a minor bite. You just can' get but very few veggies and liquid in a normal soup spoon.  Liquid sloshes down my blouse on my chin.  Maybe I'm just a messy diner.  I'm old and this has happened to me all my life.  I feel like my face is chasing the spoon.  These are great for not having to do that.  However, these do cure all my ills.  Two ways to hold the spoon... neat design.  Catch on the end of the handle so you can put down the spoon without it slipping into the bowl.  And notches at the hand/bowl area of the spoon so you can turn it upside down and prop it up in your bowl.  While either way works, it's just a really neat design.  These are just so so handy, especially for grandchildren and grandparents... We're all messy.  Those in between can claim they're above it all, but I think not as I've seen the drips around the tables and computers.  My husband is in love with these and we ordered three more sets.. one more for us and two for stocking stuffers.  I wanted to get my order in before they could possibly run out.  They came fairly quickly, almost a week.  They're attractive and they stack pretty well.  I doubt they'll stay in the drawer long enough to worry about stacking them though.  Discovered they are the absolute perfect size to measure out my coffee for my two-cup coffee pot... awesome... there goes one.  They've got a reasonable handle length.  Works for us.

These stories are slipping in this installment.  So far I've enjoyed each of these installments.  However, they are progressively getting more and more out there.  There are so many ghosts now, it's like the whole town is full of them.  They sort of lose their significance when overplayed.  And the story lines are spreading  so thin, I'm having a hard time setting aside my disbelief.  We have not just regular ghosts, we have ghosts who have different talents than just regular ghosts.  A lot is left to your imagination instead of explaining how one ghost can do this and one ghost can't, the story just expects you not to question that.  We have the library ghost, we have the cemetery ghost, and we've added more now.  We have ghosts that are so good they can text you logical conversation, and on the other end we have ghosts who mysteriously and obviously can't do that, don't or can't speak, show up and don't even hand signal.  You're left to guessing what the heck they want and what they are saying.  It's not making sense any more to me.  I don't know if I can be talked into the next one after this, as this one was barely tolerable. And the main character has questionable character to me.  She breaks promises and seems inconsiderate to her boyfriend.  She's just not honest and justifies it on really thin threads of reasoning (actually baffling threads).  I'm starting to feel she's fairly arrogant and dishonest and I don't feel for her like I used to in the previous installments.  Think this is my last one.

This wasn't "hilarious" to me...but it was entertaining and passed the time.  I think a 4 rating in a 1-5, pretty much says where the story ranks.  There are better out there, but there are also a lot worse.  I will read the follow on books.

This is sort of like a girdle, but not quite as tight.  If you get it smaller, it could be tight and hold you in well.  It is great for  not "jiggling" around.  The lower one third has a very nice lightweight panel which keeps that area from getting overly hot.  It was very warm yesterday and I did a lot of activity.  These panties did not add to my temperature and I didn't even notice I had them on during my inflicted exercise.  They weren't as  high on me as they are shown in the picture.  But I think that's because I have body form issues.  Washes well.  The only problem I had with these was in using the ladies lounge.  These were more difficult to get back up and down...  However, they were pliable enough that you could push your hands inside and press outwards, enhancing your ability to get the things back up.  Even at that, it wasn't really a difficult chore, just a little tedious for someone who had taken a diuretic that morning.  I only ordered one to see how I liked them and I'm going to order more as I think they are worth it.

The exact color that is on my screen.  I wanted something light for bed coverage and this color matches with my bedroom.  The material is quilted, yet it's like a bedspread in that it is pliable enough to drape over the bed.  I didn't think it was too stiff.  I have a velour type blanket underneath and as my first cover.  My older comforter set made it too hot to sleep with both over me.  This is just the right amount.  I live in N. Alabama, so the temps don't get much lower than freezing except on the rare occasion.  Even so, I like having my blankets underneath my top cover and will add another blanket if necessary.  I purchased a King and the shams are regular pillow size.  So, that could be a drawback for some.  Since this is the color in my room I wanted to match, I have plenty of pillows that match this when I have company and want my room looking extra good.  The cover is on a Queen sized bed and cover it generously.  I wanted the King size as my matteresses and box springs are very thick and my bed is very high off the ground.  The King goes 25 inches to the floor and covers the pillows generously at the top and folds back nicely on a queen size bed.

These are just gorgeous.  These are a bit on the heavy side, but if you have long thick hair that you pin up in any way, these are great.  Takes some time to get here, but at these prices, they are just beautiful.  I buy them two at a time for sisters, and they can't wait to get them.  These sisters are in their late teens and they look gorgeous in their hair.

I love these.  These are awesome, and very attractive.  They pour perfectly just as their name indicates, without dribbling all over the place.. and with the longer spout.. the pictures don't do that spout justice, I can aim for my coffee pot's water tank and hit it perfectly.  You know that filling that tank up and be a pain in the rump.  I have a 4-5 cup coffee maker and I was having a time filling it.  I would use the pot and fill it with water which is a pain or I would use other things around my kitchen.  I just cut to the chase and ordered these.  The spout in the picture looks a little blunted... In "real life" the spout is a good bit longer, given you perfect control over where stuff ends up.  And...and they hang by their handles perfectly.  I was able to hang them in on an overhead kitchen rack between two lines of beautiful coffee cups.  They're not very obvious there.. but they are easy to grab on a daily basis.  These will take up cabinet space as the set is large, especially with the handles and the snouts being a bit longer than they look.  While the snouts  (no dribbling) and the handles (can be hung up) are the biggest selling point for me... might not be for everyone because of the space required to store them.

These are just great to get rid of the ashtray smell you get by leaving an ashtray sitting around, it's much neater as you don't have the ashes flying everywhere at the least little ac or fan breeze, or just the breeze of walking by, you don't have to worry about knocking it over and dumping ashes all over the floor or on the rug or around your desk.  Once you spin your cigarette butt into the tank, it's gone and dies.  No picking around in the butts to find which one is not out yet... no smoke from a not completely dying butt.  I still don't empty my ashtrays for at least six hours just as a fire safety measure, and these ashtrays don't look all nasty sitting around.  And, these are great outside on your patio or porch.... definitely with the breezes that come thru.  My husbands' forgotten ashtray would go scattering everywhere if a storm with wind came up.. what a freaking mess.  Now, there are no cigarette butts for me to complain for him to chase all over.  A must for the patio... a better look for the house.

I've read in some of the comments that there is not a  hot-plate here, that it's "just" the thermal pot that keeps the coffee warm.  Well, my hot plate is working just fine.  It also turns off after an approximately one hour.  I love this little pot and it's just perfect for my husband and me.  We get up at different times.  With this pot it is just so easy for me to have my two cups, prepare the pot for when he gets up, and then he can have a fresh two cups of coffee also.  It's also nice for making a cup for late afternoon or dinner.  I like that it doesn't take up near the space that the other pot did.  It is just so much neater on my counter.  I can now place this smaller coffee maker in a more convenient location.  The other coffee pot seemed to take up quite a bit of space (needed pull out and rotate room to fill water tank).  Filling the water was a hassle as I had to pull the whole thing out from under the cabinet and turn it around in order to get the water in the tank.  I found the "perfect" measuring cups set and use the four-cup container to fill this pot.  They have the long spouts with the stabilizer catch which catches on the side of the pot and with the long snout, pours into this pot perfectly without dribble.  This pot is the perfect height for under the counter.  I like the heavy thermal pot (so much easier to clean), I'm saving by not using as much coffee, and it looks really nice.  I haven't used the programmable function as it only takes four minutes to make coffee.  It will take more water than four cups, I fill the container pretty much to the top, and use 1/3 cup of coffee, and my coffee is strong the way I like it.  My husbands kicks it back as he likes weaker coffee.  I'm glad I switched and ditched...the old pot. UPDATE:  I still love this coffee pot a couple of months later.  In fact, I like it more today than when I first wrote the review.  I've saved a lot on coffee. I'm only sorry I didn't go downsize sooner.  Making coffee couldn't be easier or faster.  And one pot enough for more than 2 very large cups of coffee!  Update:  Went belly up this evening.  I am not a happy camper, but it's on sale... and I love it so much, I just bought two more.. one as a back up.  Hopefully, I'm just unlucky in the one I purchased.  I really love this pot.

These are exactly as advertised.  And the case is amazingly organized and very useful to keep your kids from throwing their crayons all over the place....  I don't feel bad for having spent the money... and in fact, reordered another of these for a friend.  I like that you get the crown sharpener with it... and it has a good sized case for the shavings... good design, functional...worth the price...recommend.

Well... these will work for guys... but if you have any hair... these just keep getting stuck in them.. they want to flip outwards pointing away from your head and so you have to continually put them back over your ears.... and they get tangled in your hair and it's just a mess... plus they slip along the glass arms...so you are constantly pushing.  However, when they were in place and not pulling my hair out... they did help to hold my glasses in the right position... and they fit on almost any arm....  My husband uses them just fine... but he's pretty near bald...  But they're just so easy to lose and you have to look for them.....  Even though your hair would cover them... they do look at little dorky.

What?  I've got these and they don't fit on any of my glasses, prescription or otherwise... and none of my husbands'.  I even thought that maybe I ws doing this wrong... but friends have tried to use them... and we can't seem to get them to work.  So, either we're all idiots or these are not functional on "all" glasses...  but not sending them back... maybe someone will come along who can use them some day.

I love these... even though they are pricey....  They are not "that" large.. but they are large enough that you don't feel you're looking thru granny glasses and you don't have to hold your nose in the air in order to read something on the side of a can, a letter or whatnot.  They're great and I wish I could afford to have a pair for each car and outside for the patio and to carry in my purse.... but one pair will have to do.

I recently had cataract lens replacement surgery.  While you have 20/20 vision for distance, you will need reading glasses.  I do some reading outside, so I just didn't want to switch back and forth between sunglasses.  Keeping track of one pair is much easier.  I keep them on in the store so I can read the labels on cans and boxes.  I love these.  They are as large ..don't seem as large as shown, but close and I also love that they are large.  I hate looking thru those granny glasses because I end up feeling like I'm looking thru a frame as I can clearly see the frames.  It's like strapping binoculars to your face... you get that vision surrounded by frame.  I wanted something larger and more sophisticated that didn't require me to keep tipping them up and down with my hands and really had enough room for the bifocal part... Nothing's more irritating than nodding your head up and down in order to see something.  With these I barely have to move my head.  I also bought these with a clear lens for wearing around the house or at night when I wanted to be able to do both driving and seeing something up close.  So, I love them and I get compliments on them all the time and asked "Where did you get those?"  "I didn't know they made these."  My eye surgeon even asked because she's wanting to have some on hand for those people that can't get them locally... which you can't.  Seems the only place I could even find bifocals was on-line in the first place.  So, I've passed on the link to her.

Don't look any further.  This is the perfect paper towel rack.  There's no way it gets an easier to add a roll than simply lifting of the rod and inserting it in your paper towel roll and putting it back.  It looks great and is so convenient that even my husband has started restocking the paper towel racks.  I loved it so much I bought my Daughter-in-Law one to replace the one she kept fussing about... she absolutely loves it.  All those pape rtowel rolls where it was a pain to restock the paper, those that required a cabinet rebuild in order to install, all those ones that take up a lot of space and stand on the counter... out out out...  This also comes in a silver/chrome coating... looks great in a bathroom (mine is on the inside of my closet door for easy access).... Love these....  one of those purchases where you say... I wish I'd found it first before I bought 20 ones that I was less than happy with.  I literally have four or five sitting around the garage.  I even gave one away and the girl brought it back and said she couldn't use it because she wanted this one instead....  I have no idea what to do with that one now... hate to throw it away... but I'll never use another type....sigh....  what to do, what to do?

This is the best spice for meats of all kinds.  It's a fine dust which dissolves easily in soups and gravies.  This dust is great on green beans and other vegetables too.  I love to cook vegetables just slightly in olive or canola oil, and flavoring with this spice but leaving them slightly crispy.  I also use this in stir fries with rice.  I like the slightly smokey peppery taste, it's not an overly or even a very salty taste so it's easy to use in recipes without overpowering the flavor.  It  is especially great as a roast and steak rub.  It's just not for beef, the flavoring is great with chops of all kinds, used as an ingredient in your flour mixture for fried chicken.  Rub down your chicken before baking it, you won't have a piece of chicken left over.  Rubbed on a pork loin that is wrapped in aluminum foil and baked is a huge hit.  It's very versatile and I get raves on my cooking when using this.  I've used this flavoring for years, but couldn't find it any more in grocery or the big warehouse stores.  I was glad to find it on Amazon.  I also don't mind buying such a large portion.  My husband and grandsons will grab this spice to take to the table with them to either add more (as I use it lightly), or just to add it in something I didn't.  It's my favorite go-to spice.  Yet, it doesn't make everything taste the same, it enhances the meat or vegetable's flavors instead.  Love it....and won't be without it unless they stop making it.

Thought the price was a little more than it should have been.  But these are pretty useful for taking lunch items...  I wanted them for pot luck and Holiday dinners so that I could push off some of the leftovers without having to make people sign for the "good stuff"...  You know you're never going to get half your plastic wear containers back  You can just kiss half of them, at least, good bye... until you visit "their" house and rummage thru their plastic wear to rescue yours from being kidnapped.  These are a perfect size.  You can get a good amount of leftovers in these.

What is this material?  I ordered two of these and I won't be wearing them anywhere other than to do yard work... there's no structure to the blouse.... looks way way better here than on you... The material is very thinnish and practically wads up on itself as you wear it... it's not static... but it's something weird.  And, the color is just enough off to look like a duller version of the same picture...not quite as rich or deep.  Not worth the money in my estimation.

This caftan does flow  or drape as in the picture.  It's cottony and it feels as if it's billowing up under your neck.... especially after having washed it once.... You know how a cotton garment can be if it isn't pressed...sort of stands out in weird places...and makes you feel like you need to keep pressing it down.  I do like the zipper in front (which is my criteria for dressing gowns/robes)... but past that, I feel like a big pink cotton candy puff... and no way am I dragging out the iron!!  Besides, it felt smaller after washing once... imagining what is going to happen after a couple of more washes....I'll probably wear it again... but it's definitely going to be at the back of my closet.

I just finished this book not five minutes ago and am up at the computer looking for the next book in this series.  One reviewer noted grammatical errors that were distracting to the book?  Really???  This was well written (1st person).  Maybe I was to busy gobbling up the story to notice.. ah well.  Once I started,  this book captured me... for the next two days my Kindle was never more than four feet or arm's length from me as I totally devoured this story.  The characters were all entertaining.  I only had one moment where I thought the story stretched my ability to buy into it...and it wasn't that important to the plot...I just would have gotten Molly there differently.  And, past that, if I wasn't reading the book I was busy filling every idle minute trying to come up with a plausible "And the killer is...."  My husband even had to wave his hand in front of my face at dinner while we waited for our meals, I was off in La La Land trying to analyze the clues!  I normally don't particularly care for books where the main character is a mom as I consider having children around in a mystery stifles the main character... but these children were just so adorable.. you felt you could just grab, at least,  the little boy up and hug him.  All the suspects were fascinating... not overblown... but not your norma or usual set of characters.  They were all fairly unique...and the dialogue was great!!  These characters were very defined....  I loved her best friend and their sometimes stressful friendship as all friendships are, I loved the Stephanie character with her "bitchy" personality...so much so that I found myself memorizing some of her lines to steal and turn on those self-centered  people in my orbit... very creative.  I'd like to give as good as I get...and Stephanie's dialogue is just fantastic...not over done either..but brilliant.  The Tommy character was just so right on... we all know that guy... and he's not the usual dumb cop or overbearing macho guy.  There were several humorous if not down right funny moments too.  I loved her business of doing personal cartoons/e-cards... my own husband is an artist and has done that so many times.... and it's amazing what a creative brain and art talent can do... And, just like Molly, they come to him in synapses and he's constantly grabbing something to jot down his ideas... just like Molly.  Talk about realism!  I especially appreciated those wonderful ideas Molly  kept coming up with that really added so much fun to the story.  The only character that leaves something to be developed is the absent husband.... and that's not unexpected...but can't wait to see if he's going to be as equally entertaining as all the other characters have been once he returns to the fold.  This is definitely a good mystery which will keep you occupied until the last word.  I recommend this book as a great way to pass some hours being entertained not only by the mystery,...but the characters and the humor of the characters and those darn cute cartoons!!!  Happy Reading...

I was so anxious to read the second book of this series!  I wasn't sure I was going to like this book after the first couple of chapters, but I stuck with it and boy am I so glad that I did.  I love this series... I love this writer... I love this book.  In fact, I just finished this second book and I want the third one...and I want it now.  Unfortunately, I read due to personal family issues, the writer was not able to complete Book 3  as of yet.  I'm so sorry for the family tragedies of the author, but I have to have Book 3.  I just have to!!!  I haven''t wanted anything so much as I want more of this series.  I'm going to be so depressed and sad until the third one comes out.  As hard as it is to believe, Book 2 way surpassed my expectations... what a terrific story.  Again, I just couldn't put it down... I devoured it...  I was biting my nails right till the end.  All these main characters are so alive...even the ghosts... and what a surprise at the end!  So much to look forward to in Book 3... I just can't wait!  I know that this is a series that I'll want to save to re-read a few years from now.  It definitely doesn't get better than this.

I almost didn't order this book because of some of the reviews.  I'm glad that I did anyway. .  I haven't been able to put this book down since I started reading it this morning.  This story runs at a good clip....and it's very interesting.  I, unlike others, did not think of the Ghost and Mrs Muir.  This was completely modern and totally different and far more interesting.  While the idea of ghosts is in itself a bit "out there," the story was very plausible... logical... and about the way you might interact with a ghost assuming you could get over the initial fear and shock should you see  one.  The main characters are extremely normal.  The main character and her side-kick are not scatter brained nor given to illogical actions.  There are no exaggerated personality disorders.  There's, nothing to make feel you've stretched your believability too far, not one boring paragraph...you won't skip one single sentence.  I ordered the second book in this series without even reading the synopsis, nor any of the comments just minutes ago.  I'm  holding myself back from starting on it until the laundry is done....talk about suffering.... I can't wait to get started!!  If you like cozy mysteries, and like the idea of spiritual involvement in your story... then you're not going to do any better than this.  Take it from me, I've read well over 400 mysteries since I've had my Kindle just a few years ago...  I have "deleted"  many books from my Kindle after the first chapter or so as I just can't tolerate anything too nonsensical or droning torturous descriptions of everything...and stories that won't move.  I am not easy to please.  This ranks right up with one of the best reads in a long long time. Ah... the dryer just beeped.... I gotta run!

If you want the wheels to move, forget it.  The wheels are sticky... it's more like dragging them, they are not turning at all.  Or maybe one is turning and the others or not.  And, the thing will collapse on itself in 3 seconds flat...spilling all your contents.  If you put heavy items in the shelves, it becomes a bit more stable, but just the act of putting something on the shelves and taking it back off, causes the whole thing to collapse yet again.  The whole structure stability depends on the shelves remaining braced to the poles.  It just wouldn't remain together no matter what I did...I could get it to fall in a heap on the floor using one finger lightly touching the top.  There's too much play where the shelves snap on..  You shouldn't have to re-engineer a product;.  You're not going to get any use out of this unless you come up with your own fix, like clamps?.  As cute as it is when it's sitting all put together, it's  only a breath away from falling to a heap on the floor.  I

Very nice product.  I ordered these to wear at night when reading in bed.  I sleep on my side and my hands and arm get cold because they stick out from under the covers when operating my kindle or reading a book.  I have to read to fall asleep!!  These leave my finger tips easy access to touch screen or turn pages.  Having arthritis, my hands seem to get bone-chilled more than the rest of my body.  So cold, they ache.  These are wonderfully functional. .  I actually wore these to drive today and was able to stave off the very cold steering wheel feel, and at the same time, touch screen with my GPS, and operating some of the touch screen options for my vehicle with ease, and other gizmos (garage door opener built into visor, cruise control, etc.  and without suffering that ice cold ache in my hands.  I can tell that I will absolutely have to have another pair, one for my bed tray and one for my vehicle.

The writing wasn't bad... the plot was.  I didn't put the book down and walk away, but I kept wishing I'd get to the end so I could give up on it.  Very close to boring.... I wasn't charmed with the characters and Daisy has a truth issue.  She's taking money from people for her psychic medium abilities, and she has none.  So, she's a fraudster.  I could go with that, but the book isn't comedy and Daisy rationalizes that she's comforting people and therefore it is okay to lie to them.  The book is mostly her running up to the rich folks house to comfort a complete ninny and then back home to deal with her handicapped husband.  It wasn't very entertaining at all... nothing interesting in the plot... just a silly plot I could have made up on my worst day.

This isn't all that secure, but does the trick in keeping people from palming your stuff without you knowing.  Someone can easily just walk off with the whole thing.  I haven't found a need for the clipboard as of yet.

These are fantastic.  Work great, store in a drawer without fuss.  Getting two of these was a fantastic deal.  We use one of them constantly without issues.  Sometimes it will stall on a large can, or if the rim is smashed up a little.  But, when that happens, a little push or wiggle and it continues.  I also think that these type of openers are more sanitary than the other type.  These don't let metal shavings and dust fall into your food. Update:  I've used the heck out of one of these and gave the other to my sister.  They're still working great.  Sometimes the lid gets stuck on the thing and is a bit annoying to pull off...but not so much so that I'd use anything else.  Still love these.  My sister loves the one I gave to her!

Took too long to get here and the quality is a bit on the low side.  The eyes and mouth are a little lop sided.  You have to constantly tug and pull to get the alignment right.  The holes for the eyes is quite small...not open as shown in the picture.  Not recommending.

This shirt looks much better on the model than in real life of course.  But it's not a bad shirt and I'm happy enough with it to keep it to wear around the house.  It's not as long as shown in the picture and has a more squared-off boxy look.  The color is not as vibrant as pictured either.  I wouldn't recommend purchasing it; but once you have it, it's not worth returning it and makes a good around-the-house-and-yard look.  Wouldn't particularly want to wear it anywhere to impress...because it won't.

This hate was a total surprise.  I didn't expect, at the price, for this to be such a warm insulated hat.  It is not thin or cheap looking.  It feels double thick and the material retains it's shape even when the mouth piece has been pulled down under the chin for periods of time.  The top of the head is well sewn to where you can wear this under a construction hard hat without feeling a knot on top of your head.  Going to order more for all the guys.  The wait was worth it.

My husband loves this hat!  It's a perfect fit for his big head...chin strap is totally comfortable and the hat is warm.  The overall look of the hat is high quality.  When it arrived, it seemed like it might be "thin," but that was not the case. I guess it was a little flat in that bag.. but comes to life swiftly.  My husband walks our dogs around the yard at nights and dresses as if he were on an arctic trek...  He's the sweater-in-August type of guy...wuss?  He has a full beard and a fat head and this hat is so comfortable.  This hat actually looks much better than the picture... beautiful brown color.  His last one like this was uncomfortable at the chin and around the face and fairly tight... this is a great improvement over that old hat in both function and beauty!!!

Seemed like a long time to wait, but it wasn't. .  However, curlers were not considered an emergency need item.  Waiting was fine.  Certainly came as advertised and were a great buy...so worth the wait and I will continue to order these from this place.  I go thru a lot of these only because my dog has taken a fancy to them and is taking them right out of my hair as I sleep... I'm not sure, I keep them in a box on a high shelf...so what else is possible?  It's a mystery that baffles the ca'ca' out of moi'!  These curlers are just fantastic to sleep on...  So much easier, less time consuming, less damaging than using a curling iron.  Since they are so comfortable, I can leave in for sleeping w/o feeling the pain of normal curlers and I can even leave in the next day up until the time to get ready.  Sometimes I roll  my hair and the next day don't go anywhere, I can sleep a second night on these before being totally annoyed with being in curlers.  To me it is amazing that people will continue with the structured velcro curlers... they are just so uncomfortable.  These don't slip or slide any more than regular velcro curlers.  In fact, if you roll tight to allow for a bit of slackening, you're spot on.  Laying on these curlers does not affect the "round" curl effect... they don't get squashed flat... they somehow retain that "round" look quite well.  To get high lift, just as with any curler, raise hair straight up, then pull up and back away from part, then roll.  These are the large jumbo curlers which are perfect for wavy curls or smoothing out into a bob.  They make them smaller for more curly dos.  Be sure and convert the mms to inches to check size before you order.

I love these platters.  They aren't particularly large for servings of meat, cheese or whatever for large parties.  However, we have used these as plates because they are just large enough that you can throw a substantial salad and your meal on them without having to get a second salad plate.  We also have sat a soup bowl on one side and sandwich and chips on the other.  We have a small kitchen, dining table and counters where it's impossible to  give everyone room for a soup bowl, salad plate, bread plate and putting out serving dishes of foods and on and on.  Everyone can load up their plate (platter) at the counter and go to the table.  No formal dining going on around here.  These work great when we do need to serve an item, or put out snacks or sandwich items and use them as the perfect small platters.

This is enough to keep guests, maids, service personnel from palming your stuff.  It won't stop someone from taking the box and breaking into it somewhere else... but it will stop people from surreptitiously snatching or palming your medications, cash, jewelry, credit cards and any smaller items you use on a daily basis.

We use this box to lock up medications.  Of course, anyone who didn't care about the theft being detected, could just take the whole box and go off and break into it somewhere.  But it's great to keep light fingered thieves who "palm" things from sneaking a few pills here and there.  Absolutely foiled a house guest whom we recently caught in the middle of the night sneaking into our bedroom to steal some of my husband's drugs.  Because he simply couldn't snatch the pills and run into another room, but was faced with a  locked box and how to open it, he was caught red handed with his hands in the "cookie jar" so to speak.  So, it works fairly well to foil children, maids and guests since it's a bit difficult to walk out of the house carrying a locked box, but easy to palm the little stuff inside and walk out.  And, our "guest" is now spending his days on the street out in the freezing cold and his nights sleeping down at the Salvation Army.

These have to be the most comfortable shoes ever and I can't wait for Spring so I can wear them.  Wearing them in the house now. These  shoes come in different colors and sizes and the prices are all over the place.  The insoles can be popped right out.  They were totally finished off sew-wise so I can't imagine that wasn't planned as a feature.  I've never seen a shoe where the insoles were removable for washing.  And shoe and sole has a "quality"  stitch/sew job.  I hate having dirty insoles.  Even  wearing socks, you are picking up dust and dirt which eventually soils your insole.  The insoles are totally comfortable and you won't need a gel insert.  But, should you insist, being able to trace the insole is great for getting the perfect gel trim.This shoe is so comfortable yet has a totally supportive structure.  I don't feel as if my feet are spreading out or  being splayed all over.  If you're working on your feet a good portion of the day like a beautician, nurse, waitress, cashier or so on... these would be great for comfort!  I live for comfort and functionality over beauty.  I am totally a senior citizen now and comfort is way more important than looking good.  This is totally reflected in my closet full of high-end walking shoes.  These particular shoes have claimed the "Best in Show" in my closet.  I'm actually going to buy the  black pair which for some odd reason was double-the-price.

I bought one of these on a stocking-stuffer Christmas-shopping run. I bought it at a home goods store.  When I got home, I had a jar on the counter of salsa that my husband could not previously open.  I'd merely set it aside to try again later.  I decided to use this before I put it in someone's stocking.  I was planning on using a lot of energy because of my previous experience trying to get it off.  I wasn't even thinking I could do it with this myself.  At the time I was hooking it on, I was yelling for my husband to come help me.  It came off so so amazingly easily that it was off before he came around the corner.  That shocked me...so I found another jar of pickles (this time) and tried it again, and off it came.  I've had jar openers, just not this design.  In fact, I was thinking when I bought it, it wasn't the "best" design.  But it really turned out to do better than any of the other jar openers I've owned in the past (who have all ended up only God knows where).  This one, it's going in my stocking... well... into my "odds and ends" drawer in the kitchen.  Sad sad... now  I need another "stocking-stuffer"....

I bought two.  Sadly, I could not use one because I forgot about having drawer space along the front.  However, the other desk did not and this turned out to be great for my husband.  He loves his.  I'm not worried about them braking....  They're not flimsy, but they're not a super sturdy.  If you're going to constantly bang on them, or use them as support to stand up... you're wasting your money for sure.  Now that I've got the second one, I'm looking for some way to repurpose .

Came just in time for a lot of can opening... Worked great.... I had no problem whatsoever with these.  The only hiccup was the first larger can.  The opener stopped... Dragged out the directions and, sure enough, explained.  On larger cans, when it stops, you hit the button to get it to resume.  I love these things and getting two made the purchase a whole lot better.  I don't expect these to last my whole life...  And, at this price, they wouldn't need to.  Just a note.. you get two in separate packaging.  That means, if you intend to gift these.. you have two gifts.  Make a cute stocking stuffer for anyone, even a camper or traveler.  You're a little late...  but it would have been a great idea.  I would like to keep one in my vehicle for emergencies when traveling.  We like to eat in our room sometimes.

These are great for the intended purpose.  I bought an extra one to use as a holder for my tiny handheld vacuum and it holds it just right.  I purchased a small handheld vacuum that had no holder.  I used one of these as a holder instead.  I put it on the side of a cabinet wall close to a plug in plate.  Works perfectly.  Works great on a hairdryer too.  In fact, I figured out that, if I put the wire in first and dangle it at the bottom, then reach that end toward a plug, it's even more handy.  My hair dryer tended to get the wire's stuck on cabinet door knobs and get hung up or dragged across the counter.  It was  annoying.  If I put the plug in first thru the bottom and then over to the plug,,. the height keeps it from dragging across my countertop and getting stuck in odd places.  I find that it's all one smooth as it keeps the cord from dripping down on to doorhandles or knobs.  My husband is going to order a couple to hold a couple of his tools out where he can reach for them quickly.

This design has a lot of functionality to it.  The material is a little thin.  However,  it still has it's functionality.  I bought the pink one and I'll get lots of wear out of it.  I won't be able to answer the door in this or go out in the back yard...  While you can't see thru it, you won't feel comfortable with the clinginess that comes with these unless you're by yourself.  I wouldn't recommend buying one as I think you can do a little better material-wise.

I absolutely love this toaster.  So much so, that when the first one we ordered didn't work right... I asked for a replacement and not my money back.  The second one I received works absolutely perfectly.  It's a gorgeous appliance... shiny and sleek... modern looking...high end look.  It's longer (duh) than a regular toaster, but not any wider.  It looks great sitting out on the counter along the wall.  I honestly hid the other toaster under the counter in a cabinet.  I don't feel the need to "hide" this one... maybe in a few weeks when the Honeymoon phase is gone.  This thing truly has the right amount of room for bagels and toast... and goes very fast.  You'll have to watch that and get used to the speed with which this appliance toasts.  If you have several people eating toast or having toasted sandwiches, this is going to be the best appliance for you.  I'm not kidding when I say it goes fast.  The electronics are not rocket science.  The instructions are clear...  I love the "stop" button...  That's great when you feel panic... get a look at your toast and decide whether to continue or not.  I haven't tried any other feature (got to read up on that defrost feature), but look forward to getting the most use out of this toaster.  I think this toaster is a great buy.  My best purchase of an appliance in quite a while.  Recommend you get it if you like toast, bagels... toasted  sandwiches....  I am returning the first one today that wouldn't work right...I was provided a label right away, and they sent out a replacement so fast it made my head spin!!  Stuff happens,  Amazon/Seller were perfectly attentive.  Wish I'd seen these earlier, great Christmas present to some families I know.  Definitely keeping in mind for my next wedding, hostess gift, or any excuse really. Imagine being proud to have given the "toaster"....  UpDate... still loving this toaster.. great for buns when making hotdogs....  does a great job. on everything and comes in so handy when you have two boys (grandkids) eating you out of house and home...  Everyone who's visited has asked where did you get that toaster.... And, a wedding if finally coming up and I'm going to get my gift in early... and one of the things is going to be this toaster!  Update:  Six months later.. still working great and now everyone I know has one and we all love them, especially for hot dog buns... four at a time...

I love this neck rest!  This fits great... I have a velcro extender which I put on here to give me more wearing options. I may make my own velcro extender.  It wouldn't be difficult. The Quality looks excellent  My little dog came up to me and I put it on him just to play with him.  How useful this thing could be.  It fit him perfectly.  No matter what kind of coat or sweater I buy him to keep him warm outside, there's always that upper chest where he often does not get the coverage from the elements that I truly want. I have to order larger sweaters to get them to fit around his fluffy tummy and the necks are all open practically down to his little legs.  He's only 25 pounds.  I put this on like a collar.  It covers the exposed chest and neck area around the sweater opening the collar... finally, outsmarted him. He can't get it or now his sweater off either...so he gets bored and moves on.  This will keep his chest and neck area warm.  He doesn't have an undercoat.  He comes back in during his middle of the night run and is absolutely freezing to death.  But no amount of explaining the benefit of a sweater gets thru to him.  This does that trick. and I can whip it right off of him.  Can't wait to try it on a long drive as my neck is the first thing to start aching.  Bet this will keep my neck in a more comfortable position. Oh Wow...Just gotaa yell out from the back of the house to "order you one too."  Can't put anything down for even a minute around here.. I

This runs about right to a little spacious.  Great to lounge in... to answer the door, to step outside for the dogs' to do their business... a run to the mail box... to take out the garbage.  This has got you covered.  I like the weight of the material.  It's not too hot to wear around the house.... Yet, my husband and I have set outside at night on the back porch to watch our little sweeties have some playtime in the yard and to chase a few balls and I was feeling comfy and warm.  The hood even came in handy as it was a little windy one night.  Now that it's colder I've thrown a sweater over it, and I'll pop up the hood to keep from being bothered by the wind.  I plan on getting a couple more of these for my lounging days and nights at home.  I also loved having this when I went to visit my sister and stayed over night.  Felt just fine among our relatives lounging around in this before bed time...  About the only bad thing I could say about it is that if you're really short, under 5'5", you might find this a little long...  If you're a tall gal, you will find this lounger covers you to the floor nicely.  I especially love the zippered front...easy in and out without messing with your hair do.  Fantastic for wearing at the hospital... you'll feel almost dressed.... and easy access with the zipper for listening to your heart  among other things.

While the writing was fine.. this book just couldn't hold my interest long enough to get anywhere with the story.  This was one book I read and read... and wondered when it was going to pick up.... finally I gave up.

This wasn't a very interesting plot line.  It was good enough that I read it to the end, but I lost a little bit of interest as the book was merely her going back and forth and back and forth questioning folks without much interest  The plot seemed contrived too.  The use of the regular characters wasn't as much as in the past and the focus and that made the interludes between interviewing people over and over, even more boring.  It' is okay, but wasn't a page turner... in fact, I got lost several times as to what was going on as one page turn looked like so many others.  It was like..."Now, where were we....?"

This little rolling over dog is cute...  Sometimes it takes more than a little movement to get it going, but both dogs seem to enjoy toying with it.  The little one is a little afraid of it, the larger dog not at all.  In fact, when the little one whines about it moving  and cackling, the larger dog runs right in an snaps it up and carries off to a far corner away from the little one.  The bigger one is a male, but he acts like a momma dog to the baby.  So, it wasn't a rip roaring fun afternoon when it came.  I guess it depends on the reaction you gett.  My dogs had very little reaction.  But they still get it going and are fascinated with it at times.
You can buy this much cheaper at Wally World,  half the price. .  This is a ridiculous price and it makes me angry that people are getting ripped off.

I am retired and stay home a lot.  I live in these type of lounging gowns.  What I particularly like about these are that they are front-zippered.  I like the fact that I can get ready to go somewhere, put on my makeup and do my hair and not have to pull the robe over my head; I also like that the sleeves are roomier that these pictures make them look...which makes it much easier to sit in a chair and twist and turn without dislocating a shoulder or ripping the gown, they are long enough to go to your feet  (but not an exaggerate length, I am 5'5" and the colors are somewhat better than shown...to me.  The material is thinner than I thought, but not too thin for me. If it gets to freezing in here, I might want to wear a sweater over the gowns.. I like the fact that I will not be too warm in these.  I I would feel  comfortable answering the door in these.  Actually there is nothing that I don't like about them and the price is good.  My husband actually likes them better than the moo-moo's that I have been wearing.  He says I look more "dressed" and he thinks they are pretty colors...  Of all of them, I do like the "Blue" and the "Red" the best.  The blue is very good looking and I may order another to have a week's worth of changes here.  The dark turquoise in the patterned one, my husband likes, but I wasn't thrilled.  Still I am keeping it...and this is a good price.  After seeing that one, I wouldn't consider the purple one at all.  But the paisley colors are nice.  I do love the sleeves... tapers a bit towards the wrist... but plenty of room for your wings to stay covered and not bulge.

This is a busy book.  There's just one thing after another going on so you are not bored and literally turning page after page.  Although the main character is a bit ditzy at times and I wouldn't have done things the way she did them, she's very entertaining.  I had one spot of pages in this book where I thought it was dragging... but that quickly changed and I sailed on to the end.  This book would have made a great movie.  Though the book gets serious, there are a lot of laughs in this book.  When I came to the end, they had a few pages of the follow-on series and I started reading that and am ordering the follow-on book... I liked it just that much.

I had a 200 Watt Bulb in a back porch light that excluded me plugging anything else in on that circuit.  If I did, the fuse would blow.  And the 200 Watt Bulb would get very hot so we kept it on for very short periods of time; just enough time to allow the dog outside to do his business so we could see him, and then back in.  This was the least expensive of my options for CFL Bulb.  It is big, but it did fit my lamp, but just barely.  I don't think it's as bright as the regular bulb, but it's pretty darn close.  And now I don't have to worry about plugging something else in on that circuit because this is pulling less power.  So, I love it and I'm getting one for the front porch.  Even though I didn't read anything about them being okay for outside, I've always just put in regular bulbs and there was no problem.  I haven't had a problem with the CFL bulb either.

I love that it has  a zippered up front.  This means that I can do my hair and make up while in this robe and then disrobe when finished to get into my street clothes.  I also like the color... I got read and the weight is medium.  I have ac so it's not too warm, but in the winter I would wear pajamas underneath and still be able to answer the door.  Scarry!!!

I love these and that's why I ordered them...again.  I love my others.  If you want to have pretty feet and your feet are calloused and dry and ugly... This is the mother of all Rasps...  This is going to give you pretty feet... those little tiny things you buy in the drug store are pitiful...useless...  I can't believe I ever thought they were working before I found these.  We''ve all been doing our feet with these and our feet are looking great in our sandals... or just bare....  The difference will absolutely amaze you....  I wish I had seen these ten years ago!!!!  Awesome.

This was just not my cup of tea.  The writing is just fine... I just wasn't into the story  I  I'm not into finances and anything having to do with banks, and loans and marketing....  So, I quit.  You might like though.  Just my personal preference!  Oh, and if I had been the star of this show... I would have never taken this job, never stayed at this job, and ran away as soon as I got my first free lunch!!!

I just couldn't get into this.  The book is one chapter present, next chapter or two past... and more detail than you really want or care to know.  This just went on and on and on and it never seemed to move the plot along.  I just finally gave up... it was too torturous for me.  I like to be "glued" to a book... and  if not that, then at least anxious to turn the next page.  I was neither on this book... what a shame... it looked like the premise was good.  About the only thing I can say good about it was that the author fairly well described the grief process and nailed the emptiness and sad feelings in your heart, and the way your body seems to feel the grief too.  Maybe something else this person has written will be better.. a better story line.  I'm not totally giving up on the author.. just this particular book.

If you buy this you're going to have to cover the steps with some carpet.  I suggest you don't let your dog even try it once without gluing down some carpet on the steps.  My dogs were immediately turned off because the plastic just wouldn't grip with their paws and they were sliding back down.  After that, there was no hope, even after we put the carpet squares down.  Once bitten, twice shy.  There's no explaining to a dog that you "fixed" the problem....  They seem to never forget scratching around in a panic grasping for purchase.  You also have to brace this as it does wiggle a little and doesn't feel steady under neath their feet.  For a little dog.. you should just go ahead and spend the big bucks and get the foam staircase... it worked right from the first time...never a problem.  I should have done that for the second bedroom too.  I'm going to end up giving this away, I'm sure.  Had it for two months and not one of the dogs will go near it.

I received this product free of charge in exchange for an honest unbiased review.It was hard for me to tell from the picture,  how these earrings would look on my ears.  Now that I have them, I realize that the gold ball is behind my ear, but shows from the side.  I reversed the balls and put the while gold ball (which looks like faceted silver) on the back, but the yellow gold ball was to large for me to wear in the front.. of course that is just a matter of personal opinion, some may like the larger ball in front.The white gold faceted ball is very pretty ... it glimmers and looks like there might be some small diamonds on it...there aren't, it is the facets.  I love the look.The reason I gave these earrings 4 stars, is that the site says that they cost $172.72, which in my opinion makes they much too expensive for what they are.  I realize that they are gold, yellow and white, but no way do they look that expensive.  If I saw them in a store I would be willing to pay maybe $50 for them, certainly no more.The major thing that I like about them is that they the balls screw into each other, instead of being just regular posts that push through and can easily come off.  I have lost many posts this way.  These are very secure and will not come out of your ears as long as they are screwed in tight enough.They are comfortable and attractive and I will wear them, but again, I would never pay that much for them.

I received this product free of charge in exchange for an honest unbiased review,I have to admit that I am a bit disappointed with these liners.  In advance I didn't realize that they would completely block the shelves below and I couldn't see the items on it, but this is my fault for not seeing it.  This is especially true for the shelf about the small drawer that holds, cheese, salami, yeast etc..The material is a bit 'fuzzy' and that sort of gives me the creeps when it is sitting on a shelf... don't ask why, I am just funny that way I guess.  The sheets are reversible, one side is a dark red and the other is lighter, white and red lines... which I much prefer over the solid red.I am not going to use them on the shelves themselves, only in the two vegetable drawers and the door shelves.  Only time will tell how well they hold up and I plan to follow the washing directions to a T.I do like that they have no adhesive backing, which of course makes it easier to add or remove.  The weight of the items will keep them in place.  I am going to use some on my dish and glass cupboard shelves.

I received this product free of charge in return for an honest, unbiased review.I hate painting. Not so much the act itself, as the invariable disappointment in the final product. I fully understand that adequate effort must be invested in preparation, before the paint is applied. Unfortunately this knowledge doesnt seem to prevent the typically negative reaction to the end result, esp. after expending that time and attention.When this paint-system showed up, I had a specific job in mind for it.
