If I had to make toast in this oven 2 slices at a time for the entire family, I would either always be late for work or I would be chronically sleep deprived.The instruction manual leaves a lot to be desired in my opinion.  Fortunately, I think the controls on this oven are quite simple and easy to figure out.For me, the major drawback is the size of the toaster oven.  The oven is not much smaller than a counter top microwave oven.  While it is light enough to easily move around, it is large enough where finding a place to store it is not an easy task.I loved the fact that the crumb tray is removable from the outside.  This makes cleaning up all the burnt food bits that fall to the bottom of the oven a breeze.Honestly, this is one of those products I have mixed feelings about.  For me, part of the appeal of a toaster oven is having something that is small enough to fit on top of a counter that I can make small items easily without using my regular oven.  On those hot Midwest summer days where using the regular oven makes it feel like it is 120F in the kitchen, using a small toaster oven is great!  When I sit this on the counter, it is as wide as one of my cabinet doors and it takes up a lot of counter top real estate.I believe this product is great for the right target audience.  If one has limited access to kitchen appliances such as in an office you never leave or in a dorm room, I think this is a great item.  However,  if kitchen space is tight and you are looking for something small, while this seems to be a great

Our initial inspection of the towel in the package was quite favorable.  The towel is brightly colored and the graphic design is quite awesome.  After taking it out of the package, my opinion of the item was much less favorable.My biggest gripe about the towel is the fact that it is super thin.  When I say thin, this towel is thinner than the thin towels you find at cheap, low rent hotels.  The fabric very much reminded my wife and I of the thin fabric that they use in those promotional items that are shaped and you put it in water and it expands into a wash cloth (Magic Pop Up Towel Wash Cloth).The size of the item seems to be geared toward younger children.  Upon seeing the size of the towel, I would not recommend buying it for a child over 5.The physical design of the towel is very simplistic.  The sides of the towel are completely open.  Fold a towel the long way and cut a hole for your head along the folded seam, add a washcloth hood over the hole and you have this poncho towel.Despite the thin, cheap feeling fabric, the towel is absorbent.  It seemed to absorb a fair amount of water and left the skin feeling as dry as one would expect.  I doubt it would hold enough water to dry an adult, but it seemed to work with children just fine.Overall, the graphics on this towel are excellent and very well done.  However, the fabric is thin and the quality of something I would expect to buy from a dollar store.  I am sure others might feel differently, but personally, I would not pay more than $10 for this item.

This is the third Ever After High Thronecoming doll to grace our house, the other two being C.A. Cupid and the other being Raven Queen.  As with other dolls from the Ever After High Thronecoming series, the clothing and overall appearance of this doll is exquisite.  The dress that adorns Apple White is a very attractive multi layer design and her accessories accent her overall look quite well.However, there are two things that I felt were subpar when compared to the other dolls.  The first is Apple Whites forearms.  Her forearms are a slightly different color, which I guess is supposed to simulate gloves.  However, the color just seems off to me.  The color is kind of a translucent white colored that reminds me a lot of the white used in rubber fishing lures.The other thing is that the hair really does not remain nice looking after a minor bit of use.  After 30 days, the dolls hair is ruffled and messy looking.  My kids also report that the glittered strands of hair seem to come out easily.While Apple White is not the greatest, most beautiful doll of the Ever After High Thronecoming series in my opinion, it still is a beautiful doll.  It is definitely a doll that I would feel great about buying as a gift to give or buy my own children.

The setup on this PC was a bit unnerving.  This is the third Window 8.X PC I have setup in the last few months.  I did not time the setup from start to finish on this machine, but what I did not like about the initial setup with this PC is that it seemed to do nothing for several minutes.Once I got back the initial PC setup, the start screen pretty much looked like the any other Windows 8 based PC.  When I went into the desktop mode, I was greeted by a myriad of icons for links and software that were pre-installed on the PC.  I did not see anything that I would deem was of concern, but personally I like my new PCs clean and do not like to have to invest time in a new product to clean it up to use it.I was quite interested in the audio of this computer, given that it was advertized to have audio by Beats.  I was really hoping for crystal clear sound that would blow me away.  In the end, the audio was pretty much the same as every other laptop I have.  I tested the audio with two songs, Cruise by Florida Georgia Line and Ruby Tuesday by the Rolling Stones.  With a higher pitches song like Cruise, the speakers sounded pretty good.  When I put Ruby Tuesday through the speakers, I could tell the speakers really cut out the low end.  With the factory audio on my HP laptop, I can hear the cello playing quite well.  On this PC, the cello is barely audible at all.  So the audio is not bad by any means, but it does not seem any better than my other laptops.The touch screen worked flawless for me.  What I did not care for was the color and the quality of the display.  The display looked faded and washed out.  Looking at photos and videos on the display just is not that impressive.  The screen does seem to be pretty forgiving when it comes to the viewing angle.  The screen is fairly visible from a wide variety of angles.The tablet feature works great; however, using the PC in tablet mode is a bit awkward in my opinion.  The resulting size is about 25% bigger than my full sized iPad when comparing screen area.  Whereas the iPad with cover weighs in at 1 pound 13 ounces, this PC weighs in at 3 pounds 15 ounces.  I am sure the tablet mode would be advantageous to someone for something, but I am not sure to who and for what.  Given the extra size and weight, if I needed a tablet, I would rather use a tablet, not this PC.If you are looking for a cheap, basic laptop, this would probably be a good choice.  I had no issues using this PC for light usage, but nothing stood out to me at excellent either.

I have been working night shift for about the last 10 years.  I tried a number of things to try and block the daylight and get a better nights sleep.  I bought room darkening roller blinds for the windows which helped.  I then got wooden blinds to try and help diffuse the light leaking in from the sides with limited success.  I resorted to putting thick comforters on the curtain rods, which did not thrill my wife at all, but seemed to help quite a bit.I had tried the cheap, low quality sleep masks given to me by the airlines when travelling in business or first class to Asia when I used to travel for a living and I did not care for them.  I thought I would give a sleep mask another try.  I looked for what appeared to be a good quality sleep mask and settled on the Dream Essentials Sweet Dreams Contoured Sleep MaskMy initial impressions of the sleep mask were excellent.  When I first started using it, the sleep mask blocked out 100% of the light.  No matter how hard I tried, I could not see light anywhere in the mask.  Not being used to the mask, I did find the elastic band a bit tight at times.  There definitely is a bit of an adjustment period for that.  The part of my head the strap would rest against would actually ache in the morning when I was first getting used to it.  After a few weeks I was used to it and it no longer bothered me.After several months, I noticed that I would be getting light leaking through the bottom of my mask around my nose.  As goofy as it sounds, I had to remind myself to look straight when going to sleep and the light did not bother me.  The light peeking through is a bit annoying.  In a strange way, I felt attracted to look at it, kind of like those bugs in the movie Wreck It Ralph.Over the year, the elastic strap did require adjusting as the elastic wore out to the point I cannot get it much tighter with the Velcro on the strap.  After about a year of daily usage, the fabric is coming off the inside of the mask.  The mask is still useable, but I am getting a new one because the fabric bunches up and can get uncomfortable.After a year, I am a convert.  I use my sleep mask every night and this is the best I have slept in years.  My wife turns on the bedroom lights in the morning as she gets ready for work and the kids ready for school and I sleep through it all.In a way, the mask can be addicting though.  I did not take my mask with me on my trip to Alaska this summer as when I go to bed at a normal time, the early morning sunlight had never bothered me before.  Without my sleep mask, I was up as soon as the sun was out, which was a bit of a drag.If for one reason or another, light is preventing you from getting a good nights sleep, then I highly recommend this mask with the caveat that the mask only lasts a limited time before it starts to fall apart.  Personally, I wore out my first one and am happily buying a second.

This is the second Ever After High Thronecoming doll that has graced our house.Much like the other Ever After High Thronecoming doll we have, the manufacturer did not skimp on the details.  The dress that comes with the doll is astounding.  All aspects of the doll, from her shoes to her hairclip all have little details that seem to make the doll stand out from most other dolls in my kids collection.The only downfall I have seen with this doll is the hair and the hairstyle.  I am not sure if it is the wings that Raven comes with or if it is how the hair is held in place, but the hair on the doll started to pull out of its style immediately after we removed the doll from its box.  After a few weeks of use, much of the hair has pulled out of the hairstyle, giving the doll a wild, unkept look.Overall, this doll has awesome detail and will surely make any little girl happy.  If it was not for the hairstyle falling apart so quickly, I would say this is easily a 5 star product.  Given the problem with the hair, I am giving the doll 4 stars.

This is my first Alienware PC.  When I opened up the box, I have to say I thought the overall Alien theme is pretty cool.I found the package included a desktop computer, a keyboard, an optical mouse, a power supply, and a cool alien sticker.  There are two DVDs, one indicating it is the Dell OS Recovery DVD and the other is labeled an Alienware X51 R2 Resource DVD.  The only instructions I found was a small quick start pamphlet, which is only good if you have never set up a PC before.The initial setup was quite easy.  I had a monitor (the unit does not come with a monitor), my password for the wireless router, and my Microsoft account.  From opening the box, connecting everything, and powering the PC up was a mere 6 minutes.  From power-up to completely done was another 9 minutes for a total setup time of 15 minutes.I was unaware of what the Alienware Resource DVD was so I popped it in the PC after the initial setup.  I got a screen indicating that the DVD contained Dell Drivers and Utilities.  I selected my OS and indeed the DVD contains the Alienware Command Center and various drivers used on the PC.The PC itself has an attractive, sleek design.  I personally loved how the aliens eyes light up when the PC is powered on.I knew that Alienware comes with the Alien Command Center.  Perhaps it is my unfamiliarity with Windows 8.1 or perhaps I am just getting old and my PC knowledge is getting dated, but for the life of me, I could not find how to access the Command Center. I resorted to installing it from the Alienware Resource DVD and created a shortcut to the desktop.  I was able to access it after that to tune various aspects of the PC and change the lighting scheme.The performance of the PC seems quite good, but I am not a high level gamer.  I was not completely blown away by the quickness of the system, but it still seems to be a decent quality system.  I did love the fact there are a large number and variety of ports on the PC, a huge improvement over the on-sale PCs I have picked up at brick and mortar stores when I suddenly had a PC die on me.Overall, this PC is an attractive unit with pretty good performance.  If you are looking for a PC just to surf the internet, then there are much more cost effective options on the market.  If you are looking for a higher performance PC, then I think this is one to consider.

Update:  To be fair to Dell, for now, I am leaving my initial review and rating unchanged as I have not had a chance to run this issue by their customer support.  I hope to do that in a week or so.  This PC has been experiencing Wi-fi issues on a more frequent basis.  Standard fixes such as running System Restore and updating the wi-fi driver from the Dell have proven ineffective.  I confirmed that the issue is not limited to my home network as I took the PC on a trip and the same problem happened on multiple networks.  I will adjust my review and star rating depending on Dell Support's response and ability to remedy the issue.  The PC will lose connectivity to the attached wi-fi network.  Fixes range from the PC resetting the wi-fi adapter to having to power cycle the PC.  Connectivity ranges from minutes to hours.  I just want potential buyers to beware of the issue I am currently having so they can make an informed decision.  I'm not sure if this PC can be connected to a router or modem device via a wire.  There is no RJ45 port.I am not a PC aficionado by any means.  To me, a PC is a tool that is used to get work done.  The brand of PC I buy usually depends on what is on whenever my current PC decides to die.  However, when I opened the box on this laptop, I have to say the unit just seems to scream quality.When closed, the laptop roughly measures 12.5 inches by 9.75 inches with a closed thickness of roughly 0.5 inches.  I put the laptop on the kitchen scale and it weighed in at 4 pounds, 8 ounces.The screen casing and housing in the keyboard area are constructed out of a lightweight metal, which to me is an excellent upgrade over the cheaper plastic casings found on most laptops.  The bottom of the laptop does indeed appear to be a weaved carbon fiber material or a material that resembles it.  As advertised, this material does seem to stay a bit cooler than conventional materials.  After having the laptop on my lap for several hours, the unit is warm but far from hot to the touch.I found setup of the PC quick and easy.  Armed with the password to my wireless router and a Microsoft account, I was able to go from powering the PC up to surfing the internet in just under 10 minutes.The unit comes installed with Windows version 8.1.  Rating the Windows OS version is beyond the scope of this review, but I will say that I am not fond of the Windows 8.X series operating systems.  If you have not used Windows 8 in the past, prepare for a bit of a learning curve.  It is easy enough to perform basic functions on, but I find it difficult to change PC settings after years of using older Windows versions.The display, color, and resolution on this computer is astounding.  To check the color and resolution, I viewed a recent picture we took in Canada of a young light brown colored bear eating clover and dandilions and the colors really looked incredible.  The same with some photos of an area known as Miles Canyon.  The colors are gorgeous and very lifelike.The touch screen functionality seems to be accurate and has almost worked flawlessly.  I did run into a hiccup where it quit working that I will mention later.I put about 11 years worth of digital photos and videos on the PC, totaling 33540 individual files.  This amount of data took up a mere 16% of the 1TB harddrive.The speaker is located at the front bottom of the laptop.  To me, this seems to really make the quality of the audio variable depending on what the laptop is sitting on.  I have listen to the same song with the PC sitting on my lap and different surfaces and the audio quality ranged from good to excellent.The keyboard on the unit is a bit different.  At first, it seems small and a bit awkward.  It does take a bit of getting used to.  I personally did not care for the PgUp and PgDn buttons as they require a "function" button sequence to access.In roughly the month we have used this laptop, we did encounter 2 issues.  At one point, the wi-fi quit with an error indicating the wi-fi adapter was disabled.  After searching the internet and looking for an on/off switch for the wi-fi, the issue was resolved with the Network troubleshooting assistant in windows.The second issue was the touch screen quit working.  This was remedied with a reboot of the system.Overall, this laptop seems like an excellent, high-quality product.  If you are looking for a light, high-end laptop, this PC is definitely worth consideration.

As I have stated in similar reviews, I do not play with dolls and would not admit it on the internet if I did.  So I turned the doll over to my 3 children and let them play with it.  This is what they had to say:8 year old:  When I asked them what they thought about the doll, they told me, "It is good".  They also commended that her bangs were stiff like they were full of hairspray.  They also went on to say that the mask did not stay on the dolls hand too well and when the mask was on the dolls hand, it was hard to bring the mask to their face.  Overall, they did like the doll and they gave it 4 stars.6 year old:  They said the doll was nice.  However, they seemed to be hung up about the fact glitter coming out of her hair and getting all over everything.  She was a bit more unforgiving and gave the doll 3 stars.10 year old:  My 10 year old really like the doll.  However, they said that they thought the arms are hard to move.  They liked that the dress was big and there was a lot of details put into the doll.  They also said they really like how their makeup is done.  They gave it 4 stars.My wife and I examined the doll.  One thing we tried and thought it was worth mentioning is that Barbie clothes are much too big on the doll.  If you have mass amount of Barbie clothes, they will not work on this doll.  Also, the shoes are very difficult to remove.  This can either be a positive or a negative.  Personally I do not think this is a bad thing.  The dolls hair gets caught on the wings and kind of gets messed up as a result as well.Overall, this seems to be very high quality product.  I think the craftsmanship in the dress is excellent and the details in the makeup on the face is impressive.  Personally, I give the doll 5 stars.  Averaging the families ratings, we get a mean rating of 4 stars.

When I received this item, to say my 3 children were excited is an understatement.  While I had never seen this Barbie set before, the kids seemed to know exactly what it was and were very excited.I began assembly and putting stickers on the unit.  From beginning to end, to assemble the camper and put all the stickers on took 46 minutes.  I found assembly fairly easy, but a bit tedious.  A few pieces took me a little time to figure out exactly where they went, but assembly went smoothly overall.Being that I do not particularly care to play with Barbies, I turned the camper over to my three children to evaluate.10 year old:  The only complaints they had was that the chandelier came apart on them once, though they were able to reassemble it.  They also mentioned it was difficult to store the dishes and snap them in place.  They loved the fact there were a lot of beds and the camper came with food.  They specifically mentioned how they liked the lemonade dispenser and how it looks like it drains.  They gave the camper 4.5 stars8 year old:  They informed me that they really liked the fact there were lots of beds, but thought there should be 4 beds instead of 3 as there are 4 Barbie sisters.  They thought it would be nice if the bathroom was a bit bigger and wished the camper set included a doll.  They liked how the food and such snapped into place so it would not move.  They loved how everything folds up and can be stored in the camper, but indicated that it can be hard to arrange everything so it all fits.  They gave the camper 4.5 stars.6 year old:  They loved the set overall, but wondered why there was only 1 blanket for 3 beds.  They brought up an interesting point that when the camper is folded up, there is no floor or bottom.  They told me that sometimes when the camper is closed up, sometimes things will fall out the bottom while they are playing with it (I did not notice this at first, but there definitely are gaps in the bottom).  They gave the camper 5 stars.Again, while I did not play much with the unit, I will say that my initial impression of the Dreamhouse Camper was quite positive.  I thought the unit was well designed and constructed very well.  The only thing that I did not do it for me was the detachable cab.  The kids like it, but it seems to be a strange aspect of the design to me.  I noticed that even after having the Dreamhouse Camper for several weeks, the kids are still playing with it on a daily basis and is one of their favorite toys.  I give the camper 5 stars.Overall, I think this is a great toy and one my kids love!  With as much fun as my 3 children have had with this toy, I feel that the Dreamhouse Camper is well worth the current price of $90.  Averaging my family's ratings together, I get a mean rating of 4.75 stars which I will happily round up to 5 stars!

With three young girls at home, one being a huge Monster High fan, the kids were quite excited and had high hopes for this playset.  After getting a lecture from my 8 year old on the difference between Monster High and Ever After High and the origins of Briar Beauty, I realized I was in over my head and just moved onto the assembly portion on the set.Assembly for me took just under 20 minutes.  I had no specific issues except I did not realize the "spine" of the book was actually a storage area where the bed was stored.  Also, the railing at the very top of the set was missing in my set, or it is hidden well enough that I never found it.  While I did not spend any time playing with the set, my impression of the set was not very favorable.  To me, the set seemed flimsy and not very sturdy.  I then turned it over to my three children to test.8 year old:  My eight year old really liked the doll and accessories.  However, they specifically said that they thought the house "was a mess".  They also commented that it was hard to get the mask on the doll.  They gave the set 3 stars, attributing most of the rating toward the doll, which they loved.10 year old:  Their exact words are "I wouldn't give this as a present to anyone."  They hated the fact the DJ stand in the house was made out of paper and they felt the set would not withstand any significant usage.  They also mentioned they thought the hands pop off the doll real easy.  They gave the set 1 star.6 year old:  Similar to my 10 year old, my 6 year old did not like the fact the DJ stand was made out of paper.  They commented that it was really hard to get the doll in the DJ stand and have the DJ stand keep the right shape.  They only gave the set 1 star as well.Personally, I do think the set feels cheap and I am disappointed that it came missing a piece.  I will give the set some kudos for the overall design, how the bed is stored, and how compact the set can become for storage.  However, I was just not impressed with the execution of the idea.  If I had paid the current price of $49.99, I would have felt a little ripped off.  I would give the set 3 stars, but I am deducting a star for the missing piece, giving the set a rating of 2 stars.After having the set for several weeks, it pretty much sits on the side unplayed with.  My children also got the Barbie Sisters Life in The Dreamhouse Camper around the same time and that playset is still being used on a daily basis while this one collects dust.Averaging all our ratings together, as a family, we gave the set a mean rating of 1.75 stars which I will round up to 2 stars.

When I grabbed one of these bags and shook it open, I have to admit, I did not have high expectations.  The bags looked cheap, felt cheap, and sounded cheap.  Given that, I was expecting a poor performing trash bag that would rip and fall apart easily.Right before our weekly trash pickup, I grabbed one of these bags and began to make the trash rounds around the house.  I emptied every garbage can I had into the bag and then dumped all the litter from the guinea pig cage into the bag.  By the time all was said and done, I put the bag on the scale and found that I had just over 25 pounds of trash in the bag.  A corner of a cardboard box and a discarded plastic hanger poked through the bag, but even with the weight and the holes in the bag, the trash bag did not tear any further and remained intact.While my initial impression of the product was a poor one, the bags held together quite well.  If you have a need for large trash bags, these are worth a try.

I will be the first to admit that I have not cooked on cast iron in years.  After the negative press that nonstick cookware has gotten in recent years, I was interested in trying to cook with cast iron once again.I unpacked the unit and the first thing I noticed is the out of place handle on the lid.  The handle of the lid is a porcelain coated knob that is screwed into the top of the lid.  The screw securing mine seems to come loose awfully easy.  Personally, this gives me a bit if an uneasy feeling as I do not like the loose feeling when I am dealing with hot metal.The inside and outside of the unit is rough textured.  This is different than the cast iron pans I remember which I recall tended to have a much smoother cooking surface.  I seasoned the unit prior to first use and despite the rough surface, I had no issues with food sticking to or cleaning the cooking surface.What I did not care for is that the dutch oven has edges.  While these edges were not sharp, I thought they gave the unit a very unfinished appearance.  The top of the pot portion is rounded much like I would expect it, but the edges of the handles and the cover have a sharp, unfinished look.Finally, the lid does not seem to be perfectly round.  A few spots on the edges are flattened.  It appears that lid was cast that way as I did not see any deformation in the metal, but it gives the appearance that the lid was dropped and dented.Overall, I had no problem cooking with or cleaning the dutch oven, so in my opinion, the unit is completely functional.  However, I think it falls a bit short in the looks department.  I am sure how their cat iron cookware looks is a minor point to some people, but I just think the unit looks hurried and unfinished.

This is one of those rare products that I really have nothing bad to say about.  If you are looking for a small table to use in bed or while sitting upright in a couch or large chair, this is definitely one to consider.The area of the table is roughly about the same size as a TV tray (for those old enough to remember), maybe even a bit larger.  The surface of the table is actually 2 pieces, a solid piece which is about 1/3rd of the table and a hinged piece which is about 2/3rds of the table area.The hinged area folds up and has a metal bar in the back to hold it in place at 1 of 6 possible positions.  There are two holes drilled in the bottom of the table, to which a removable strip of wood can be inserted.  In the event you are using a laptop or book while that portion of the table is in the tilted position, the item will not slide off.  When this portion of the table is not elevated, it is held into the closed position by a magnet.The legs of the table fold underneath the table for easy storage.  The legs on each side can be adjusted which helps keep the tray level.  We found this an awesome feature when trying to serve breakfast in bed.  You can adjust one side higher than the other to make the table level and account for the person lying in bed slightly compressing the mattress on one side more than the other.There is a small drawer on the right side, which I use for storing the wooden strip when not in use.  The drawer can stick a little bit at times.  The drawer is not very big.  With the wooden piece in there, I can fit a few pens and a pack of Post-its if needed.Overall, I think this is an excellent product.  It is sturdy and well built.  The little drawer to store the removable wooden strip was a great idea to prevent the end user from losing it.  Whether it is for using a laptop in bed, serving someone breakfast in bed, or to work on a craft while sitting in a recliner, this table is versatile and an awesome design.

I am reviewing this mattress from two perspectives, my own and my oldest daughters.  My bed has a high end latex mattress we spent several thousand on at the time.  My daughter is the one with the full sized bed and her mattress was the $200 mattress we got from the local warehouse store.The mattress was shipped via a nationwide cargo carrier.  In my case, the mattress was shipped only wrapped in a heavy plastic bag.  However, the mattress did arrive clean and damage free.I slept on the mattress for about a week.  My overall impression of the mattress was highly favorable.  The mattress is on the firm side.  However, despite being firm, the mattress envelops you slightly.  I am guessing this is the plush and gel layers.  This gives you a firm, yet comfortable surface to sleep on that seems to hug and caress the body.The mattress seems to be well crafted.  There are no pressure points or springs that I could feel when I was laying down on the mattress.The mattress does transfer some motion, but nowhere near as much as some of the older, cheaper mattresses in our house.  I laid down on the mattress and had two kids jump up and down on the other side of the bed.  While I could feel some motion, it did not feel like a lot.  I would guess a partner rolling out of bed in the morning would disturb me slightly, but probably would not wake me up.The only thing that I have to say about the mattress that is somewhat negative is that I am not sure that I buy the cooling factor of the mattress.  I did not feel any cooler on this mattress than I did on my latex mattress.I then handed the mattress over to my 11 year old.  In her words, it is nice and it keeps her cooler.  I pressed her for more details.  She said that she likes it a lot better than her previous mattress (the $200 mattress from a warehouse store).  Finally, she says she gets a good nights sleep on the mattress and reports sleeping better in this mattress than her old mattress.Overall, both my daughter and I really liked this mattress.  I really liked the fact it is firm yet very comfortable and is wonderful to sleep on.  Personally, if I paid $1000 for this mattress, I would feel that it was worth the money.  I would highly recommend this mattress to anyone who likes sleeping on a firm mattress

My wife and kids love popcorn and have used various popcorn seasonings at times.  I thought Kernel Seasons Cheesy Variety Pack might be a nice treat for the family.  When I received the seasonings, I popped some microwave popcorn and set up a taste testing with me and my three kids (10, 8, and 6).  All the kids were asked to try the products without their siblings present to get different opinions from each.Nacho Cheedar:  I tried this and did not think it was terrible.  It is the strongest flavored in my opinion, but I found the flavor artificial tasting.  It is a bit salty on its own, but I did not find it overly salty on the popcorn as long as I did not add additional salt.  All three of my children pretty much had the same comment.  None of them really thought it tasted like Nacho.  Everyone in my family gave it 3 stars out of 5.White Cheddar:  This is by far the family favorite.  I found the seasoning to have a nice cheesy flavor with a slightly sweet finish.  The flavor is not as overpowering as the Nacho Cheddar, but is much stronger than the Garlic Parmesan.  While the flavor was good to me, it seemed similar to every other White Cheddar flavored product on the snack market.  All three of my children thought it had a good flavor with my 8 year old saying it was very yummy.  My 10 year old gave it 4.5 stars, my 8 year old 4.5 stars, and my 6 year old 5 stars.  Personally, I give the White Cheddar a solid 4 stars.Garlic Parmesan:  This is the most subtle flavored of the three.  I could taste subtle hints of garlic.  The flavoring reminded me of a cheap, powdery alfredo sauce.  My 10 year old really liked it, but it took a lot to get a good taste she said.  My two younger children really did not think it was garlicy at all.  My 10 year old gave it 3 stars, my 8 year old 3.5 stars, and my 6 year old 3 stars.  I gave it 4 stars, but I did agree with my 10 year old that it took a lot of seasoning to get a good flavor.While the kids did not have glowing reviews during my taste testing, I could not help but notice that they used the seasonings often with their popcorn and seemed to like it.Taking all the ratings for each product given by each person and figuring out the mean rating, I came up with the value of 3.63 stars.Overall, the flavors are not perfect.  However, the product really seems to add a fun, tasty element to popcorn that the kids really seemed to like.  For that, I am rounding it up to 4 stars.

We have an elderly dog that has a bit of a urinary incontinence problem.  While we are getting the issue under control with medications, there are occasional accidents, usually on his bedding during the night.  We normally used All Stainlifters Free and Clear Laundry Detergent, 150 Oz and it did not eliminate the urine odors at all.We then used All Free and Clear and used OdoBan Odor Eliminator - RTU Spray W/1 Gallon Concentrate in the rinse cycle and this proved to work quite well at eliminating all the undesirable odors.We then decided to try Tide Plus Febreeze.  While I did not expect the detergent to get rid of all the odors on its own, I decided it was worth a try.The next time the dog had an accident, we laundered the dogs bedding using the Tide Plus Febreeze and nothing else.When I smelled the contents of the bottle, I was not particularly impressed.  To me, it smelled like someone mixed some spring/flowery air freshener with a bottle of vodka.  I dumped the recommended amount in the washing machine with warm water and the soiled dog bedding.The product did to quite an exceptional job with removing the urine odors.  By the time I put the bedding through the dryer, the scent on the bedding was a pleasant, slightly floral, fresh air scent.  There was barely the slightest hint of urine odor.  This product did as well as using Odo-Ban in the rinse cycle.Personally, I think Tide Plus Febreeze has done a better job of stain removal than our normal detergent, All Free and Clear.Overall, I am quite pleased at the detergents ability to clean and mask/eliminate odors.  If you have to deal with smelly, dirty items that need to be washed, I would highly recommend giving Tide Plus Febreeze a try.

I frequently use kitchen scales to measure portion sizes.  As what is accepted as a portion in America has gotten bigger, so has my waistline.  Personally, I found that weighing out portions for me has been an effective way to help me lose weight.This scale is a basic food scale.  The scale has a glass top and a plastic housing.  The glass top is not removable, which can make it a bit difficult to clean underneath the platform, but not too bad.  The plastic housing sounds cheap and hollow, but has held up very well in the 45 days or so I have been using the scale.The scale measures both in pounds/ounces and in grams.  I grabbed several different items and they all weighed in right where I would expect.  A 10 pound bag of flour weighed in at 9lb 15.6 ounces.  A 5 pound weight was 5 pounds, 0.3 ounces, and a 2.5 pound weight was 2 pounds, 6.9 ounces.  A stick of butter weighs in at 4.1 ounces.  The weights were consistent with our other scale.The scale weighs consistently.  When an item is removed and is put back on the scale, the weight does not change.One of the things I liked the most was the fact the scale uses standard AAA batteries.  I have had a scale that used CR2032 button cells.  This necessitated buying overpriced button cells locally when the batteries ran out or mail ordering them at a good price and waiting.  I really like the fact this scale uses batteries that I use in other things.The only drawback I found with this scale is that it seems liquid can get behind the display easily.  A small spill resulted in condensation behind the display.  The condensation evaporated away from behind the display within a few days though and there seemed to be no effect on the scale.If you are looking for a basic, accurate, and reliable scale, then I would highly recommend this one.

1:19 MinsThroughout my adult life, I have used cheap hoses and cheap hose carts.  In my recent Vine review of the Scotts SMF58050CC MaxFlex Premium Heavy Duty Garden Hose, I learned that cheap hoses just are not worth the hassle.  With the Yard Butler Hose Truck, I learned that cheap plastic hose carts are just a pain to deal with compared to this product.From unboxing the product to completion of assembly was about 20 minutes for me.  To assemble the unit, I ended up using a large socket and ratchet (I used a 24mm which was slightly too big if I recall, but it was the best fit I had handy), a crescent wrench, and a phillips screwdriver.  While assembly was not difficult, it was not the easiest either.  The directions were fairly simple to follow.The first thing that caught my attention was the wheels.  Right off, I could tell the inner tube in the wheels was bulging and the wheels were out of round.  As this cart is not being towed down an interstate at 70 MPH, this is a minor point.  However, what I really did not care for was that if the wheels were secured tightly to the frame, they would not turn.  It seems the bolt puts pressure directly on the rim of the tire.  The result are tires that do not wobble but also will not turn or tires that turn and are loose and wobbly.Once assembled, the cart is quite nice.  As I show in the video, after 30 days, the connector with the hose is starting to rust already.  I am unsure if this is due to poor quality materials or if it is a reaction between the metal in the hose and the hose fitting on the cart.  The cart does feel sturdy once assembled and does make moving my hose from the back yard to the front quite easy.While the unit does seem to be well built, in my opinion it is far from great.  When I was at Sams Club the other day, I stopped and took a look at their hose cart that they sell for about $80.  Their cart had the right angle piece at the point where the short hose connects between the spigot and the hose cart which takes a lot of pressure off the hose.  The wheels on the cart I looked at did not bulge and were secured tightly while still being easy to turn.  Their hose cart pulled like a wagon instead of being pushed like this unit, but their design had 1 axle that moved left and right when pulled, making it very easy to pull around.I think that this unit is nice, but it could use some improvements.  If I lived in a remote area and there were no other alternatives I could buy, then this unit is not a bad unit by any means.  Conversely, if I had the choice between this unit and the $80 cart at Sams Club, I would take the Sams Club unit.

I will be the first to admit that it has been years since I have used speed hurdles or a speed ladder.  However, with three young children interested in sports, I thought it would be something worth trying once again.The SKLZ Elevation 2-in-1 Speed Hurdles and Ladder has been a fun and so far durable tool for my 3 young children to use.  When I first set this product up, I have to admit that I had some concerns about the durability of the Speed Hurdles/Ladder.  The cross members seemed a bit flimsy, especially when propped up in the hurdle position.  So far, it has survived the onslaught of my 10, 8, and 6 year old daughters.  When they have stepped on a cross member in the up position, there seems to be enough give in the member to help prevent breakage.When broken down, the product consists of 5 rectangular pieces, each measuring roughly 26 inches by 18 inches.  There is a small, drawstring, nylon type bag to store the hurdles/ladder in when not in use.  When collapsed, the product is roughly the size of two pizza boxes side by side.The sides of the hurdles/ladder are connected together by a stretchable cord, which allows for fast assembly and breakdown.  Moving the product from a ladder to hurdles is simply pushing the side pieces together or pulling them apart.I have used other SKLZ products in the past and they seem to be a decent balance of quality, ease of use, and ease of storage.  This product is no exception.  While it seems a bit flimsy, the kids have not yet broken it.  At 250 pounds, I stepped on a cross member in the hurdle position and it did not break.While only time will tell if this product will remain durable after months of use, so far it seems quite promising.

In my youth, I was a full contact Tae Kwon Do fighter.  As I have aged, I have little to no desire to take a swing at anything that has the potential of hitting back.  However, I am still happy to throw down with the heavy bag on a daily basis.  After talking with a friend who is a boxer, I opted to move up to the 16 ounce boxing style gloves over the much lighter MMA style gloves I was using previously.I picked up a pair of 16 ounce TITLE Boxing Pro Style Leather Training Gloves and was very happy with them.  Then, I was given the opportunity to try the Venum Challenger 2.0 Boxing Gloves and I thought it would be fun to compare.Upon unwrapping the Venum gloves, the first thing I notice is the logo and artwork on the gloves.  I really do like the snake on the Velcro strap, but I thought the Venum logo screen across the glove was a bit much.  I find this a minor detail as I have never had someone stop me in mid fight to compliment or criticize the logo/artwork on my gear.The gloves are made from PU leather, so they do have a slight plastic odor to them out of the box.  The feel of the exposed surface is much like feeling a stiff, cheap leather product.My hands are neither large nor heavy in mass.  The jeweler who made my wedding ring even went as far to call my hands slender and lady like.  Even with average sized hands, I thought the hand compartment of the Venum gloves was smaller than I was expecting.  By the time I added wraps to my hands, I thought the hand compartment was a bit snug, but not uncomfortably so.  However, I think this could be an issue if a person has large, meaty hands.The gloves themselves are a bit stiff.  Again, I would not call it uncomfortably so.  I guess this comes down to personal preference.  While my TITLE gloves are softer and more supple, there is something about the Venum gloves and the stiffness that I like the feel of when working the heavy bag.Over the last 6 weeks or so, I have used these most days of the week on the heavy bag.  After inspecting the gloves today, I see no signs of tearing or signs of the seams coming apart.  The Venum logo on the glove still looks good.  For the most part, these gloves still look brand new.I put the gloves on a scale and there was roughly an ounce difference between the two gloves.  One glove weighed in at 15.85 ounces and the other glove weighed in at 16.75 ounces.Overall, I have been fairly happy with these gloves.  The only caveat I would offer with these gloves is that if you have large hands, the fit might be a bit tight.  Personally, I am happy with the fit, how the gloves have protected my hands, and how the gloves have worn so far.

The last set of plates I purchased was $100 for a 16 piece set.  My original set was the Oneida Adriatic Blue set.  While it was a beautiful set in my opinion, the plates kept overheating and breaking in the microwave, despite being labeled as microwaveable.  After losing most of 1 set of the Oneida plates, I had the opportunity to try this set.  I was curious about the quality of a set that was 1/4th the cost of the Oneida plates.My first impression of the set was that the pieces feel quite light in weight, which initially caused me concern.  The pieces are plain yet are attractive.  I used the pieces for about 6 weeks and the plates have undergone regular use.  After weeks of being eaten off of, microwaved, and put through the dishwasher.  After weeks of use, most of the dishes still appear flawless.The only complaint I have so far about the set is that the ring on the bottom of the plates seem to chip easily.  Several of the plates have chipped on this ring.  The chips range from small to quite noticeable.  Despite the chips on the bottom, the viewable surface remain in perfect condition on my set so far.Overall, if you are looking for an affordable, simple, nice looking set of dinnerware of decent quality, I think this is definitely a set worth considering.  As long as the design is attractive to the individuals taste, this is a set I would recommend without hesitation.

As I have gotten older, the traditional razor and shaving cream method of shaving irritates my skin and prevents me from shaving more than every 2nd or 3rd day.  Electric shavers do not irritate my skin as much, but I had never been satisfied with the quality of the shave.  I had tried various Norelco three head shavers in the past and have been less than satisfied.  Over the years, I settled on a Remington foil type shaver with better results, but it still did not do a great job.  Finally, I just gave up on the idea of shaving everyday.  The last electric shavers I tried would be considered ancient by todays standards.Then I had the opportunity to try Phillips Norelco YS521/41 Click & Style Shave Toolkit.  It had been years since I tried an electric shaver and I wanted to see how the technology has changed over the last decade.I made my final shave with a blade and the next morning I popped on the shave head and proceeded with my morning shave.  I have to say I was incredibly impressed with the results.  While the resulting shave was not blade shave close, it was still a very close shave with hardly any missed whiskers and very few scratchy, stubbly spots.  I have used the shaver most days of the week for a month and have still not recharged the shaver.The only complaint that I have with this electric shaver is that it seems to do an exceptionally poor job with longer whiskers.  The shaver has a tough time dealing with a 2 day beard growth.  I usually have to resort to a blade shave before using the electric shaver again.I then tried the body groomer attachment.  The body groomer takes a little practice do be able to groom yourself without scratching yourself and pulling the hair.  The body groomer attachment works OK.  The foil does not seem to get a close shave of the body hair in my opinion, but I am not 100% sure it is meant to.I played with the beard trimmer a bit, but I do not have a beard.  I tried it on body hair before using the body groomer attachment.  The beard trimmer is easily adjustable and seems to do an OK job.  Not having a beard, I cannot give it a thorough review though.As an electric shaver, I think this product is outstanding.  I was very pleased with the shave I got using this product.  The rest of the attachments seem to be all right.  I think this kit is a solid 4 star product.

I will the first to admit, I am behind the times.  My light on the aquarium was still the old fluorescent tube.  This always made the aquarium orange and dingy looking.  I had the opportunity to try the AquaticLife Edge 36 inch LED aquarium light.When I received the light, my first light was not operational.  The light would cycle through a lighting sequence, but nothing ever appeared on the display where the time should be.  I emailed the customer support address included in the instructions.  I received a reply within several hours.  I called and spoke with a wonderful gentleman from their support team who determined the product I received had a fault and immediately send out a replacement light and a return label.The second light worked exactly as it was supposed to.  The directions to operate the light cover one-half of one side of a sheet of paper.  The directions do not do a very good job explaining how to operate the light.  The light has three channels.  The first channel is a combination of reds, blues, and whites.  By my count, there are 7 blue LEDs, 11 Red LEDs, and 24 white LEDs on channel 1.  Channel 2 consists of 42 white LEDs.  The Moonlight channel consists of 3 Blue LEDs.  Each of the channels are run on independent timers and can be run in any combination with each other.The light has a sunrise/sunset option, which makes the lights turn on and turn off over a period of time set by the user.Overall, I am quite happy with this product.  Despite having a defective product at first, the companys customer support was helpful and a pleasure to work with.  The light seems like a quality product and the LEDs are very bright.  The only issue I had with the product is the instructions.  I think the product would benefit from a longer instruction pamphlet that would explain what the various channels do, when you might want to use each channel, and how exactly the sunrise/sunset function works.  The channels and functions are easy enough to figure out, but it would be nice to have documentation explaining what does what.  Personally, I would recommend this product without hesitation.

I am nowhere near as fit as I once was and my knowledge of exercise is becoming old and dusty.  As I try to get back into shape, I thought some exercise videos might help break up the exercise routine a bit.  After reading about RIPPED, I thought it might be something I would like to try.I will not waste time giving the background on what RIPPED is.  To me, an exercise video serves two purposes, to instruct and help motivate.  The million dollar question to me is does this video to this?I am not a trainer and I will even go as far to say my knowledge of exercises is limited.  Many of these moves I could not even tell you if the instructors demonstrated correctly.  However, in my opinion, most things were demonstrated well enough for me to do them.  The part I did not care for was the endurance section.  In my youth, I was a martial arts fighter.  When I viewed the tutorial for the endurance portion, I thought the portion involving the punching techniques could have been explained much better.  What I thought would have been highly beneficial was if they explained the footwork behind the punches.  I also thought they should have stressed control in punching techniques, but that is just me.  The purpose of the video is to exercise, not to train someone to be in the ring.The exercises in the video range from slow and easy to fast and complex.  As with any new activity, learning the moves takes time.  The first few times, I definitely felt like I was messing everything up and felt uncoordinated.  I still feel a bit on the uncoordinated side, but it is getting better.Does this video motivate me?  To be honest, I find the instructors too cheery for my taste.  As with most videos, the participants seem to be tight and well muscled.  There are a few token large people like me, but they are in the back and largely unseen IMHO.I do think the video provides a decent workout for the average person.  I find that I am quite tired as the video was nearing the end and to be honest.Overall, RIPPED seems to be a decent exercise video.  It is now something I have incorporated into my exercise routine and incorporate it once or twice a week.

When I saw that this product was labeled as a science lab, I was under the impression that the product would contain everything you needed to conduct a series of simple science experiments.  I was quite shocked when I opened the box and basically found 4 containers, a spoon, a couple molds, a mini toilet, a bubble wand, and a book.My daughters and I began playing with the set on a whim one day (still thinking at least some ingredients were included).  After finding out the set included nothing except the containers and the book, I started flipping through the book.  The book contains a series of 20 simple experiments and 6 secondary experiments (a second experiment you can do with the results of the first).  Some experiments are fun yet scientific based, while others are just included for the gross factor.  The time required to conduct the experiments vary from instant to hours.  The problem I ran into was the fact I had all the ingredients on hand for very few experiments.So what ingredients are needed?Experiment #1:  Baking soda, vinegar, food coloring, and waterExperiment #2:  Dry yeast, sugar, and waterExperiment #3:  Food coloring, unflavored gelatin, light corn syrup, and waterExperiment #4:  Borax, white glue, food coloring, and waterExperiment #5:  Garlic, dish soap, rubbing alcohol, and water.  A garlic press is recommendedExperiment #6:  Garlic and water.  A garlic press and a balloon are required.Experiment #7:  Corn starch, chocolate syrup, food coloring, light corn syrup, and waterExperiment #8:  Ivory bar soap and a microwaveExperiment #9:  Cooking spray, applesauce, unflavored gelatin, oatmeal/raisin bran, instant coffee/cocoa powder, and waterExperiment #10: Cooking spray, colored cereal, marshmallows, and butterExperiment #11: Cooking spray, juice/water, Jello (orange or yellow), and food coloringExperiment #12: Cooking spray, orange Jello, nonfat evaporated milk, food coloring, and waterExperiment #13: Milk, food coloring, dish soap, and waterExperiment #14: Honey, light corn syrup, milk, vegetable oil, and food coloringExperiment #15: Disposable diaper, food coloring, and waterExperiment #16: Cabbage (purple or red), lemon juice, baking soda, vinegar, dish soap, and waterExperiment #17: Vegetable oil and corn starchExperiment #18: Carbonated water or soda (clear or light colored is best) and navy beansExperiment #19: Raw egg and vinegarExperiment #20: Cornstarch and waterDespite the set being rather basic, if you have the ingredients handy, I think this can be a fun and educational experience for children.  Not having the above list, I had the ingredients for 5 experiments and of those, 2 were something the kids already knew well.  If I had the ingredient list before hand, we could have performed the much cooler experiments while the kids showed interest.Overall, I think this set has some value to it.  On one hand, you can do most of these experiments for free with some old Tupperware containers and an internet connection.  However, I think the customized containers, the flushing toilet mixer, and having all the data and directions complied in a single source makes things more fun for the kids and much easier on the adults.While I know prices of products fluctuate all the time, I am not sure the value for the money is there at roughly $20.  If the kit was more in the $10 to $15 range, I would say that this is probably a must try.  Any higher than that, in my opinion, it would not be worth the money.

My wife used to have beautiful, thick, straight hair when we met.  After our first child, her hair developed wavy curls in it (which I think are still beautiful) and 10 years later, it is still that way.  As my hair is short and straight to begin with, I felt that it would be much better to try this product on my wife than on myself.We plugged the flat iron in and tried the heat at the 200C that the thermostat was initially set at.  The iron advertises that it is ready to use in about 30 seconds and while I did not have a stop watch in hand, I would agree that 30 seconds was about right.As I mentioned, my wifes hair is nice and thick and in order for the flat iron to work optimally, we had to turn it all the way up to the max setting of 230C.  Once the heat was turned all the way up, the iron worked beautifully.  My wifes hair glided effortlessly through the heat plates.  With about 5 minutes worth of work, my wifes hair went from wavy and curly to mostly straight.My wife did most of the testing and thus the comments are mostly from her.  The iron is very lightweight and even after being on for about 10 minutes, the handle was still nice and cool.  The swivel cord is an ingenious feature that really helped keep the cord straight and not bunch up under the iron.  The rounded end makes the iron easy to slide under your hair close to your scalp without burning you.  The digital thermostat is easy to set and easy to read.Overall, this is an excellent quality product and one that we would recommend without hesitation.

In my opinion, a first aid kit is a very specialized thing.  I have traveled to many different places and have done many different activities.  If I were designing first aid kits, my ideal first aid kits for the home environment, white collar office environment, travel to hot 3rd world countries, coaching a sports team, and traveling in the remote Alaskan/Canadian arctic would all be different.  So what do I think about this kit?This first aid kit seems to be designed mainly for minor events like small cuts, scrapes, minor burns, and insect stings.  Of the 355 pieces advertised in this kit, 257 of the pieces are adhesive bandages, 40 are antiseptic wipes, and 12 are ointments.  With those three item categories alone, 87% of the kits contents would treat nothing more than the minor issues I mentioned above.  If encountered with a situation where excessive bleeding might occur or some sort of more serious traumatic injury, this kit would not be much help (though the kit does contain 1 ABD pad per ANSI standards).If one is planning on using this kit in an office setting or at home, I think this kit is very beneficial.  The cover for the case could have been better quality in my opinion.  It will flex and bow if the contents of the case are not placed in the case just right.  However, the rest of the case is a bit cheap feeling, but sturdy.  I have not had any issues with the cover staying closed.  I would like to subject the case to a drop test as if it were mounted on the wall and knocked off, but to be honest, I am not sure it would survive the impact.I examined the perishable contents of the case and most of the contents that have expiration dates have about 1.5 to 2 years before they expire.  The earliest expiration date I found was 7/2015.  The latest was 1/2016.The bandages are of OK quality.  There are better bandages on the market in my opinion, but these do just fine.The only major complaint I have about this first aid kit is the tweezers.  The tweezers are cheap plastic.  They might remove a bee stinger or something that can be removed easily, but for the most part, they have little gripping ability.The kit does come with a first aid reference guide.  I do have a few issues with this.  In my kit, the guide was buried at the bottom of the largest compartment.  The rather plain appearance of the outside of the guide makes it look much like a typed letter.  If someone needs this guide and is not familiar with the kit, it might take some time to look and find it.  I would think that it might be better to mount it on the inside of the lid.  When I read the guide, I will say it was a decent quick reference.  The part on the back/neck injuries failed miserably though.  It tells you signs of what to look for and tells you how it can be highly life threatening, but then does not tell you anything how to treat it.  It does not even tell you to not move the person.  The CPR section outlines the traditional compression and rescue breaths method versus the hands only method.A first aid kit is only going to be as useful as the knowledge of the person utilizing it.  Just having it is not going to be enough.  Without training, will the average person know how to use a triangle bandage or what an ABD Compress is for?Overall, this is not a bad first aid kit for a low risk environment.  In the home or office setting where storage space is not a huge issue, this kit would be fine.

Three things I can never find in my house are a screwdriver, AA batteries, and a pair of scissors.  With three small children who love to create things with paper, our good scissors constantly were being used by the children and misplaced.  As soon as we would buy new scissors, they would disappear in some abstract corner in our house.  Sewing scissors, kitchen scissors, plain old office scissors, it never mattered, they always disappeared only to be found days or months later.We got the Westcott School Scissor Caddy and gave them to the kids to use.  The caddy is solid and seems well built.  The scissors are contained in 4 color coordinated cups, which are removable.  The cups fit into a ring attached to the caddy and the cups can be spun around the caddy.The scissors themselves are smaller, as one would expect kids scissors to be.  The scissors are comfortable to use.  They are not flimsy at all.  They feel solid and well built.  The size and design is great for kids, but they are also surprisingly comfortable for me to use for quick cutting jobs.  They have become quite a hit with my children as they feel they have their own scissors to use.  Having a dedicated place to store their scissors really seems to encourage them to put them away.  Most importantly, since we got this set, the children quit using and misplacing our grown-up scissors.Personally, I think this is a wonderful set and if you have children or a group of children, I think this is a great purchase.

I purchased these to bottle my own vanilla extract for Christmas gifts.  Dark colored glass is perfect for this use and these were a nice price. The bottles were all in perfect condition when they arrived and worked perfectly for making homemade vanilla.
My wife's favorite perfume. A great value here. I paid only 10 dollars more than in stores...and got twice the product. Definitely the way to go if you know you love this perfume!
Perfect fit for my Broan range hood. OEM with indicator strips. Exactly as described. Saved a bunch by ordering them here.

I wasn't really a fan of the cheap feel of this switch and decided to return it. I agree with the other reviewer; it doesn't really allow for a smooth control of the fan speed. Not worth the extra cost.
Simple and easy way to cap your draft faucets. Nice knowing random stuff or bugs won't be going up my taps when not being used. Flexible and easy to clean.
Smooth pouring action every time. This is well worth the investment. I like that it is solid stainless steel as well without any plated components. I expect this to last a long time.

Simple and easy to use, this was just what I needed for bringing with me on long days where I don't have access to a charger. My iPhone 5 charges quickly and I was able to get numerous charges from this before needing to recharge. Good buy!
Perfect fit for my kegerator. I like the double walled line for insulating purposes. Thick hose of high quality. I expect many kegs to go through this line.

After looking at Dewalt's only choice for a miter saw clamp, I took a chance on these. Even though it is not listed as fitting my saw, the shape and design were exactly the same. They fit perfectly on my DW 703 (type 2). Based on this, I would imagine them fitting almost any current Dewalt miter saw. I paid $40 for both of these....less than just one of the Dewalt brand clamps.And...not related to the product, but I ordered these on a Friday and they were delivered on Sunday...EASTER SUNDAY! That was mighty impressive!

This was the first time I purchased vanilla beans and I was excited by all the postive reviews. They did not dissapoint. The beans were plump, shiny, and wonderfully fragrant. I have used them a number of times to make vanilla ice cream and the flavor is amazing! (even my wife loves them, and she is not a vanilla fan). I have also used them in homebrewing and plan to make vanilla extract for gifts. I keep mine in a wine fridge (around 48 degrees) and they have kept fine for almost 6 months so far. Highly recommend.

Purchased this for my son's second birthday party. Looks as pictured and is of average quality. As with many novelty shirts, you might want to order a size up as they do tend to run a bit small and/or shrink in the wash (even on cold water, low heat).

Our son's bite valve had gotten a bit funky with some mold growing in it. These worked perfectly to replace it and keep the water bottle in use. Good as new! (Also saw these at Target for roughly the same price..just in case you need them in a hurry)

Based on many glowing reviews here, I chose this mount. It is for a 47" LED, weighing about 30 pounds. The bracket itself is quite heavy and benefits from having two people install. As long as you know where your studs are, installing is easy. The included lag bolts hold this tight! Leveling adjustments on the mount itself allow for slightly "oopsed" installs (although using a level makes life much easier). The mount folds fairly flat to the wall and allows for a considerable distance away from the wall. The tilt feature is something we needed as we wanted the mount high enough to see across the basement, but still be able to watch comfortably from a couch. Tilt adjustment is quick and doesn't require any tools.The metal is heavy gauge steel and will last a long time. I don't foresee any sagging issues as mentioned with other more cheaply made mounts. The HDMI cable included was a nice bonus as I did wind up needing it. (picture and audio work fine..didn't test for 3D functions as I don't have a 3D TV on this mount). Highly recommend this quality product. Save  your money - don't buy one in the store for twice the price!

I purchased this to extend the range of my verizon DSL router. Setup was not too difficult and I was up in running in a fairly short period of time. After testing it out from various locations in my house, it wind out up not really adding much range to my network. There was a slight improvement, but not enough to warrant keeping the router. I also wound up having issues with my DSL connection and soon after switched to cable anyway, with a better range router included. Certainly, each home is different and you may have a better experience. I definitely enjoyed the user interface and easy setup. It was so much better than what I was used to with the DSL router/modem. Do be careful to follow the instructions as I did something out of order the first time and wound up havig to factory reset both this and my DSL modem.

We received a few of these for Christmas, and had to immediately pick up the other two here on Amazon. They look great and sound quite good. As a musician, I was quite impressed with the sound quality actually. One by itself is cool, but getting them all together and having them play a group is where it is really fun. My 2 year old loves them...and so do I!

We received a few of these for Christmas, and had to immediately pick up the other two here on Amazon. They look great and sound quite good. As a musician, I was quite impressed with the sound quality actually. One by itself is cool, but getting them all together and having them play a group is where it is really fun. My 2 year old loves them...and so do I!

I purchased this for my wife as she loves Snoopy. It looks nice and is as pictured. The colors on the shirt are bright and the screening looks quality. As with many types on novelty shirts, it seems to run a bit on the small side. You may want to order one size larger just to make sure it will fit after washing/drying.

This is my second pair of Fannings. My first pair have been in use for three summers and are still holding up fine. They are by far the most comfortable flip-flops I have ever owned for my flat feet. Most cheaply made flops make my feet hurt after moderate use. These have a much stronger support and sturdy design. Once broken-in, they are fantastic. Until that point, they are a bit tight and will hurt your feet a bit if you wear them too long one day.I wear mine almost every day during the late spring/summer and keep them on for the entire day usually. I'll even wear them to baseball games where I usually wind up standing for three hours or so.The bottle opener on bottom is certainly a cool feature and one that will get a few weird looks from time to time.I am glad to be able to get these on Amazon at a good price and in the color/size I want. Finding the correct combination in a store can be difficult. I highly recommend these based on my past three years of great experience.

Definitely shop around for these as Amazon is not usually the cheapest. In fact, sometimes they are down right WAAAY high. However, I lucked out with a coupon and 20% subscribe and save discount, which made them a good value. We love these paper towels though as many store brands do not compare (although, Target Up&Up paper towels are quite good). They are super-absorbent and don't fall apart into a linty mess like cheaper towels. I find I wind up using less Bounty towels as they are more effective...so I feel saving money on cheaper brands isn't really worth it the long run anyway.
Exactly what I was looking for and works great. Makes a solid connection and everything sounds fine; no distortion or static of any kind.

After reading many glowing reviews, I picked this up for doing all of the trim work in my newly finished basement. As many mentioned, it cuts extremely cleanly and does not splinter edges in the least. The cut surface is so smooth its as if I sanded it with a fine grit sandpaper. In addition to trim work, I also used it to cut some ABS sewer pipe to length. Again, the cuts were perfect and smooth. While not cheap, it was worth the investment to let me do this (and other future) job right.

I chose to order these after struggling to find an undershirt with a closer cut. I have had problems finding an undershirt that won't have the sleeves stick out from under my t-shirts (mainly crew neck ones from Eddie Bauer). With these, they have a much slimmer cut and shorter sleeves as a result, which was exactly what I wanted. The material is soft and comfortable and they have held the shape after a few washes. I will be picking up more of these.

Based on many positive reviews, I purchased these batteries a couple times now. They appear to last not quite as long as higher priced ones, but for the price they cannot be beat. I am using them in almost all children's toys so they are not exactly high drain device, but they last for long enough for my purposes. And I don't mind having to replace them as they are very economical.

I was looking for something just like this; tasteful arrangements of Christmas songs that are a pleasure to listen to. Imagine sitting on the couch with the fireplace going and mug of your favorite warm beverage...this is exactly the music you want playing. It is also great for entertaining and having as background music. The arrangements are enjoyable and stick close enough to the original tune  which is just what I want to hear for certain occasions. Putting on some Christmas jazz albums that try to take the melodies to all sorts of unusual places (different tempos, strange rhythmic interpretations, and unusual harmonies) just doesn't fit for relaxing or entertaining. Overall, the album is a pure pleasure to listen to and should be in anyone's music collection for the holidays.

When you are getting a bit bored of the original set of cards, these expansion packs do a great job of adding some more variety and interest to your games. Some of the cards are a bit lame, but the ones that are laugh out loud funny more than make up for that. And the combinations you can put together on some of the multiple fill-in cards are hysterical. Pick up a few expansion packs; they are certainly worth it.

My two year old has watched this movie at least three times a week for the past few months. That being said, I still enjoy sitting down with him and watching it each time. The variety of characters in the movie provides for an enjoyable experience each time as I pick up new details and nuance. The score is also very well done which lends to the enjoyment of the movie. And of course, the quality of the animation on a Disney/Pixar Blu-ray is amazing. The level of detail, shading, and lighting make for a very realistic feel. Definitely recommend for any family.

I purchased this to replace one that was almost two years old. It had gotten plenty of use (almost daily) and there was a noticeable drop in performance. Replacing the filter helped bring the vacuum back to its original efficiency. Amazon makes finding these replacement parts so easy!

I picked up a few of these to have some extras around in different rooms of the house. I like that they are black and match my phone and case better. Cable works exactly the same as one's from Apple. I am running ios 6 on an iPhone 5 and have no issues with charging at all.

This was purchased to replace a similar Mr. Coffee coffeemaker that had stopped working. Important features that were important to me were a programmable timer and auto-shutoff, which this has. The only feature missing from my old maker is an adjustable warming plate, but this is always hot enough for me (and I enjoy my coffee quite hot).  One feature I like with this maker is that the "nozzle" the water drips down from above the basket is built in. On my old coffeemaker, there was a separate piece of metal that often came loose and was cause the water to leak or miss the grinds, causing a wasted batch of coffee. After using this for well over 6 months, it has been brewing consistently good coffee without any issues. Definitely worth picking up.

Based on the positive reviews I ordered this to cut reveal lines on my Armstrong Oasis tiles. It worked very well and providing a clean and straight cut down the sides. I chose to use a utility knife with a drywall square to cut the face of the tile. Using both provided a good revealed edge for any tiles I needed to cut. Definitely make sure to change blades often which makes the job much easier.Also, a side note not related to the product directly...if you need paint to touch up the Armstrong tiles, try Lowes Icon flat white. It is a near perfect match. In fact, I brought a piece of tile to the store to have them color match and that is exactly what the computer matched it to. (This after I tried five different variations of white paints I already had at home...none of which matched close enough).

As often occurs, a student of mine lost these off their Bach Strad trumpet. These are exactly the same fit and make as the one's that came on his horn originally. Make sure to order these (silver) if you have a silver horn. They are a little brighter in color than the nickel ones. Having one of each makes you notice the difference.

My friend let me use his framing gun when I started working on finishing my basement. I cannot believe how much time it saved! The nails worked perfectly with his gun and fired reliabliy each time. Hot dipped galvanized was needed for toe-nailing into pressure treated lumber. A couple times we had to move a stud because of a miscalculation or change in plans...let me tell you, it was not easy at all with these nails. I feel very confident in the strength and holding power of these. Two of them were able to support 220 lbs. of a person hanging on a 2x4 nailer!!

I have looked at a number of kitchen stores and have been unable to find this size lid. Of course, one quick search on Amazon and I was in luck. Product was as described and fit my pot perfectly. Material is high quality and I feel this was a good price.

As I am undertaking a bunch of electrical work in my house, I realized I did not own any insulated screwdrivers. These were a good find and really good value. For the cost of just one or two screwdrivers from HD, I got a whole set of 7. I like having different sized bits on the end to ensure I always get a good fit. It's also nice to have some extras as screwdrivers always seem to get misplaced or are not around when you need them. The bits on the end appear to be average quality and are showing a little wear already. Fine enough for my needs, but probably not for an electrical contractor.

I needed to replace a sensor that we lost as part of our security system. While a little bigger than the previous sensor, this one works perfectly. I like the screw holes as the last one was just glued on (and fell off...which is why it got lost).

I have performed this piece a few times, and each time my students enjoyed performing it. The parts are easy and certainly appropriate for first year musicians (near the end of the school year). Percussion parts are simple and the pots and pans parts could be played by any musician in your band, not just percussion. Definitely a good piece to have in your library for any 1st or 2nd year band.

These cups are a cute design (my son, almost 2, loves them!) and are a good value. They are easy to clean and don't leak, unless the valve inside the cup gets loose...which can happen when it gets thrown around a lot. The insulation works well at keeping drinks cold without any condensation. Only minor complaint; they are a bit small..I wish they were a few more ounces so they could last longer between refills. Otherwise, I definitely recommend these.

Overall, these batteries do the job OK. We needed them for the many toys my son received for Christmas and his birthday. The price was good and they last a decent amount of time. Not quite as long lasting as more expensive brands. I'll probably start stocking up on Tenergy rechargeable batteries instead of buying more of these.

This was a very nice smell to have around the holidays. I used this in my classroom and my students all commented on "What smells so good?"...high praise from middle school students. I certainly wish they would last a bit longer, or be a bit cheaper. But overall, the product does what it is supposed to and provides a nice scent that is not overpowering.

The price is great and the quality of the item is good. Maybe not quite OEM quality, but certainly acceptable (especially for the price). For a 2012 Tucson though, this product is not quite a correct fit. It is a bit too wide and causes the cover to not snap on correctly. For other Hyundais that have bit of wiggle room where the cabin air filter goes, this would not be an issue. The Tucson has very tight tolerances which requires a perfect fit.
