In one diary entry Zoe says they're a week away from their first weigh-in, but then the date of the diary entry detailing their first weigh-in is 2 weeks later. When they finally do have the first weigh-in, it isn't until sometime in mid-April, but then it mentions there are 9 total weigh-ins... So they waited a month and a half for the first weigh-in, then they plan to squeeze 8 more weigh-ins in over the next 4 months..? But then they only have monthly weigh-ins... Basically, there are inconsistencies all around. It was so hard to follow and keep track of what was happening and when because the timeline kept changing.Then there were just some super far fetched scenes. Greg takes 3 ibuprofen, and then starts acting drunk.  That does not happen on ibuprofen and is just ridiculous. Then at another point, Greg blames blisters on some generic shoes, and not the fact that he went on a long-distance run in brand new shoes that weren't broken in at all.I don't mean to rag on the book, but it just really frustrated and annoyed me. However, if you look can past the unrealistic story and find the characters likable, and if the premise sounds entertaining, then it's not bad. I've read worse.

This was a really informative book that addresses the science behind whether or not fathers matter. Fathers are often downplayed in our society, and in this book, Raeburn presents many of the scientific studies out there that deal with this subject matter to try to determine what effect a father has on his child's life.The book is very scientific and a bit dry at times. It presents a lot of facts and research, which do run into each other and can become a bit repetitive. But it was very informative and interesting, with some parts being more interesting than others. Raeburn does a good job of breaking down the science so it's easy to understand, and of explaining what various studies involving mice tell us about fathers. The book explores a lot of topics, including how the absence of a father can affect a child, how an attentive father can influence his child sociability in later years, and how older or unhealthy fathers can impact the health of his child.Overall, a very informative read that I think would benefit men and women that have children or plan to have children, so they can better understand the role a father plays in his child's life.

Meh. This book was fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way to read it. It's a British "thriller" about a dysfunctional marriage. Hannah is a Brit working in New York when she meets Mark, and they have a short, whirlwind courtship before marrying and moving back to London. Hannah discovers she doesn't really know all that much about her husband after he doesn't return as planned from a business trip, and she starts snooping around.This book was fine, but it had trouble keeping my interest. Although it was a thriller, I didn't find it too thrilling. It was boring and ho-hum, and there were many attempted plot twists that I could either see coming from a mile away, or that just weren't that exciting. The book was okay, but there are better thrillers out there.

I see a LOT of movies, and I also read a LOT of books. When I saw a promotional poster for this movie at the movie theater the week before Halloween, I was surprised because, while I had heard they were making this book into a movie, I hadn't realized it would be coming out soon. I hadn't seen any trailers for this movie, in the theater or on tv, so all I knew about this movie going into it was that it was based on a book I could vaguely recall, and it was a thriller.I read this book several years ago, and can't remember much about it. I remember at the time thinking it was good but not great, and apparently I rated it 3 out of 5 stars on Goodreads. I remember the climax of the book, but that's about it. From what I can recall of the book (but don't quote me), Christine is an amnesiac that may be repressing her memories after a horrific accident years earlier. Every day when she wakes up, she doesn't remember anything and has to have her husband fill her in. She keeps a diary with notes to herself, including details of secret doctor's visits that her husband is unaware of, and a note is scribbled in there not to trust her husband.The movie follows the same basic premise. At the start of the movie, Christine (Nicole Kidman) wakes up in bed with a man's arm around her and seems alarmed. She goes to the bathroom to see pictures taped up of her and this man, with post-it notes saying things like, "Ben, your husband", and "our wedding". She comes out of the bathroom and Ben (Colin Firth) is waiting for her, and explains that she had an accident about 10 years ago and doesn't remember anything. After her husband leaves for work, a man calls Christine claiming to be her doctor, and tells her to look in the back of her closet for a hidden camera that she uses to record video messages she's taped for herself. Christine needs this because every day when she sleeps, her brain "resets" itself and she forgets all of the memories from that day, so she has to rely on whatever information Ben gives her. Basically, this movie is 50 First Dates as a thriller.Walking out of the movie, my husband commented that it was good, but not as good as Gone Girl (which I really enjoyed, although still had my own issues on that one as well). I would have to agree. For me, this movie was similar to the book in that it was unmemorable. It's similar to Gone Girl, but Gone Girl is better.  In a few weeks, I probably won't remember much about this movie, other than the fact that it was good, but not great. It was a suspenseful thriller that kept you wondering what was going on until the end, but it was a bit slow at parts. Also, there were major holes in the plot that I couldn't get past. Getting into them here would spoil the movie, and if you look past some of the more unbelievable aspects, the movie is still enjoyable. What you need to know is that Christine was severely beaten and left for dead, causing her amnesia. We don't know who to trust and who is telling the truth or lying, and both of the men we meet (Ben and Christine's doctor) seem suspicious, but Christine's old friend Claire also is a bit untrustworthy. While the book has Christine keeping a diary to track memories and notes, the movie uses the camera. I found the use of the camera and videos to be a bit more effective in movie-form than a diary, and I think it's smart they made this change in the movie, to try to differentiate itself a little more from Gone Girl.One thing about this movie that pleasantly surprised me was the acting. I normally love Colin Firth, but he really surprised me in this role because Ben was a little bit creepy and suspicious, and it was a totally different role than most of the roles I'm used to seeing Firth in. Nicole Kidman is an actress that typically grates on me. My husband loves her but I can't stand her, although I can't quite put my finger on why she bothers me so much. In this movie, I thought she did a good job and I really didn't mind her and actually enjoyed her performance. However, my favorite performance in the whole movie was that of Mark Strong, who played Christine's neurologist, Dr. Nasch. His character kept me guessing a few times as well, but I found him really intriguing, and liked every scene with him in it.Overall, this movie was fine. A decent thriller, but again, good, not great.

Horrible Bosses 2 does what so few comedy sequels are able to do, and that is to live up to the expectations set by its predecessor. While I don't think it surpassed the original (which I thought was hilarious), I thought it did a great job and I give it an A for effort.This movie follows a similar formula to the first one, but changes it up enough to avoid feeling too recycled. In the first Horrible Bosses, Nick (Jason Bateman), Kurt (Jason Sudeikis), and Dale (Charlie Day) hate their bosses and plot to kill them. In this one, Nick, Kurt, and Dale are trying to go into business for themselves selling a product they've invented called the Shower Buddy (which seemingly dispenses soap for you out of the shower head). They manage to get a huge retailer owned by Bert Hanson (Christoph Waltz) and his son Rex (Chris Pine) to order 100,000 units and they think they're on their way to making it rich, so they lease a warehouse and hire staff to fulfill the order. Unfortunately, Bert and Rex were just screwing the guys over, probably because these lovable idiots are easy targets. Apparently Nick and the others didn't think to get a deposit from Bert or sign a contract, so after they've made all of the units, Bert cancels the order and plans on swooping in and buying the patent and inventory after the guys go bankrupt. So..the gang decides to kidnap Rex and hold him for ransom, and obviously hijinks ensue.Back for the ride this time are MF-er Jones (Jamie Foxx) and Mr. Harken (Kevin Spacey), who both dish out advice to our dumb pals. Jennifer Aniston reprises her role as Julia, Dale's crazy old boss, and we also see Lindsay Sloane a few times (very few times, unfortunately IMO) as Dale's wife.I thought this movie was pretty funny. I laughed consistently throughout the movie, and it didn't have the third act slump that many comedies suffer from. Plus, this movie has one of my favorite things - a gag reel that plays during the closing credits.  (You just can't top a funny gag reel. Right when you think the movie is over and you start the slow shuffle down the stairs and out the door, the gag reel starts, making you walk out the door on a high note thinking about the funny line this person ad-libbed or the funny goof that person made.. Smart move..) All of the actors were great and funny in this movie (Day, Sudeikis, Spacey, Foxx, Bateman, Waltz) but Aniston was my favorite. I felt this movie stood on its own pretty well, and you could easily see this one without having seen the first movie. (Although I don't recommend it - Horrible Bosses is great!) If you liked the first movie, I don't think this one will disappoint. It was full of laughs and I'd rate it 4 stars.

As most people probably already know, Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part I is the third movie in the Hunger Games series. Like with Harry Potter and Twilight, producers decided they could churn out some more money by splitting the last book into two movies, so this movie adapts the events from the first half of Mockingjay, the final book in the Hunger Games trilogy.Mockingjay Part I picks up right where Catching Fire left off, so if you haven't seen the first two movies, I would wait to see this movie.  Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence), Finnick (Sam Claflin), and Beetee (Jeffrey Wright) have been rescued from the Quarter Quell by rebels, and they're taken to a huge underground facility in District 13. Katniss' mom (Paula Malcomson) and sister (Willow Shields) are there, along with tons of other rebels. Katniss meets President Coin (Julianne Moore), the rebel leader, who wants Katniss to be their mockingjay and be the face of the rebellion so they can take down the Capitol. Katniss is furious because they didn't rescue Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) and initially refuses. Plutarch (Philip Seymour Hoffman) suggests Katniss be taken above ground to District 12, and after Katniss sees her former district in ruins, she changes her mind and agrees to help, under the condition that Coin will rescue the remaining victors that were taken by President Snow (Donald Sutherland) as soon as possible and pardon each of them. With the help of Haymitch (Woody Harrelson), Effie (Elizabeth Snow), Gale, and some new friends/allies, Katniss basically goes to visit other districts and see the aftermath of various battles while filming propaganda commercials.Overall, I really enjoyed this movie. Although it was just over 2 hours, the movie kept things moving and didn't have many slow parts. There was always SOMETHING happening. Even though I read the trilogy quite some time ago, I felt that this movie stayed pretty true to the Mockingjay book, while somehow improving upon it.  I don't say this often, but this movie was better than the book.  I really enjoyed the first two books (and movies), but I found the Mockingjay book to be a bit disappointing. This movie, however, greatly improved upon the book. The only thing close to disappointment was the feeling I felt after seeing this movie, when I realized I would now have to wait an entire year before I could see the conclusion in Part 2.This movie had a different feel to it than the first movie, and I think part of it has to do with the fact that there are no Hunger Games in this movie. While the first two movies seemed to have plenty of time to showcase just Katniss, or Katniss with her sister or Gale or Peeta, I felt this movie had a bit too many people around. I really liked the movie, but with all the characters interacting with Katniss, there wasn't much time for her to have touching moments with Prim and the others.  I didn't get to see enough Peeta, Gale, or Haymitch, and I kind of missed them. While Gale was in a lot of scenes, he didn't seem to do much or have much speaking lines for the first half of the movie, and pretty much the only time we got to see Peeta was on tv when he was being interviewed by Caesar Flickerman (Stanley Tucci).  Also, this movie definitely lacked much romance and played down the love triangle of Katniss, Peeta, and Gale. Despite my complaints here, this movie was elaborate and exciting and fun.  I really enjoyed this one and can't wait to see the final movie....next year.

I love these t shirts! Let me just say that I posted that they fit just a bit small. If you are thin you won't have this issue. But even if you carry a bit of spare tire around your belly ;) these shirts will not ride up over it.They are longer than most shirts and stay tucked it great!They are very durable. I have bought a bunch of these shirts in different styles and I love every one of them. I literally wear them everyday and they have stood the test of time and multiple washes. Shrinking after the first wash was as it should have been and the shirts fit just fine after.Customer service is great. Any issues and they get back to you in a short amount of time! They really try to make sure you are happy!Best of all these are made in the a USA keeping the jobs here and our money here. My only wish is that they would make children's shirts too! There isn't enough selection for American made kids clothes. That being said I'm a fan and absolutely recommend these!

I own a weber performer charcoal grill. I have replaced the stainless steel grill grate with a Craycort Seasoned Cast Iron Grate. That being said I've had a hard time finding a brush that can do it all. The cast iron grate is much thicker than the stainless steel wires. When I bought the grill I bought the Charcoal Companion Monster Big Head Grill Brush. It did a great job getting down inside the grill grate but always left residue on the top. So I bought the Grill Wizard Brush and that did an amazing job on the top but couldn't get in between the grate very well. I bought the chain mail for my cast iron pans which does great but terrible for the hot grill.I just received this brush in the mail today and it looked very promising. A nice long handle but no longer than the others I had but those were sufficiently long to keep the heat away from my hands. The long bristles were very compact and stiff. Much tougher and more compact than my Charcoal Companion one. The Charcoal Companion heads were more expensive to replace but lasted longer than the Grill Wizard one. But this one has a lifetime warranty with free replacement. .. nothing is better than that.This cleaned my grill grate very well. Got in between the grates and cleaned the top. It's angle was good so you can apply a good amount of force of you need to. The handle is nice and thick and sturdy. The only downside was that because it was so stiff it was really difficult to clean against the direction of the grill grate. Small price to pay.That being said I'd willingly pay more to have this made in the USA.

The helper handle on this was the selling point for me on this one. When making a sauce and dumping it into a container it is extremely nice to have the helper handle to control the pour easier. The copper core really really shines on the induction burner. It reacts really quickly to the changes in power on induction. It takes about 3 seconds to see the change. I love it. Great feel and the angle of the handle are just right. The copper band is not hard to clean. I use a copper cleaner and in about 20 seconds its clean.

I love this saucier pan. I have used this on ceramic cooktops and induction cooktops. This thing really REALLY shines on induction. The reaction time of this pan on an induction top is about 3 seconds. I love it.The copper band isn't that difficult to clean. I use a copper cleaner and it takes me about 20 seconds to clean it.The helper handle on the 3qt one is absolutely necessary. This is a nice heavy pan. Retains the heat and changes as necessary and quickly. The handle is comfortable in my hand and at a good angle. I am very happy with this pan.

I teach a culinary class at a private high school. I have told all my students that when buying a turner/spatula to start with a fish spatula. A good fish spatula will essentially be the only turner you'll need. So the very first turner I bought was the Wusthof Gourmet Slotted Turner. I love that turner. It is my favorite turner and its the best one I've ever used. That being said it comes at a fairly steep price for a turner at $45 dollars. When I determined I needed a second spatula I decided to see if I could find a comparable turner made in the USA.This spatula is made in Massachusetts, not too far from me. That's a huge plus for me because I like to support the local economy and American jobs.I gave this four stars because its almost as great as the Wusthof one.1. The rivets on this one do not hold the handle as tightly together as the one on the Wusthof handle. I like the feel of wood in my hand but the looseness of the handle I dont appreciate. Its bad enough to notice but not so bad I can't use it. Overall this is the worse thing about the product.2. This one is about half as thick as as the Wusthof one. That is really great for trying to flip things like fish and eggs. The downside to how thick this is, is that it makes it a bit more flexible. So heavier things like large pancakes do provide a bit more of a challenge to keep the heavier items on the spatula without sliding off. Overall I prefer the slightly thicker Wusthof version, it tends to be more versatile.3. Slots on this one are thicker than the one on the Wusthof version. To me that is a great plus. It adds to the sturdiness in desperately needs but also prevents smaller food from falling through. Overall I do prefer the ticker tines on this one than the Wusthof one.4. The offset angle at the front end of the spatula on this one is not as dramatic as the Wusthof one. At first I wasn't sure which I preffered. Because prefer the Wusthof one overall I thought I might prefer its sharper angle. However, over time I have found that its steeper angle when up against the sides of a saute pan do require more dexterity. That being said I do prefer the less dramatic angle of the LamsonSharp.Overall I don't think I could completely replace my Wusthof one with this one but if they could tighten up the handle and stiffen up the turner a bit more, this would be a no brainer. The fact that it's made in the USA is huge perk for me. So all things considered, I would definitely buy this again and I do recommend it.

I was given this product for free in exchange for a review. Unfortunately, I did not like this product. I found it to hesitate when I moved the mouse and used the scroll bar. Its a cool design and looks nice but I was not impressed with it. Also with a gaming mouse I prefer a scroll bar that can change from a free roll to a click roll. This one is perpetually a click roll.

I like the concept but for my application it failed. The double sided tape was not strong enough to hold onto the silicone cable clip. The slightest amount of pressure removed the silicone right off it's sticky tape. I honestly have no use for them. They dont anchor strong enough.

This product worked way easier and faster than I ever thought It would. I "spaghettied" zucchini in a flash. I was also able to julienne up so carrot as well. Even my wife came in and was impressed with how well it worked. It is well thought out product and works exactly as described. Even the pictures of the product are spot on (which is rare for most products).My negatives are that orange guard/plunger in the back of the product have little spikes to grip the vegetables and help you use as much as possible. I found the spikes were too small and have a tendency to tear through the vegetable, even the tough ones like carrots. If the spikes were longer and thinner I think that would be an improvement. It was overly difficult to clean but not entirely easy either. Overall a great product especially if you want some alternatives to pasta or add some flare to your salad!

No spoiler alerts in this review. This is my first time writing a review for a movie as far as I can remember. I really find reviewing movies to be completely subjective. Movies are like food and art in my opinion. Everyone has a taste and flavor something different. I felt compelled to write a review for this movie because, well in my opinion, it well exceeded my expectations for what this movie would deliver.The first captain america movie was OK at best. It was more of a Monologue that began to build his character. The fight scenes/ action scenes kinda felt flat very one note. By contrast, the winter soldier tied in that first movie and gave it the depth it needed to make this a great film.I have felt that Disney had really underpowered Captain America as a superhero. In this movie I feel like that gave him a significant boost in power that made him a more formidable superhero. The fight scenes were incredible in my opinion. Kudos to whoever was doing the stunts because they were incredible. It isnt unusual for the editor to speed up the fight scenes to make them more dramatic and if they did that in this movie it was nearly as noticeable as I had seen in other movies.Captain America really steps up his game in this movie and you really see his leadership abilities as well. The dialogue between characters is well developed as well as the banter.The villains were well developed as well.The post credit scenes (yes there are two) are worth sitting around for and waiting. They give a nice prelude of what's to come. I want to write more but for the sake of not giving away any part of the movie I will refrain.

I wasnt sure about this product because of the reviews on it but after having used it and tested it multiple times I like it. I know it says its only accurate up to just over 9 feet but I tested this in my room wall to wall and it said 17ft 2.6in. I took my tape measure out and it was 17ft 2.5inches. I was surprised that it was that accurate. It has been nearly accurate in every situation ive needed it in. I even have a slanted ceiling in two bedrooms.and I needed to know what the height was from the floor to intersection of the ceiling to the floor. It even measured that accurately. I am very pleased with the product.

I have the 4 of Oxa Portable power batteries. This review will compare the four among themselves and my use of them.OXA Juice Box S2Oxa Aluminum Alloy UltraThinOxa PerfumeOxa 2200mAh portable power.The Oxa Juice Box S2 is definitely my favorite of the four that I own. If i was only going to buy one portable power this would be the one I would want. It is capable of charging two devices at one time. But I do warn you that amount of power drains this battery really fast. I actually used it two charge my HTC smartphone and my Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It charged both but drained relatively fast. I like that this one has a digital display and tells you which output you are using (2.1 or 1.0) or what your charge % is at while charging or draining. The flashlight is relatively bright. All the products with flashlights are turned on by double clicking the power button in quick succession. There was no instructions for this procedure which did aggravate me. I actually had to come onto amazon and read a review in order to figure it out. So I thought Id add it to my review as well. It takes about 2.5 hours to charge completely from dead. I did notice that mine died at about 9% charge. The cable that comes with it is nice and sturdy and most of the connectors you would need for most smartphone and tablets (new and old apple connectors as well). Of all the portable power batteries this one is the bulkiest.The OXA ALUMINUM ALLOY ULTRATHIN is the 2nd bulkiest but is significantly thinner. I would also rate this as my 2nd favorite portable battery. Little blue LED indicators let you know how much charge you have in 25% increments. The LED flashlight turns on with a double click from the power button. The first one they sent me didnt work and the company immediately sent me another one without hassle so kudos to OXA for that. This one also has two charge ports (2.1 and 1.0). I used it the same way as in the previous review and it did discharge faster than the Juice Box. My biggest complaint for this one is that the cable that comes with this one was really touchy with my smartphone. I actually bought the Amazon Basics equivalent to replace the cable that came with this one. I actually prefer the Amazon Basics cables over these anyway. This one takes about 2hrs to charge completely from deadThe OXA 2200mAh my third favorite for its size and the fact that i can plug this directly into a usb charger without a cable. Amazon basics has a male to female cable that works with this too if you want a cable. This one does not come with any extra connectors so you wont be able to charge your apple products on it unfortunately. It only has a 1amp output so it works for my smartphone but my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 draws too much power from this to work effectively. My biggest suggestion for this product is the cover that goes over the USB side of it should be either tethered or hinged to the product to prevent it from getting lost. Overall good product though. This takes about an 1hr to charge from dead to complete.The OXA PERFUME is supposed to be a portable keychain battery backup. I find it way to bulky to carry on my keychain. That being said it is a great little charger. Also only has 1A output. It comes with all the connectors you need as well.  While testing this product the car charger in my car died and I needed my phones GPS to get me where I was going. This saved my butt from being late and managed to charge my phone even while my phone was using a high draw from the GPS.

as you can tell from the title of this I bought this for my 4 yr old boy who is actually fairly small for his size. Yup the hat is a bit big for him.Let me stress that it is only a Bit Big. It doesnt fit on my head at all. I would say this would fit the 6-12 yr old boy range. I wouldnt necessarily call this a "Men's" size.

as you can tell from the title of this I bought this for my 4 yr old boy who is actually fairly small for his size. Yup the hat is a bit big for him.Let me stress that it is only a Bit Big.  It barely fits on my head. I would say this would fit the 6-12 yr old boy range. I wouldnt necessarily call this a "Men's" size.

And every time I see him use it, I think to myself I would love to have one of those! It was cool to find this product on amazon. I read a bunch of the reviews and knew before buying it not to grab it buy the neck since it might fall off.Over the past few months I have been able to use this quite successfully without ever grabbing it buy the neck. I use it all the time when I am heating a skillet with oil in it and only use a tablespoon or two (depending on my cooking method for that recipe).I have to say this has become one of my favorite tools in the kitchen for convenience. I wouldnt go so far as to say that this tool is a necessity to have in the kitchen because quite honestly it isnt. However, I do feel it definitely helps speed things along sometimes. I really do like it.

So I bought this for the purpose of having this spout on the Extra Virgin Olive Oil that I have. Most olive oils come in a clear plastic bottle and is cheaper. I use that type of olive oil (not extra virgin) usually for cooking and the whole idea of protecting its flavor and nutrients arent an issue for me. I actually use the http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B0000VLZIA/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_32 for that type of oil since I usually use a tablespoon or two for my skillets this is a perfect tool.But I digress. For my Extra Virgin Olive Oil the glass green coated bottles are perfect for storing my precious extra virgin olive oil. Since there are very few replacement bottles anyway that protect my bottle as well as the bottle they come in I thought this OXO Oil Stopper/Pourer would be my solution for a slower pour and also sealing the bottle.Well let me tell you I usually save the bottles my EVOO comes in and repurpose them for salad dressing. So in my storage I have 3 different bottles.Columela EVOO from Spain: This stopper pourer was too big for this bottleCalifornia Olive Ranch Millers Blend: This stopper pourer was too small for this bottle(I feel like I am telling the story of Goldie Locks lol)California Olive Ranch Arbequina: This stopper pourer was also too big for this bottle.Since the California Olive Ranch Arbequina bottles are the ones I buy most often I took a razor blade and trimmed the stopper/pourer down till in fit tightly into the bottle.Now that I have trimmed it and have had multiple chances to use it, I notice that sometimes in can pour painfully slow but if you give it a quick shake or shakes it usually will begin to pour out at a reasonable speed.I gave it four stars because it wasnt able to fit any of the three bottles I use and for its slow pour. It gets good marks for its ability to seal in the bottle and the fact that I was able to trim it to size. When it does pour out at good speed its perfect its just a little tricky to get it to do it every time.

I dont use this for your typical oven roasting usage. I have been using this as my medium for sous vide cooking. I use this with my homemade thermocouple and a 5dollar aquarium pump. With the thermocouple, aquarium pump, and this oven roaster I have successfully made quite a few sous vide recipes.There are a few things I dont like with this product though. The black insert is a sheet metal product that may not be the best heat sink for this method but the water handles that ok. 2ndly any part of that black insert that missed painting will rust in the water. Also the accessory rack rusts along all of the weld spots. very annoying.One tip, if you use this for sous vide cooking its best to set your oven roaster to just about the 200degree mark. Under that and it takes forever to heat up and over that it tends to over shoot the temp while trying to regulate the temp.

I would definitely say this is more for the 6+ age group but my four year old loves captain america so much he had to play it even though he wasnt very good at it. Honestly though he is actually starting to get the hang of it and it getting better at it.
He plays with these and his DC super friends toys together. They are about the same size so its easy to match the sets together!

I love this ice cream tub. I love the long length of it. I use my kitchen-aid 6qt ice cream maker to make home-made ice cream. My biggest gripe is that almost all the recipes make 2qts of ice cream but this only holds a quart and a half. leaving me with an excess of half a quart.This fits perfectly on the door of my upright freezer so I love that. and it fits perfectly is the ice cube tray holder in my bottom freezer. I just wish it was either slightly longer or taller to compensate for the half quart shortage

This is my first french press coffee carafe.The first thing I noticed was that the instructions for using the french press was on the box instead of an insert on paper inside. The box was thrown away immediately after opening and two days went by before I used it and forgot what the instructions said.2nd: This french press is advertised as 8 cups. I already know from previous experience that the coffee industry has redifined what a CUP is. For every application besides coffee a cup is 8 ounces. But for coffee it is 5 oz. I always do a 7:5 ration of coffee to water. Essentially I do 56grams of coffee (yes i weigh my coffee) to 40oz of water. Because of my preconceived notion that a cup of coffee would be 5 oz I went ahead and prepared my coffee for 56 grams assuming I was going to use 40oz of water. WRONG. This company has redefined the CUP as 4.25 ounces.That being said. This made an incredibly smooth coffee. I was really impressed with it. I will re-adjust the ratio i used initially because i did 56grams of coffee to 34oz of water and that was a bit of a waste of coffee beans knowing that now. So I only knocked it down for them calling it 8cups when its more like 4cups. I like this french press. I will definitely continue to use it.

I like the honest kids drink packs. They are definitely more watered down and have less sugar but that is what i like anyway. I water down the juice i get from the store anyway for my kids. This was cheaper on amazon when I ordered it but immediately after I ordered it they raised the price on amazon. I wont be buying this from amazon any more till the price drops.
He plays with these and his DC super friends toys together. They are about the same size so its easy to match the sets together!

When I started buying EVOO I read a lot about the benefits and the scandals surrounding it. I read all about the imported extra virgins may not be extra virgin at all. I read about different home tests you could do. I read consumer reports and they reported that KIRKLAND EXTRA VIRGIN olive oil was the real deal and had great flavor.I started buying Kirkland Extra Virgin olive oil but it really bothered me to buy it in a PVC or PET bottle whether or not it was BPA Free.I decided I wanted to buy in glass bottles from now on and continued my search. America's Test Kitchen picked their favorite brand of EVOO as Columela from Spain. I really liked that olive oil and bought it for months. But something in me kept telling me that if I could buy American I should.I found the California Olive Ranch Miller's Choice brand and bought that for awhile but I honestly still preferred the Columela brand from Spain so I went back to it.Then I saw America's Test Kitchen did a test of California olive oils up against there favorite Spanish olive oil (Columela) and though none of their competitors beat their favorite in blind taste testings the California Olive Ranch Arbequina EVOO came in under a fraction of a point under the Columela brand. I decided to give this olive oil a try.I must say this is clearly my favorite EVOO I have tasted yet. Even my wife who is not a fan of EVOO at all noticed the fruitiness of this olive oil and I have successfully won her over. Great product will be buying frequently!

I get frustrated when I read reviews from people who have not done their homework.1. What is Classico pure olive oil? and How is it different from Extra Virgin Olive Oil?Before I begin let me start by saying I have contacted Bertolli to determine what is in this particular product. The ONLY (let me repeat) ONLY ingredient in this olive oil is.... olives! Federal law states that if the label does not represent exactly what is in the bottle then an ingredient list is required! Since only olives are present in this oil then no ingredient list is required. So what is Extra Light Tasting Olive Oil from bertolli? Its olive oil.How is it different from Extra Virgin Olive Oil? Now that is a great question. There are different degrees of freshness and purity based on their label. The different degrees in descending order from most fresh to least fresh are as follows:Extra Virgin Olive OilVirgin Olive OilClassic / Pure Olive OilExtra Light Tasting Olive OilOlive OilAs you can see this product is 3rd from the bottom in freshness. So why is that? and why would one who knows this want to buy it?How is Classic Olive Oil made? Extra Virgin Olive Oil is made by hand picking or machine picking olives at their peak ripeness then usually cold pressed and stored in a gas chamber and bottled on demand. That is the freshest way and keeps most of its flavors and nutrients.How is that different from Classic Olive Oil? Classic Olive Oil is usually made from the olives that have already fallen of the tree and began to rot. They have a terrible flavor. These olives are cooked at a low temperature in order to mute their flavor. By the way these olives are also cold pressed exactly the same way as the Extra VIrgin Olive oil. These olives after cooking are then strained and put in a gas chamber and then to just add a little of that flavor back they take some of the Extra Virgin Olive Oil and add just a small amount back to it. Now understand that this process does indeed remove some of the nutritional value of olive oil. Extra Light Tasting Olive Oil can also be called Refined Olive Oil. Did you know most of the oils you use are probably already refined with a similiar if not harsher process i.e. Canola Oil, Vegetable Oil, (most) Peanut oil? Refining oil is not something we are unfamiliar with, but we seem to hold a different expectation for olive oil.So why buy it?Well for one did you know that refining oil increases its smoke temperature and decreases its freeze temperature? What does that mean for you? EVOO (extra virgin olive oil) has a smoke temperature of about 350-375. Which means when the oil hits that temperature it starts to break down and lose nutrients at that temperature. That makes EVOO very difficult to cook with ( I dont recommend it). Classic Olive Oil from Bertolli has a smoke temperature of 460 and because it has a very neutral taste it means that you can fry (again i dont recommend) or BAKE (I DO RECOMMEND) with it. It has been refined so some of its nutrients are already lost. Have you ever tried to bake a cake with EVOO? Its gross. But i guarentee you have with Vegetable Oil or Canola Oil. You can bake with this oil as well. Well why bake with this instead of Vegetable oil or Canola oil? Well vegetable oil is made with a wide mix of different vegetables and put thru more of a chemical process in order to maintain that neutral flavor. Same thing is done with Canola Oil.Though this oil has lost some of its nutrients in refining it hasnt lost them all. And though i would not recommend this for a salad dressing I absolutely recommend this for cooking and baking applications (I recommend peanut oil for frying).Now when it comes to buying Classic Olive Oil your only prerequisite should be - is it in fact just OLIVE OIL or something more. I would not get into how fresh it is or anything else because it is irrelevant. Apply those standards to EVOO.As far as Classic Olive Oil is concerned I recommend Bertolli. Of the companies I emailed about their processes and ingrediants Bertolli were the most transparent and had a good turn around time. Also I learned that even in the Classic Olive Oil they maintained at 77% ratio of mono-unsaturated fats (thats the good fat you want to eat as opposed to saturated or trans-saturated fat) which is well within the average for GOOD olive oils.If you want a good EVOO i recommend Columela Extra Virgin Olive Oil From Spain or Arbequina Olive Oil from California Olive Ranch. They are also very transparent and take great care to keep their full of its nutrients and freshness.

I like to buy in bulk but i also like to store in containers as opposed to the plastic or paper bag the product comes in. I bought a 10-lb bag of sugar and none of my 4qt and under containers could hold the entire 10lbs. I went online to try to find a product that clearly told me that it would hold either 10lbs of flour or sugar and then I knew I would be set. Long story short i couldnt find one.I had the 8qt version of this container that i use to brine whole chickens. I took the container down dumped the 10lbs of sugar into and it came up to just beyond the 5.5 qt line.Problem solved I now knew I needed to by a container that was at least 6 qts.Stores the sugar great. The container is very sturdy. There is more than enough room to get my measuring cup in there for a full scoop and sweep. Stores nicely as well.I am very happy with this container.

This item is one in times past I would never have considered buying. In my day to day routines, I have a charger everywhere I go. While I sleep my phone is charging.When I wake up it goes onto my computer charging.Drive to work, on a charger.Get to work, theres a charger on my desk.Needless to say I never thought I'd have a need for a portable charger.In the past month or so I have found myself in situations that were not in my routine and put me in positions where I had no charger near by for hours at a time.I had this charger and started to use it. I have to say I loved it. I was able to sit in a restaurant waiting for a client and was able to surf the web and monitor my live streaming security cameras from my phone and this charger not only was able to hold the charge but actually increase the charge on my phone. BIG WIN in my book.My car charger in my car died and I was heading to a place with my GPS and this charger was able to make the difference of whether I got there painlessly or had to guess my way.Bottom line this is definitely a nice accessory to keep around. I keep it in my car so that its always with me. They have a key chain on it but honestly I find it absurdly too big to keep on my key chain. It comes with plenty of different charging types. It has the micro usb for the majority of smartphones and it has the standard apple charger (I'd have to double check but i do not think it came with the lightening charger) and it had a few other misc adaptors for charging. I only use it for my HTC Thunderbolt and have been very happy with it.4 OXA PRODUCTS 1 REVIEWI have the 4 of Oxa Portable power batteries. This review will compare the four among themselves and my use of them.OXA Juice Box S2Oxa Aluminum Alloy UltraThinOxa PerfumeOxa 2200mAh portable power.The Oxa Juice Box S2 is definitely my favorite of the four that I own. If i was only going to buy one portable power this would be the one I would want. It is capable of charging two devices at one time. But I do warn you that amount of power drains this battery really fast. I actually used it two charge my HTC smartphone and my Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It charged both but drained relatively fast. I like that this one has a digital display and tells you which output you are using (2.1 or 1.0) or what your charge % is at while charging or draining. The flashlight is relatively bright. All the products with flashlights are turned on by double clicking the power button in quick succession. There was no instructions for this procedure which did aggravate me. I actually had to come onto amazon and read a review in order to figure it out. So I thought Id add it to my review as well. It takes about 2.5 hours to charge completely from dead. I did notice that mine died at about 9% charge. The cable that comes with it is nice and sturdy and most of the connectors you would need for most smartphone and tablets (new and old apple connectors as well). Of all the portable power batteries this one is the bulkiest.The OXA ALUMINUM ALLOY ULTRATHIN is the 2nd bulkiest but is significantly thinner. I would also rate this as my 2nd favorite portable battery. Little blue LED indicators let you know how much charge you have in 25% increments. The LED flashlight turns on with a double click from the power button. The first one they sent me didnt work and the company immediately sent me another one without hassle so kudos to OXA for that. This one also has two charge ports (2.1 and 1.0). I used it the same way as in the previous review and it did discharge faster than the Juice Box. My biggest complaint for this one is that the cable that comes with this one was really touchy with my smartphone. I actually bought the Amazon Basics equivalent to replace the cable that came with this one. I actually prefer the Amazon Basics cables over these anyway. This one takes about 2hrs to charge completely from deadThe OXA 2200mAh my third favorite for its size and the fact that i can plug this directly into a usb charger without a cable. Amazon basics has a male to female cable that works with this too if you want a cable. This one does not come with any extra connectors so you wont be able to charge your apple products on it unfortunately. It only has a 1amp output so it works for my smartphone but my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 draws too much power from this to work effectively. My biggest suggestion for this product is the cover that goes over the USB side of it should be either tethered or hinged to the product to prevent it from getting lost. Overall good product though. This takes about an 1hr to charge from dead to complete.The OXA PERFUME is supposed to be a portable keychain battery backup. I find it way to bulky to carry on my keychain. That being said it is a great little charger. Also only has 1A output. It comes with all the connectors you need as well.  While testing this product the car charger in my car died and I needed my phones GPS to get me where I was going. This saved my butt from being late and managed to charge my phone even while my phone was using a high draw from the GPS.
thats all it is. works accordingly. My son loves it. It has difficulty settings you can use. Nothing special but my 4 yr old is happy with it.

I searched for quite awhile for an all in one prenatal multivitamin that was NOT a one a day. I wish they would start fulfilling it again. I may end up just switching to a different brand otherwise.P.S. Lately this product has only been available from third party sellers. I cannot leave a seller review for the company VITAGLO but if I could they would get 2 stars. I bought the product from them and they charged 10 dollars for standard shipping 7-10 days. On day 11 I sent them an email saying that I had not received the product yet. No response. I sent another email day 12. No response. On day 13 I sent another email demanding a full refund. No response. On day 14 I received a reply email saying, "We will send you a full refund today." No explanation, no apology. Not happy with them.

I love the vermont soapworks products. I do wish they sold more of their products on amazon. This product does a great job of foaming up and lathering your hands while washing. I love the scent and that love that this is an organic and natural product.I do not like buying antibacterial soaps but I want my soap to still clean my hands. This has no problem cleaning my hands when filthy or the hands of my kids.My daughter has sensitive skin as well (eczema) and this she doesnt cause her to flair up. She says it actually feels nice.This product is SLS free and paraban free. It is only made with saponified castile and essential oils. No chemically made fragrances. This one smells great as well. Since there are no foaming chemicals in this product this will not foam up by itself. Vermont soapworks uses a few very tiny screans that when the soaps is forced through with the pump the screan causes the soap to foam up on its way out.Its a small hassle for me, but it can be annoying, the soap can have a tendency to plug the dispenser at the nozzle. It only takes a second to remove the clog but that is the only real negative I have to this product.

This is one heck of an upgrade. Its big, its quite, and it works. and it will continue to work for a decent amount of time. It comes with compatibility for current and future sockets. It may block your first expansion port depending on how close it is to the CPU socket. Also, if your case isn't big, like Cooler Master HAF big, it might not fit. its different than the NH-D14 in the fact that its wider and if you chose to use 1 center fan instead of both, you can fit high profile RAM. If you use both, you will need to use standard profile or low to make it fit. I personally used IC Diamond with this rather than the NT-H1 thermal compound that it came with. Its a personal choice, (ICD will give about 1 degree Celsius better than NT-H1 and will scratch the wonderful mirror finish) but i digress.This is the best air cooler on the market, (well, maybe the thermalright silver arrow is on par). I'm a quadrupedal certified Technician, and this is my go to for high performance rigs that wont go water.Don't be fooled - this can work better than some low-mid range ready made close looped water coolers. You sacrifice clearance, space and case choice for this over said water coolers, but its a darn good cooler.

This dash cam does the basic function of recording acceptably. But there are a few flaws that prevent it from being a superb product. Note that this cam does not have infrared LEDs and cannot "see" in total darkness or very dark environments (I deliberately choose such a cam to avoid reflections from the windshield glass).THE GOOD:+ Relatively uncomplicated, only 5 buttons.THE BAD:- Unlike other cams this one doesn't seem to have a large capacity internal battery. If you leave your car switched off for a few days (and the accessory socket doesn't supply power when off) you will find that the internal clock needs to be set next time you drive! I have seen dash cams with an internal rechargeable battery to eliminate this problem.- I don't like that the display auto shuts off and cannot remain permanently "on" while powered. (If you need to turn the display on if it is off you have to press the rightmost button).- The bracket is a "move to any position and screw to secure" type, like what some security cameras use. This is too easy to accidentally move when you didn't mean to do so. Other dash cams have a "fixed" bracket that is better to prevent inadvertent position adjustment.OVERALL, while it works I am not happy with some of the issues. I feel it is a little overpriced for what it is.
