There is an explicit sex scene that I found believable and erotic.There is a camukra flower that blooms once every 14 years or so. It blooms at the beginning of the story and blooms at the end. I guess it is supposed to be symbolic but I did not even try to think of what it was supposed to mean. Maybe the author threw it in because it felt cool and he figured we would do little mental gyrations trying to make it significant. The ending is abrupt and the tone not quite right. How our storyteller could have made it better, or richer, or more meaningful is beyond me. I have not an ounce of creative writing in me, but an appreciation for 95% of a well-imagined young man's story. But then, real life is like that sometimes. Narratives sometimes don't come with a neat ribbon tying everything up. (But I want the ribbon).
Too firm to help me, but that is an individual response. YRMV. Well made. Good material.
They are simple and foolproof. Not precise to the minute, but inexpensive and they work.

I never actually taste bottled sauces before loading them up like crazy with green bell pepper, onion, and oregano. As a taste test, this time I spooned the  cheese and bacon Barilla and Meat All Natural Barilla straight from the jar as if I were some kind of wine taster. And then again I spooned the sauce after adding ground meat and simmering for awhile.Taste impressions before cooking: The bacon and cheese REALLY did taste of bacon and cheese. Sounds overdone but made my tongue happy. The basic Meat All Natural Sauce made me conscious that the tomato flavor could have been sweeter but there was a good basic integrity to the sauce. What does "integrity" mean? Well, we really don't have a taste vocabulary analogous to the famous and possibly apocryphal "43 words for snow" of the Inuit people, so I will have to go with "tastes good". I give the Bacon and Cheese 3 stars and the Meat All Natural Sauce  a 4 with the sweetness having improved after heating and sitting overnight.In the end, it was the Traditional that I kept coming back to. The Bacon and Cheese is a bit too artificial.I spooned out sample 1 and sample 2 for Mrs. Js, the Taste Queen. Her opinion? Barilla Traditional Meat Sauce: "Yum". Barilla Bacon and Cheese: "Yum." Such a nuanced response! Very helpful. To be fair, she had not eaten dinner yet.

I was ready to rate 5 stars but Mrs. Js says drying ability could be better. Otherwise, Can't think of any negatives. Color-fast from the first wash, and 8 on a scale of 10 for softness. 28"X15" after washing. It has a little loop at midpoint for hanging. The grey color should hide stains. Only a few loose threads. Purchase with confidence.

Latex gloves are preferred by most surgeons for their fingertip sensitivity (see Purdue pegboard test) but the difference is small and nitrile gloves are tougher and more puncture-resistant. The toughness wins out over the slight fingertip conformability of  latex. I am not doing Cholecystectomys in my garage.Even better, Gloveworks HD nitriles are 9 mils and even tougher than your average nitrile glove and I perceived very little if any diminution in dexterity. A box of 100 is MUCH heavier and bigger than a box of 5 mil. By the way, I had to do some research to discover the thickness. I did not see it ANYWHERE on the box: a surprising omission of such a virtue.I have the XLs for my medium hands and they are just slightly tight at the palm and slightly long at the fingertips; a good compromise for me.Realistically, although great for a day's wear to keep dirt and grease off your hands, they will not do for long out in the garden wielding a rake or pruning thorny bushes.
This length is perfect in my car, and my device isn't giving me that warning that the cable is not authorized. Charges fine and fits fine.

One star off because Scotts Grass Seed rufuses to spring into green life in a couple of weeks when I just toss it on almost bare ground barely moistened and otherwise unprepared by any effort on my part. So lazy! Update: after 2 months, this has been Rogain for my lawn.Scotts reasonably asks you to rake or otherwise stir up the ground, water regularly and perhaps thrown down a little topsoil so the seed has some moisture-holding surroundings to promote germination. Unsurprisingly, the seed I 'cast liberally on bare ground just sat there. Surprisingly, at least if last year is any measure, even my poor preparation did not stop the seeds from sprouting after about 4 weeks.On a positive, 4-star note, the thin and brown spots within the main body of the lawn have sprung up enthusiastically. If you take a picture, mental or literal, and water some every day, it works lots faster than Rogaine. The lawn is much fuller where I seeded. Seeds appreciate some cover.This "Turf Builder" seed is recommended for sunny AND shady areas. Well, it is still struggling in the shaded area. It is not working miracles. Still, for a bad lazy terrible gardener, this is such an easy fix.Update: 10 days later the shaded area has filled in fairly well. One has to be patient.

"Becoming Steve Jobs" has a narrow premise, sticks to it, and succeeds. Steve Jobs began as a product-driven, cruel company-smashing maniacal marketing genius, and rebuilt himself into a product-driven sometimes humane, super company-building CEO maniacal marketing genius. Although BSJ is an unauthorized biography, it is actually far more authorized than Walter Isaacson's "Steve Jobs" because of Brent Schendler's access to very high-level colleagues such as Iger, Ives, Cook, Catmul, Gates and of course, Steve's wife Laurene.This isn't an in-depth analysis of the technology, which I would have liked. Nor are there many anecdotes from the many, many interesting people Jobs interacted with during his amazing life. It is a broad and illuminating look at how Jobs became a really good boss instead of a bomb inside the company gas tank. It is also, through interviews, the story of how Steve got less mean, more patient, and wiser. It separates his behavior outside of work: some people NEVER got yelled at by Steve. Starting a family with Laurene changed him. Watching creativity being gently fostered at Pixar, his "side bet purchase" changed him. He learned. He grew.As for the leaps that were the music player, phone, and tablet look elsewhere for a real description of their technology and social impact. Although they are covered as pivotal events, the focus is always on Jobs, and that is fine.There is a lot left untold in this useful new addition to the Lore Of Steve. I want more personal stories. I want more about the tech... lots more. Still, this is an excellent overview and the quotes from his friends and colleagues are valuable.Oh, and one more thing: The book was written with love.

5-star ratings are kind of boring, but what can I say? Smells like sweet barbeque and tastes the same. I'm no cook, but it is dead simple to fry chicken with onion for 10 minutes, pour in this sauce, and simmer covered another 5. Next time I will slice the chicken into smaller pieces and fry hotter; I want more surface area coated with more thickness and caramelization. My taste buds are OK but I defer to my Wife, the Super Taster. No chemical aftertaste and a genuine smoky sweetness. Now I will try some of the other flavors.

It's a simple process to punch 10 oz and even 20 oz (2 layers) leather belts, horsehide, buffalo, and English bridle (These are the types of leather I use). This tool has a strong frame  sure feels like it's not possible to bend it when I'm wielding it. Great handle grip, even for my small hands & the jaws open easily after each punch. The punch carousel clicks soundly into place after being rotated many times, while the puncher rotating head is very strong  but not too much so you can still turn it around, lock it in place and gives a good alignment with the puncher plate. After seeing so many shoddy tools on the market, I guess I was pleasantly surprised by the durable plastic and metal disk, and a good screw underneath that holds it in place. Punched with it many times and each hole was great!

There are many bloggers on the internet, and many eCommerce businesses-- so, how does one distinguish oneself to the point of making it all profitable for You? This book is packed efficiently with a plethora of essential chapters covering every aspect of blogging for your online store, and with links throughout to online resources (the author's even provide a list of links they used to sites, if you are reading a hard copy).I had a thousand questions when I sought out this book and then first cracked the cover. It seems the movement of traffic to a site should be easy: of course, it is not. Everything is right there if you simply have internet access and a device of some sort to actually access it! But this is far from the truth. Yet, as we are shown herein, this is Not 'a mountain too high.'This book breaks it all down into 8 manageable chapters. Beginning simply, we get to cover content, traffic, building an audience & more ... the Basics of Blogging for Beginners, as it were, but essential and the ideal place to get our feet wet. Next we go over actual tactics for our strategy: what are listicles, including 'How To's' and interviews, and more.Further, Keywords are vital for people (potential customers) searching online: lure them in. The authors take us through using certain features on Google, in particular-- and given the ubiquitousness of Google it is crucial to learn how to use it. But also phrases & tools and much in between to make the most with the right bait.If you are not a writer, this is something you will have to overcome. But it is Not difficult.. hang in! This is about simply relating to the reader out there, description, using email, outsources-- a singularly critical chapter here. Of course we go through dressing up your posts, graphics and more also. And all throughout we get links of real sites the authors highlight for numerous helpful reasons.RSS, webmasters, permalinks, slugs-- there is a lot in here you have probably heard about before, but maybe didn't quite know what it all was. It is explained easily for us. Some further work in the realm of SEO (search engine optimization), and how to share your posts the most effectively, I.E., using social media (we've all heard of this, but don't be frightened it won't bite ;), and so on.If I write any more on it I would have my own book to publish-- and it would look suspiciously just like this one! I love this book, helpful, frank, and presented perfectly for the lay person and is sure to help other bloggers as much as it did me.

This book was quite different than the other ones I've read on the topic of poker. It had interviews with a whole bunch of full time players who talked about how they got into the game, and also what it was like to play for a living. Pretty unique perspectives some of these guys had.

Orphans always have a way at tugging at the heartstrings, and Alex O'Sullivan is no exception. Born with spina bifida and confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life, he never knew his parents. Not only that, but he was told they tragically perished in a fiery car crash. He wasn't just given up for adoption, he was left without any living family members and thrown into an impersonal foster care system to fend for himself.But what makes Michael J. Bowler's young adult characters so unique is how adoption can become a life-changing, transformative process for themif they connect with the right people who are willing to care for them. Once placed in a loving, stable environment, they finally get a chance to flourish and thrive.The novel starts out with Alex at the mercy of his current foster guardian, Jane. She's the worst of the worst, a manipulative con artist who's only in it for the money. She takes in as many juvenile offenders, former gang members and handicapped teens as she can house under her roof, siphoning every last penny out of the stipend she receives from the state. She gets away with feeding them next to nothing, and even encourages them to pummel each other while videotaping their altercations, hoping to make a quick buck on the side. This is her way of punishing them for "starting trouble."But despite her numerous threats of intimidation and her constant barrage of verbal abuse, Jane is afraid of Alex. He has a secret power, an uncanny ability to control her emotions whenever she speaks. It's a special gift he dubs "spinning," hence making him the "Spinner" of the book's title. For Alex, spinning is the only thing he's good at.Yet not all adults fear Alex's talent. Nathan, the father of his best friend, thinks he possesses an extraordinary gift. He welcomes Alex into his home without trepidation, seeking to adopt him and make him a permanent member of the family. He knows how close his son, Roy, is with Alex and how many times Alex has saved his boy from mortal danger, and he wants to offer Alex some kind of protection. Nathan is genuinely concerned about Alex's well-being. He knows how Jane treats him, and he wants to get him out of her house for good.Alex is grateful for Nathan's offer of assistance until a boatload of secrets from his past begin to emerge, starting with a video message from his dead mother that Jane tries to keep from him. Is he "the boy with round legs" who's the source of an ancient Iroquois legend and the healer the Bible itself references? As he begins to sort through the clues his mom left for him to uncover his true identity, he learns that he may not be alone in the world after all. There just might be someone who shares a special bond with him that runs a whole lot deeper than blooda conjoined power that could very well corrupt the entire human race.Alex faces a tricky dilemma. Does he move on and start a new life with the people who mean the most to him? Or does he explore this new tie to his affections that he never even knew existed until now? It's a weighty decision for a fifteen year old to make, but the beauty of a Michael J. Bowler novel is that he always gives his adolescent protagonists the power to choose what they want based on what kind of person they want to be.It's a dual journey of self-discovery and acceptance that culminates in an epic battle between the forces of good and evil. Will Alex be the great peacemaker or the great destroyer? Will he choose love over hate?Bowler sums it up best, "Thoughts don't make us good or evil. Actions do."

I was initially thinking about getting an electric bike, but it was just too expensive to get one that is decent. Then I stumbled across the Solowheel on Amazon, and thought "that would be cool" but at nearly $2k, it was way overpriced. Then I noticed under the "Customers also viewed.." a similar thing that was only $658 (with prime shipping!) called "TG". I was quite interested, and decided to do some research. I watched several videos and looked at reviews so buy the on ,wonderful product. highly recommended!!

Whenever I see that 'Accolade' I'm locked in! Mr. Smith gives an extensive list of acknowledgement to all the masters of this sub-genre of the overarching Science Fiction Genre-- and it is a highly distinguished list. Also, having read this exemplary adventure, I must say it does them proud.Landry leads an expedition to a war-ravaged planet where he and his crew must solve a pressing problem for the inhabitants of this unfortunate world: there are no females to continue their species! The characterizations herein, and about All of the beings we meet, is rich and complex. Giving life to various personalities, conflicts & ambitions.Overall the writing style is deliciously descriptive. I was actually taken to the world the author brought to life in a way that is difficult for many writers to achieve. There is something new-is-old-is-new again in some of the concepts Mr. Smith uses, some of the technology, and just the thrill of this kind of space adventure-- and it was wholly welcome. If you are up for 'Space Opera' of the finest, Golden Age sort, this is definitely a book to pick up & savor!

Beats using a pen knife-- lemme tell ya! The blades on this are the key. They cut evenly, is what they do, all around. So i'm not sawing from one side mashing the end and making for a fitful, unsatisfying smoke. I like the box it comes in almost as much as the scissors ~Heh. Has a little brush kinda comparable to what you'd get with an electric razor for cleaning the heads. Really top quality item here+

And very enjoyable. Our 'ordinary citizen' in this light mystery is Doctorate-in-making candidate Lauren Sarasohn who is forced from the get-go to put on her amateur sleuth hat when the body of a strange young man is found in her office on the Campus of Winthrop College in Connecticut. What proceeds from there is an unfolding series of event-based clues that spell out a mystery far deeper and more sinister than even a dead body could have foretold. Gold, Nazis, Art & Secrets etched in human flesh are a heady enough mix that Lauren will have to traverse paths and trust people she never thought she would be able to again if she is to solve the murders and safeguard her own life. A terrific venture this turned out to be & I am grateful I received this e-book as a promotional gift in exchange for an honest review.

Ellie March is "the unhappiest person, like, ever."Since she investigates gruesome murders for a living, her job probably has something to do with it. She's quite good at what she does, so good that the men she's in charge of, know it and don't necessarily like it. It's hard being the team leader, especially when:"You're supposed to be perfect. The margin of error in this line of work is slim, at best. Forget the pity party."But sometimes, she's still not taken seriously by her male colleagues. When they call her "our own palace princess" or make snide comments like, "she's not much to look at, but she seems pretty smart." She just tries not to let it show that it bothers her because she's sacrificed everything for her work. She's lost touch with her elderly parents after they went into a nursing home. Her ex-husband remarried, and their two daughters resent her for never making time for them. She has very few friends and doesn't have a boyfriend or a significant other. She's completely and utterly alone.And with the grueling type of work that she does, it really gets to her sometimes. She has no one to come home to and cuddle up next to in bed and talk out her problems. She's left to her own resources. She practices tai chi to calm her nerves and methodically cleans her gun every morning, even though she's never had to fire it in the line of duty. In order to function on a day-to-day basis, she compartmentalizes, shutting out all the personal stuff and focusing only on the case at hand. In fact, she enjoys the silence her life provides because she has the time to sort out all the details of the case in her mind in order to catch the killer as quickly as possible.But Ellie doesn't completely slip under everyone's radar. Her new partner, Kevin Walker, respects her crime-fighting abilities. He's young, and together they're working on his first homicide case. He knows he can learn a lot from her, if he just follows her lead and pays attention to the way that she handles herself. She even encourages him to continually ask questions, and not to make any assumptions, just so he can appear smart in front of his superiors.Kevin even introduces her to his favorite hole-in-the-wall restaurant in town, The Silver Kettle, and that's where Ellie meets Skinny Jimmy, the gourmet chef who's now stuck being a short order cook. Skinny Jimmy rarely acknowledges anyone, and speaks to practically no one. He's a loner just like Ellie, but he takes a shine to her when she comes in with Kevin to pass out some police sketches of the murder suspect. He admires her no-nonsense demeanor and when she becomes a frequent customer, he has her Christmas dinner delivered to her door before a blizzard hits with detailed, handwritten instructions on how to serve it. When Kevin finds out about Skinny Jimmy's thoughtfulness, he's impressed since not people receive such one-on-one attention from him. Ellie broke through his shell.Ellie's dedicated, and the people around her come to appreciate that. She wanted to be in law enforcement ever since her parents' shoe store was robbed when she was eleven years old. She felt terrified and helpless then, and she never wanted to feel that way again.Sure, she may often hear, "never send a girl to do a man's job," but she doesn't care what anyone thinks of her. She gets up every morning and enjoys being a free agent, unencumbered to do what she does bestnailing the bad guys to the wall.

I was looking for a stand, but I didnt like the normal ones. Watching some videos I found this one by chance and I really liked the functionality. You easily realize it has been manufactured with really good materials. I travel a lot and I was looking for a stand for my tablet which could be as foldable as this one. I've attach some pics of the product. I believe you will get a better idea -- mostly because of the double function of tripod and stand. A 10 over 10

One of my favorite genres-- and when practiced very well as with Mr. Longward's series, it is the Best.This time period is the beginning of the lost set-up, the long decline and fall of the Roman Empire and the role the Germanic people will play in it. It is drawn out like a breath, not quite a sigh-- this was a violent time, so more like the gurgling of blood in a throat. We have numerous sources for the time, yet archaeological evidence can be scant so it is a time of some mystery of just how the relations between the Germanic tribes and the Romans worked out.And thus fiction is our friend here and not just our entertainment. Our narrator Hraben of course is torn between his people, and working and fighting and bleeding from within the Roman palisade, as it were. With much to balance, not only personally, but professionally as alliances and balances of power shift, not just on maps between opposing forces, but within the imperial government-- he is at constant risk of losing something-- be it  his charge, his allegiances, that which is most personal (like his daughter and vengeance against enemies), or his life.This tale takes us all across the ancient landscape pocked by war and the inevitable revolutions of history and I couldn't ask for a finer guide than the author's Hero.

That's 180 softgel capsules per bottle. A real haul there in and of itself! No fishy taste so no smell-- important..only thing worse is garlic. The thing I really look for is freshness of fish and the efficacy of the extraction process. That Norwegian tech is so well-regarded I only go for Omega that employs it. Great deal on this.

I have a family history of high blood pressure and wanted to take preventative measures to ensure I wouldn't follow down the same path. My blood pressure readings used to consistently be in the pre-hypertensive range. After using Born Natural's CoQ10 for three weeks, my blood pressure levels are the lowest they've been in years. I literally have not changed a thing in regards to my diet or exercise. The only difference is this product. I HIGHLY recommend Born Natural's CoQ10 to anyone who has a history of hypertension in their family and is starting to trend towards higher levels. A++

I'd love to introduce you to Eve Appel, but I think she'd do a much better job introducing herself."I find chasing down killers more exciting than selling fashionable used clothing.""Crying is not something I often give into; I'm more of a 'turn your troubles into anger and blame someone else' gal.""Nobody ever accused me of having generous thoughts about those I don't like."In A SPORTING MURDER, Eve is often described as insensitive, a bully, and immune to the needs of others whenever she wants her way. Not exactly the most flattering traits one usually associates with a main character, but Eve's sense of humor redeems her in more ways than one."There's no worse romance spoiler than peanut butter breath.""How many killings can one sassy gal stumble into?""There's nothing like work to take your mind off murder. Well, there are other things too. Like sex, food, dancing"She can be a tad self-absorbed, but her best friend and business partner, Madeleine, is the selfless balm to her constant dose of assertiveness. They run a consignment clothing shop together, but aggressive just isn't Madeleine's style. She's a petite redhead to Eve's tall, sexy blond. She worries about the money while Eve always assumes that thinks will work out. Madeleine is clumsy and naive, but she holds fast to her principles, refusing to let Eve talk her into asking a mob boss for a small business loan they so desperately need.But when Madeleine's boyfriend, David, is convicted of first-degree murder, Eve tries to protect her from all of the ugly details related to the case. But this only angers Madeleine more when she feels that Eve doesn't think she can handle the truth, that she's too much of a wimp. Eve tries to help Madeleine by investigating what clues they do have, but she feels guilty leaving her BFF out of the loop."I should be a better friend to her instead of running all over, trying to play the tough little sleuth."Alex, Eve's PI boyfriend, couldn't agree more. But Eve hates seeing others in action while she's forced to sit on the sidelines. Even when for the most part her plans never work out, she still dives in, headfirst. She thinks chasing clues will bring her and Alex closer together as a couple, but it really doesn't. Instead, she quickly turns into a problem for him, getting in the way, and endangering herself in the process."He wanted me to stay out of this murder investigation/possible abduction more than he wanted me naked between the sheets. Well, he couldn't have it both ways."And that's when things start to get complicated, because there's another man, waiting in the wings, ready to take Alex's place.Sammy is a Miccosukee Indian with dark skin and long black hair. He looks like a warrior. Eve readily admits, "I liked Sammy's understated handsome looks and rugged style." When she takes off with him to investigate and doesn't come back until morning, she knows she's in a heap of trouble."Alone with a handsome Indian. Talking? Who would believe that?"Namely, Madeleine.Eve knows she can con her into not telling Alex that she was out all night with Sammy, even though their friendship is already pretty strained."I waited for her anger to pass. It did. It always did between us. Nothing, but nothing could sever our bond."But Eve's secrets soon catch up with her, putting both of their lives in danger. And as the action reaches its epic conclusion, Eve finds herself in quite a quandary."Here I was fashionably dressed with nowhere to go except my own death."Will Eve and Madeleine both survive this harrowing ordeal? You'll have to read this page turner of a mystery to find out!

This book is filled with motivational quotes and inspirational stories to help people on their daily journey. It's a terrific culling of Mr. Jackson's sayings & advice that have been vetted by, really, the very best authority: the public-- and the ones deemed to be most valuable or helpful have been collected here. And what a blessing!The various quoted tips herein are then embellished and broadened with 'Action' Jackson's personal experiences and how these ideas helped to guide him in his ventures in life ... and how they can help you, me, anyone who is willing to accept them. And with the varied, and at times, high-profile career Mr. Jackson has had there is a good deal of verity established herein.

I love the Preston & Child books. This is a treat for me as I've mostly stuck within the Pendergast storyline, but here we branch out a bit and get some character & historical bio background on other characters in the Pendergast-verse... namely, Eli Glinn, the head of EES who is leading an expedition down near and to Tierra del Fuego, the earth's south pole, and Antarctica on what seems a difficult, but operable, meteorite recovery mission with serious geo-politcal overtones.A terrific thriller, as all their books are, and fascinating science theory about the formation of 'worlds'...possibly our own even, certainly ET ones. The way these two authors build suspense and mash-up our own known history and the modern workings of our world with deep, fantastical speculation is second to none!

In Gallup, Greed is an engrossing mystery. I like the writers style and I also like the characters who are interesting and a bit weird. The detectives are a woman named Cinnamon and her partner Burro. The book takes place in the southwest, and Cinnamon has come there to find her mother who abandoned her at a young age. The whole thing starts with a sister, who hires Cinnamon and Burro to figure out if she killed her own brother while in a blackout. The suspects are involved in a native American art gallery, which is pretty interesting. Greed and spirits get involved. A good read to pass your time. I will look for more by the author.

Bulimia is a disease often associated with teenage girls, but for Johnnie Kitchen it's something she's been struggling with almost her entire life.Growing up, the temptation to binge and purge constantly surrounded her since the grandmother who raised her bakes mouth-watering cakes for a living. Now her son mocks her, trivializing what she's going through. Even her husband who pays for her treatment wants to know why she's not better yet.But Johnnie knows:"Even when you think you've won the battle, you can never let your guard down."Because the cause isn't physical, it's psychological.Her mother took off when she was eight when the problems at home became too hard to bear, and Johnnie ended up blaming herself for the reason she disappeared. While her friends' moms get all dolled up to drop their daughters off at ballet and tap, Johnnie's mom was off God knows where turning tricks for a living. Her mom didn't even keep a baby book about her. All she knew about her birthday was that it fell in 1964 somewhere between Good Friday and Easter Sunday. Later when she looked up her birth certificate online, she found her paternity simply listed as "father unknown.""I spewed you out, Mama, along with gallons of ice cream, bags of potato chips, leftovers I'd rescued from the back of the fridge. Cast you out like a bad demon. All your excuses, all the times you left me high and dry."The harsh reality that a bulimic faces is unflinchingly portrayed. From shoving the bristles of a toothbrush too far down her throat in order to make herself gag to getting caught by her husband scarfing down an entire skillet full of hamburger meat, a bulimic's shame and humiliation are ever apparent.And the disorder continues to follow Johnnie through all stages of her life.At eight, she is pudgy and unsure of herself, hiding under a winter coat to pretend to be thin. As a teenager, she's a lonely girl who just wants to shed fifteen pounds in order to have a boyfriend. In early adulthood, Johnnie looks at someone like the singer Karen Carpenter and how she died of anorexia and wonders:"If someone rich and famous can get sick how can a nineteen-year-old college girl get well?"It's only when after she gets married and her husband takes an interest in her condition that she starts to make strides in her recovery. For years, she never understood why she does what she does, choosing to view it as a dark, evil thing taking over her body.But as she reaches middle age, she has a breakthrough as she starts to grasp the foundation of her illness."When I binged, I stuffed all emotions down, not just food. And when I threw up, anger and rage spewed out, too. For years, I internalized these normal human feelingsand I acted them out through bulimia."After going back to college in her forties, she meets another woman suffering with bulimia in one of her classes. Her teeth are rotten from constant vomiting. Her eyes are bloodshot and her face sallow. She asks Johnnie for the magic pill, telling her how to quit. But Johnnie explains, it's not that easy. It's only going to work if she wants to stop bad enough. There's no other way around it.It's a fitting message to bulimic women out there who might be reading this bookwho are just as desperate to make a change, but don't know how. Johnnie's story shows them to never give up, living a healthy life with this disease can be done.

As a complete beginner, this book was exactly what I needed to learn Rails. Unlike a lot of the other rails books out there, John really walks you step by step through all of this in a clear and easy to understand way. Thanks John!

Not the $5-10 variety at your local store. Those will top out volume-wise at a mouse squeak! And the quality... well, I don't do that level any longer. Buck up to the Big Leagues is what I do now & exclusively. The mic on this is very clear, too-The materials and design make all the difference-- yeah, they're a bit more, but the sound cannot be compromised for whatever I'm listein' to. A Lot of times I use them late at night streaming movies or shows and I cannot tell you how vital it is to be able to have say, GoT in all it's audible glory::: sweet...

And requires a magic response. If you need help in this area, you've come to the right place. The most important relationship one can form in this life, in my opinion. The author gives us an introduction to the modern pagan religion of Wicca, and it's history up to this day. I was led to understand in here why this practice was beneficial to other people and the world, and how it has proven such beneficence down the ages.In conjunction with this worldview, there are Ethics, Rules & Basics which must be observed-- this is a morality which has to exist for these practices to work. After all, how can one expect to find love while doing anything that could harm others? With the 'Rule of Three' being the centerpiece here.Once we've laid that ground work, Living Inspired provides us with a rundown of supplies needed to perform this Love Magic. also writing your own spells & a 'Book of Shadows', what is candle and color magic, and specific spell instructions: like cooking recipes!I've not yet put what I've learned into practice ... but I intend to and have a good-to-great feeling about the results ;)

Surprised !!! I'd searched for a backpack for a long time, It's a novelty design. I wanted to take my girl friend climbing, we all like sports, and it's an excellent gift for my friend, I think. Maybe I should buy another one, you always give the best to your girl.It's got adjustable straps and is lightweight. I really dig the tube with a bite valve to drink, it's well fitted out for hunting, hiking and climbing. The nylon fabric is very resistant to wear and it's waterproof -of course- can be used for many years I'd reckon. The army camo design's also my favorite color, high quality for a low price-- it's really worth it.Great Pack..

How many people thought these would be so in demand some years ago when first cassettes, then Cd's and finally digital music sent the LPs & turntables to the dust heap?? ~HehBut they're back and I can tell you I really missed them, along with my small-head wooden tennis racket. This is a fabulous device and handles that vinyl, either vintage or even a new cut, very well.The vacuum wand works beautifully, is quiet and calming even-- I've not seen any sign that it thinks about doing anything other to my records than handling them with a gentle care (otherwise you're trying to clean the platters by hand and that's a mess and very dicey).A terrific addition to my burgeoning record collection and well-timed!

Then live that dream-- that's my plan, and Eric shows how. For those of us in love with the written word: you better believe it's more than possible. Freelancing really is the wave of the NOW... thanks to the internet and what has finally become a mature online economy.The steps are straightforward, but answer yourself this: do you have a bit of free time? Then you are a freelance candidate -- Congrats! Mr. Robbins walks us thru the steps of preparing and submitting materials so that we can have the best shot at landing those coveted freelancer projects.As well, what kind of rates one can charge, what it takes to write freelance (you don't have to be Bill Shakespeare), how to best hone your research, and building your very Own Brand... He covers all the pros & cons and exhorts necessary discipline.If anyone can follow this path, I really think I can do it too-

Great quality all around! They are constructed out of metal, so they feel high end. The sound quality is even better. Everything sounds really clear and tuned perfectly. It has awesome bass and the mids and highs cut through really well. These headphones come with a mic that offers crystal clear performance and is paired with an answer/end call button. The package also included a leather carrying case and best of all these headphones come with lifetime warranty! Really comfortable headphones to work out too. Very satisfied!
This book is crammed with interesting and fun facts about Howard Hughes. The author kept things short and sweet and yet, very informative. I recommend it.

And effort pays off. So does listening! The author's take on business growth & building covers all stages, but does require some basic, ground-level recognition of where you are and where you want your business to go. Is it a new or young business, or a more mature entity? These are crucial identifiers, as your strategy for marketing will need to play off these to a degree.As well, the author encourages us to adopt the proper mindset to position us for success. This is fundamental: a winning attitude leads to winning. Whereas, if you have the opposite outlook, you will reap negative rewards. Adopting a plan on the how & where to go with your business, again, can be engaged in with knowledge so one isn't traveling blind.The marketing pointers in this book are the treasure --its gems-- and key to the guide for your future endeavors as you seek to maximize your business's success.We get the do's & don'ts, and often you need to see what can happen adversely, in order to fully recognize the positive approaches. Many of these are simply businesses failing to listen properly, or to accept wholly testing results, or not diversifying, and etc.. Mostly due to inward-thinking, myopic viewing, and frankly laziness.On the positive side of the ledger is where Ann Carden makes her bread and butter, and can best be illustrated by teaching a business owner and management team how to plan ahead and to cover all bases. And much of this is how to listen to your customers or prospective customers, and how to implement the various feedback and indicators you are receiving from them and then crafting plans, strategies & tactics to deliver for them.This is a terrific approach & a must-read for any business regardless of size.

Really nice containers, and it matters for a traveler that this gear meets certain specs. These beat the heck out of anything like it you can find in the bargain bins. And will last a lot longer, as well. No leaks have marred my experience. And great little travel pouch for them anyway. +Top Marks+

Mostly cotton but with just enough spandex 'give' for an incredibly snug, adjustable wrap where neither mom/dad -nor- baby need to be uncomfortable. The gray is a light, and kind of neutral comforting color that I think visually fits the feel excellently. Feels Safe..

I'm able to effortlessly slice through meat, vegetables, fruit - these knives are extremely sharp and a real pleasure to use - don't forget the blade covers when not in use!As soon as you have one of these knives in my hand, I Feel the quality of a real premium product. There're many other knives one can get for a similar price but these are really a great buy for a such a High Quality, well-engineered product; making them a great value purchase.This set also comes in a slick gift box with a magnetic flap/seal to close which make it a lovely gift for any would be chefs / kitchen lovers.

The entire outfit, from the suction on the 'shield, to the adjustable arm and the swivel mount. Grips securely and totally allows me freedom of movement for not only myself & driving, but positioning my device how I like it at any given point in the drive. Excellent+++

.At 19 x 27 that gives me 513 sq. inches per shelf x 3 = 1539 sq. inches in total. That's a lot of good space to work with, and with the grating-like bases of the shelves they are no fuss drainable. Sturdy frame's complimented by the clear cover that let's in unlimited good sunlight -very necessary for what I'm usually plantin', tho that goes for many plants- but can be thoroughly sealed up to keep unwanted elements or critters out. Easy assemblage if, like me, you're not good with that type of thing, but even an advanced grower & gardener will be pleased with this piece of architecture.

And other things-- if you don't have a room! This is comparable to a good quality air mattress you may have for your home or camping, but this one fits the rear of mid-size sedans on up and has supports for the leg wells too. Couple air pillows thrown in and the all-important pump to get it going. Love this thing!

This ultra fine Cassava is the purest for fertility. First things first, give your ovulation the best boost possible to conceive-- that's over half the battle in and of itself. There is no 'Guarantee' of twins, however, but this sure does increase your chances. I mean to say, outside of a very expensive fertility clinic and their procedures: Organic Cassava Root is the best and least expensive way to try and achieve that goal of multiple fetuses.

African-American Urban fiction: you see it featured at bookstores & libraries even. Hood-life, slang, crime....al boiling down to simple survival. This is a gripping short featuring Damien Webster living in East St. Louis, Mo. ...and he wants out. Out of the life of a gang-banger, but of course he can't leave it-- Alive.After watching his cousin die by gunfire, he plans to get his family out and move to someplace safe. But, it's just not that easy, and no matter how much he promised the people in his life that he was trying to get out of THAT life-- he can't. Ten years pass, of him selling drugs, of the killer getting out of prison.This is a story of further abuse, abuse passed around.. particularly to the women in the lives of these E. St. Louis gangsters. The abuse starts young, they get roped in as minors and then its a life of babies --marriages? --if you're lucky, and BBW love.If you read this genre for sport, or never picked it up before-- this is a tremendous insight into lives lived outside the norm, but inside a code that's almost secret to practically everybody else.Does Damien, his aunt Rochelle and any others lookin' for that life raft find it in the end? Read on-- it just might wind up well after all...

This is the first of many good pieces of advice the author offers, and right off the bat. In practically anything you do that needs a strong commitment and a level head, NOT giving into anxiety is a Big Key. And when it comes to money matters-- and in this new economy, it's easy to let it all be quite overwhelming. The number one issue that wrecks relationships, as well.So, now that we're calm, Jameel is going to help us cement that calm by stepping us through getting organized, keeping track, the size and timing of your bill payments... and get this: how to make friends with your bill collector. That one threw me for a loop! Hadn't expected that-- it's almost like something out of another era, right? Well, in a way it is, but it's a piece of interpersonal communication which may be somewhat lost in our cyber world of today...but could sure use a strong comeback and our author-guide is here to show us how. Worth the price of the book right there!Beyond that, we may need to change our lifestyle if we don't have the funds for going on the way we have been. The ins & outs of Credit cards, loans, your credit report, & what to do if you're just flat busted broke.In the final section she answers us in terms of the big, existential financial question that we've all asked ourselves and a seemingly uncaring heavens at one time or another: 'Why Is This Happening To Me?' Well, I'll let Jameel answer that.But let me say, the author packs an Awful Lot of information in a fairly brief (60-odd pages) handbook I'd take with me everywhere.

I was looking for specifically, A Beginner's Guide-- and this is a terrific resource for those of us who are just getting started in aquariums. This walked me through all the introductory steps: and there are more than a few things that need to be done in order to do this right. Everything about adding animals and plants to the freshwater environment, and more.... all the way down to the cleaning processes once it's established.

A fine collection of some of the best information on parrots and other talking birds I've yet seen. And, there is no skirting around, we get right to training the bird to speak in the first chapter! There are a wide-array of different birds that fit into this subject category, and the author devotes a number of chapters to each of them: African greys, various Panama parrots, Toucans, Macaws-- the list goes on. And, one of the key and most vital elements to keeping birds like this is provided more or less early on (due to import), and that is various illnesses or diseases the birds may come down with. Symptoms and how to deal with it. Great & handy owner's manual.

Mr. Jackson covers just about everything you need to know about keeping rabbits and thankfully does so in a manner & writing which is understandable not just on an adult level, but for younger hare-keepers as well, I daresay.Beginning with just who & what rabbits are, the author takes us through everything from how to build a hutch and keep it clean, the feed/breed/disease hat trick, and on to how to prepare them for market.We are also given a really interesting look at all the different kinds of rabbits globally: Siberian, Japanese, etc.. A treat & terrifically informative!

Always been a big fan. Incredibly charming design that contains a double layer-- this is very durable to water and the ribbing to wind. The curved handle really helps keep a grip. Simple to open/close & fits my shoulder bag easily. +Big Pluses+

As it turns out, and I wasn't totally clueless about this as I'd seen it before. but-- what I didn't know about making YOMO (you only marry once) work was A LOT.It all starts, and must be made right, from the very outset. Even before there is a 'relationship'. Communication is the key, from there we must take steps to achieve 'active listening' in order to put (and keep) any relationship on a good footing. But you have to get there, first.Signals given and received, who are the chasers and the chased; think of the ideal partner you seek, Femi tells us, then act accordingly. Dress as you would like to be appreciated, speak in such a manner, and hang out at the places where you think your soul mate would be.The pitfalls of cheating are covered in here, as well as 'love blindness', making false connections... and a special section in this book that I never see covered enough --if at all!-- is how a person may have changed their true character over time from good to bad due to past, harmful relationships. We're helped herein by being guided in ways to achieve closure from past relationships-- and to find a sustainability in the relationship you wish to keep.There is so much more in the wonderful book and I would highly recommend it for the author's unique perspective on this timeless, human condition.

One that comes from personal experience. This is a marvelous autobiography of a man and the most important relationship in his life: his marriage. Indeed, it is easy to see from the very beginning that his wife is the center of his universe-- and he aims to help other men make the same 'Smart' decisions he has in maintaining such. I daresay the woman of the house could benefit from a read-thru of this as well to get a better handle on where their partner is coming from (in case they don't know yet ~Heh;)We get from Mr. Jones the real nuts & bolts of relationships. Put plainly and carefully-- this talk he has with the reader doesn't need make-up, just honesty. Here is where we're going: the author tells us our 'lady friend' at some point is going to be offered by another man: what do we do? Communication & trust, keeping things fresh romantically & just otherwise by not getting in a routine... In addition to what a man should know about himself; how about what he needs to know about his lady? Don't be clueless, she won't appreciate it.The terrific advice goes on -- the 'do's & don''s' --and these really do exist and they are very serious... So PAY ATTENTION. How to pick up the strained strands of the relationship after a fight, and just the ultimate/unavoidableness of change: which is just life. I felt good after reading this because what I'd been thru was not unique and there are ways of smartly dealing with it.

Hugely convenient and multi-tasking with numerous devices/appliances. The primary thing for me is to be able to charge my phone & pad while I'm on the go. Try that with the old cigarette lighter receptacle: it'll take hours and if you're trying more than one device at a time...? Forget it. This does all that and much faster with the kind of energy output it converts for you.
Terrific little 'Wonderbocker' adventure-- loved the Slugs!! ...Haha... really well made, and gives the tots a positive message = see it thru!

When we were looking into replacing our dining set we were a bit cowed by how big the decision was. We were fortunate enough to get some great advice from someone we trusted which ultimately led us to this fine dining table set that allowed us to close on it. Couldn't be happier!Some of the things we had to look for, questions asked & answered:--How big a dining set did we need? Tough one, how big was our family? How much extended family did we normally host? And how often did we throw parties for friends, or work-related get-togethers? (So it needed to look quite nice for the all important appearances impression).--In other words, how big the table, but just as importantly: how many chairs? We ultimately came to understand that we were in the market for something more in the dinette set range... therefor more Brady Bunch, than Cheaper by the Dozen.The dining chairs are super comfy, and all 7 pieces are well made & sturdy. It's a nice, lighter wood finish that matches more color schemes than darker wood, and more pleasant on the eyes. All in all a terrific purchase!dining set, table & chairs, dinette set, dining chairs

This is the fourth book in the Fiona Frost series and perhaps the most unusual yet! In Shillingstone, we go supernatural. Our heroine is on summer vacation-- even this young, high school forensics expert needs to take a break, right? I first became familiar with this series through the author's party themes and have become hooked on this character!Fiona finds that children are disappearing from the town and folks are blaming the old Shillingstone witch from the 19th century. Spooky! Unfortunately, she becomes the target of whatever wickedness is behind all this-- which looks very much like a tainted investigation wherein she is exposed to these 'otherwordly' beliefs she had been previously unfamiliar with.Fiona and her team of CSI take this fight to the witch and bait the legend in her lair in Louisiana and this story packs all the punch of a sultry southern night of wild fun and decadence needing to be set right! There's also info for joining the Fiona fan club, which I adore, or am able to find out more about Fiona's investigative tactics at her website (very neat).I feel like I purchased several unique items for the price of one!

For me to have the One Thing: be part of the unit, but then perform several different functions all w/out having to carry around spares which is aggravating. It autos my pad to sleep, protects it for transport, and acts as a view stand. This is just what I wanted and no access entanglements with lack of ports....

I love that -- and don't hear it used enough to describe the 'verb' USE of the intellect! It includes a wonderful, and wide-ranging collection of poems: and Fun Artwork. I really think the description of being comparable to a Shel Silverstein book is very much on the mark here.It's certainly a charming read & experience that lives in the now (of being a child), but on the verge of growing up, and some things to look forward to. As an adult, I got quite a kick out of reading this as well.Bridget has several delightful talents on display here and this is one of the very best Kindle purchases I've made.

Poo-Pourri -- and whoever came up with this gets my business~ This one's actually for the mouth. These folks know their odor sensitizers and covering sprays, I can attest! Tells those taste buds and other secreting mouth glands to Shape Up; & better at lasting than most any other brand I've tried.

Blends in so well in a child's room. The red's a favorite! Very sturdy, and it has to be-- heck even I can sit on it (not that I get much of a chance to:) ...best thing is that it cleans easily with just a wipe, too.

This book is so empowering.  It is a reminder to won our stories.  To rise from our shame and our fear.  Expressing our vulnerabilities shows strength, not weakness.  Another Brene Brown winner!!  Her gift for storytelling will help guide us to rewrite our stories, tell our stories, and own and change the outcome to what would serve us better.Highly, Highly Recommended

I liked this book.  It highlights the struggle the author had with getting sober.  It shares the pain of dealing with things you don't want to deal with, and the pain of change.  sometimes i felt like laughing.  sometimes crying.  sometimes cheering.  regardless, i could relate to the struggle for change.

Very nice wicker basket for my dog toys.  The size is great to fit lots of toys in for my german shepherd.  The fact that it latches helps me to keep the dogs out of the toys when I don't want them to have them.  This has been nice because my previous container didn't have a lid so i would pick them up and as soon as i did, the dogs would strew them across the room again.

This one is ok, but i like it the least of the 5 flirty aprons I have.  It just simply isn't very practical with the white, lacy front piece.  If you want to wear it just to serve it would be cute, but i don't think it is useful as a real apron.  I love ALL of my other flirty aprons though--so overall, they are great products that i would recommend.

I have really like Manhattan prep books.  In prepping for the GRE I have many books from them.  I researched several companies but liked their products the best.  They seem to explain things in a way that I understand.  This book provides a hefty amount of GRE practice problems complete with explanations.  It is a great book if you already have some studying under your belt.  If you are starting from scratch, I would suggest their other prep books and then get this after you get some studying in so that you can practice the exam.
Works great charging my ipad mini retina and iphone 6.  The absolute best thing is that it is purple!!!!  Great replacement cable or extra cable for car.

It's prettier in person than I thought it would be.  I love these pretty aprons.  They hold up well (this is my 4th one) and always make me feel like I look nice rather than slumpy.  Easy to wash and care for.  Highly recommend!!!!!!!

This product serves its purpose and protects non stick surfaces and reduces noise of pots/pans nested with each other.  With that said, there are prettier options if you want that.  There are also cheaper options (dishtowels).This includes 3 sizes and seems that it is durable and will last.  the flexible fabric allows you to use it in pans that might be smaller than what it is designed to be used with.
Excellent product.  Beautiful bright red.  Won't damage non stick surfaces.  Heat safe.  Highly recommend.And, the spaghetti spoon is my favorite.  If you don't have one, you need one :-)

The second ingredient is chicken meal.  Which would be ok they were more honest about that on packaging.  This looks like it would be lamb without chicken, a must for some sensitive dogs.  You only realize there is chicken in it if you look at the ingredients.  And, since it is the second ingredient, one must deduce that there must be a significant amount of chicken meal.

I LOVE THIS.  I compared side by side to Kindle paperwhite.  Its smaller.  The words are crisper (with older age eyes that helps).  It is a whiteish background rather than the yellowish.What I really love is the glass cover (or whatever material).  It is smooth and there is no decreased bevel.  It is smooth all the way across.  And when you touch it, your fingers feel that it is as smooth as glass.I am still getting used to page turns on the side of the device and sometimes just do it on the screen.  But overall, I love the page turns on the side--i just have to get use to the fact that the lower ones always advance forward (my brain wants to make the lower left one go back a page).  Turns out I am a slow learning on this but I know i will catch on.I love the autodimming feature.  I found manually dimming the paperwhite aggravating.  It also refreshes faster than the paperwhiteAND, I take notes in the books and when using the keyboard--this one can keep up with my speed much better than paperwhite.  which couldn't keep up with me at all.  It was very frustrating.The Origami CASE is a must.  And the biggest reason i liked this vs the paperwhite.  Don't get this confused.  This is a much, much better device than the paperwhite.  But I wouldn't have spent the extra money if it weren't for the wonderful case and its abilty to stand up on its own as well as how much smaller it is.  With the paperwhite it is considerably bigger in the case.

DId not like it.  It is bulkier than I like.  And the interior material is not something I enjoyed touching while the case was folded back and was trying to read.  I exchanged it for a Kindle voyage and its case.  (Yes, I bought the voyage just to get a nicer case)

THIS is the reason I bought the voyage (well, and the voyage had a couple of nice features I liked as well)..  This is a very thin case.  It is beautiful.  The inside is soft, unlike the one for the paperwhite (i have sensory issues and hated touching the amazon case on the paperwhite).  But the best feature is being able to have it stand on its own while I read.  Don't think you will use that much???  Well, you might be surprised.  I read at least twice as much now that i can read while eating.  Ok,  maybe not twice as much.  But, even when on my bed, i use the stand--so I use the stand almost all the time.I LOVE THIS.  I just wish it came in purple.  AND OMG--it is SOOOO much smaller when putting side by side to the paperwhite in its case.  (the paperwhite and voyage are different sizes--but it is markedly different when in cases)
Perfect for my use--to elevate a small TV.  Its plastic but looks attractive.  It seems sturdy and I didn't have any problems putting it together.
Love the music.  List to it repeatedly.
Good for an entry level mouthpiece of this time.  Not as good as a professional one, but you shouldn't expect that at this price point.  Very satisfied with purchase.

Nice looking.  My daughter loves it.  My only frustration is getting it to hang so that all 3 three things face the car rather than some being twisted to where you see the back of them.  But overall, extremely happy.

This is a great little speaker.  Because I do not have a line in for my cell phone in my car, i use this.  it can charge via USB and it pairs up with my phone's bluetooth.  The speaker isn't overly loud but loud enough.  It is meant as a small portable device, not a home stereo system.  I can also take with me to hotels when I travel.  Or camping.  Or on a picnic.  I love it.  I love that it is attractive also.  Carrying case is included to help protect it when you are taking it places.Update:  I have used this in my car over the last month and it is awesome.  I just have to remember to power it off--and sometimes I remember and sometimes I do not.  But the sound is great--I listen to my iphone through its speaker and it is a bold sound that is loud enough to drown out car noise so that I can hear my audible books with ease and no strain.  I actually have been using it in the car on every trip and just keep it plugged into the charger in my car.  I'm very pleased with this unit and would recommend to anyone who doesn't have a bluetooth built in radio in their car but wants  to listen to something from their phone (music, audible) .Highly recommend

Really great information.  Transformative to me as a survivor of PTSD and trauma.  Great for clinicians but also for clients.  There is so much validation in this book and it is based on the science and neurology behind trauma and PTSD
Beautiful!!!  easy to apply.  Perfect
My daughter likes Vandoren reeds the best and her music teacher recommends them.  She is a top Jazz student.
Great to use.  Simple, machine washable.  Use as a mitt or a regular hot pad.  Nice dark blue color.  Slip resistant.

Small, Easy to use and Accurate.  I like the small footprint of this scale because it doesn't take up much space on my counter.  I do not use it as a pocket scale--it is to big for me to want to carry around.  I use it primarily to measure food but like that it also can be used for mail :-).  Would recommend if you are looking for a small scale.

Natural Balance is a great food, especially for dogs with sensitive stomach or allergies.  My toy poodle does well on this food, regardless of the type of meat in it.  This particular one:  Legume and Duck, in my opinion, is great for even the most sensitive dogs.  I highly recommend any Natural Balance food, and especially this particular one if your dog has a lot of sensitivities or allergies.

I use this as a supplement to my dogs dry food.  It recommends that you refrigerate it before opening to preserve the flavor the best.  And you have to keep it refrigerated after opening.  My dog likes this and I would recommend to anyone wanting to supplement their dogs food.  It can be used as a stand alone product as well but that would be more expensive.

I love this stuff (or rather, my dog does).  My little toy poodle has a sensitive digestive system but does not have any problems with this food.  Wholesome ingredients, including flaxseed.  No By-product Meal.  I want my dog to eat healthy but i don't want to prepare his food so this is a great product.
Durable, beautiful.  Worth the splurge.  They make me smile compared to boring dividers.  Because they are durable, they are also practical.  These are not flimsy dividers.
Very pretty but not very durable.  The binding is soft paperback, not a durable soft material.  But it is beautiful so we are keeping.

You may think that a notebook is a notebook is a notebook.  But Five Star notebooks truly are superior.  For starts the covers are made from a flexible plastic or something so that they are durable.  The pages tear out with ease and do not leave bits or rip the paper by mistake.  The colors are great.  The pockets that divide each section are durable and have pocket that are durable.After using Five Star Notebooks, I won't buy any that are lesser quality.

These are the most comfortable jeans I have.  I have a few NYDJ but these are my favorite.  I have 2 pairs and would like a third cause I wear them all the time.  I was hesitant to order because they say "Legging" and I am overweight and pictured someone in overly tight pants with bulges everywhere.  But it turns out, they look great and they feel great.  The only downside is that they do not have front pockets--this is because of a tummy tucking feature--which is great--but i miss the pockets.

When Robin accepts an invitation to one of August's exciting and well-known parties that are meant for the most exclusive clique at Callabrese High School, she has no idea what she's in for.  This year's scavenger hunt is going to be over-the-top for sure. It's not long before all of Robin's friends are turning up dead. Who would ever want to do this? Could it be the popular host, August or is it someone that may have something in for him or maybe even one of the other party goers?  What seemed like a meant for fun scavenger hunt has turned into anything but fun and how will Robin get out without becoming a casualty herself?I really loved "The Rules" by Nancy Holder. She did an amazing job telling the story from the different character's perspectives. Each chapter started with a rule that a certain character follows within their daily life and how it comes into play with the story. I thought this was really unique and made it easy to follow.This is what I call a "One More Chapter Book" -- one that I keep putting off stopping long after my bedtime. From page one I was hooked and on the edge of my seat. The twists and turns were done in way that made me *think* I knew who it was.  Then I'd find out I wasn't as good at this as I thought.  So scared, and frantically reading, listening to the sounds my house makes at night, I stayed up until the very early morning turning pages until the book ended.This one is perfect for a late summer night read (any season really). Especially if you're into the horror/slasher type movies. Which, I'd like to mention would make a fantastic movie.  I would absolutely recommend "The Rules". This one is for those of you that also love their "One More Chapter Books".

Life changed for Frances Mace and her family while taking a luxury cruise. She found love and lost it for the very same reason. When she would finally be rescued, Frances would also lose her identity. If there's anyone that should be out for revenge, it's Frances Mace.The Daughter of Deep Silence does not disappoint. I think that there's so much in this novel; a little something for just about everyone's reading tastes.  Carrie Ryan does has done an amazing job with the writing of this book.  I was sucked in by the story from page one and it didn't let go until the end.  I was reading so quickly to find out what was going to happen next. I needed to slow my pace because as much as I wanted to find out exactly what was going to happen, I wasn't done spending time with the characters in this book.Frances is one of four people that survive a vicious attack on the Persephone.  By the time she's rescued by her friend Libby's father, there are only three people left to tell the tale of what happened that night. One of them was Grey, the boy she fell I love with on the cruise.  The second was his father, Senator Wells. The last survivor was Frances, herself. Why were the Senator and Grey lying about what happened on the luxuryYacht?  It was suggested by Libby's father that she take over Libby's identity so that he could protect her.  She was now all alone and so she agreed.While transitioning from Frances to Libby, she had to say goodbye to the only life she ever knew and take over Libby's life. For four years, Frances/Libby is prepared to do what she has to to get revenge on anyone and everyone that ruined her life, took away her family and friends, and demolished all she knew.I loved that Frances was such a strong heroine.  The statement that I thought described her best was -- just how far would one girl go when she thinks she has nothing left to lose!  There are so many quotes that are highlighted in my book. I want to tell you all of the parts of the story I went back to read a second time.  I highly recommend Daughter of Deep Silence by Carrie Ryan. Add it to your summer reading list. It's a suspenseful, revenge story that's utterly unique.  If Carrie Ryan is a new author for you, you're in for a treat. She has written so many fantastic books. If you've read her before, you already know to hold on.  You're in for a ride!

If you don't believe in magic, you will after reading Circus Mirandus by Cassie Beasley.  Circus Mirandus is about Micha Tuttle who has been living with his Grandpa Ephraim ever since his parents passed away.  Micha and his Grandpa have a very special bond and love each other fully and deeply.Grandpa Ephraim tells Micha stories about the great Circus Mirandus, The Man Who Bends Light, and all of it's magic. Micha believes in all of the stories his Grandpa tells him. He would like to go himself but Grandpa is now very ill and Great-Aunt Gertrudis has moved in to help. One thing Great-Aunt Gertrudis will not help with is Micha believing in the stories that Grandpa tells him. She doesn't approve at all.When Grandpa Ephraim does offer proof to Micha, he can hardly wait to get started on his journey. Grandpa tells him that The Man Who Bends Light owes him a miracle. One that was promised to him long ago when he was just a boy. So when the Circus Mirandus rolls into town, Micha and his friend Jenny (who isn't one who believes in magic) set out to find the Lightbender to get him to give Grandpa his miracle and make him well.Micha and Jenny have the best time at the circus. I truly fell in love with all of the characters and the descriptions in this book. Author Cassie Beasley has done an amazing job with Circus Mirandus.  It's well-written and the story flows beautifully.  I absolutely fell in love with Circus Mirandus.  I'm even going to say that this is probably the best children's book I've read all year. I would love to see this be made into a movie.  This is the perfect book for your children's summer reading list (and the young-at-heart). I know Circus Mirandus is a keeper for our bookshelf.  I highly recommend that you take a little time to spend with Micha and believe in magic!

I thought Flirty Aprons Women's Sultry Apron in  Lovely Lace is one adorable apron.  It was liked even more by the Mister than me. It's silky, sassy and will definitely raise the temperature in the kitchen before you even turn on the oven!This is a costume-type apron that has many features that I thought were cute!*  At the bottom of the blue skirt and top of the halter there's a sweet ruffle hem*  The heart-shaped lace top is flattering and fun*  It has adjustable strapsIs it perfect or practical for making dinner in?  Obviously not.  I think that it's easy to see that it's simply not made to be functional, but it will bring a little bit of flirtation to the kitchen.  If you're looking for a saucy little gift to bring/give to the bride-to-be, this is a perfect choice.

Joe gets a letter from Grandpa asking how his summer is going and hopes he'll hear about everything he's learned  when they meet for their special trip.Joe sends grandpa a letter back telling him all about just how "delicious summer" has been!  But assures him that he hasn't stopped learning or forgot about school during his vacation.  Joe tells him just how busy he's been and the reader sees just how busy he's been through all of the adorable pictures.  He's building ice cream sand castles, reading every day, and learning new words.  The younger set that this book is focused for is sure to learn some new words themselves, like "conquering", "equation", and  "cartography".  Joe assures his grandfather that he's busy with math equations, reading the encyclopedias he gave him and learning some History.  All of the things that Joe learns about or does is ice cream related in his mind.  He goes to the beach, summer camp, and on field trips.  He's sure to prove to grandpa that he definitely deserves the special vacation he's planning.There are so many ice cream facts that are located within the pictures.  You learn who made ice cream, how it is made, and even some of the important people that love ice cream almost as much as Joe does!  The facts are done in such a way that my little one's didn't even know they were learning these facts.  It's also become a recent favorite on our bedtime reading shelf.Peter Sis will show you one little boy who loves ice cream and teach you a few facts you probably didn't know.  The beautiful watercolor drawings made me think summer and all of the fun and relaxing things that come with it.  If only we could have that weather here in New England all year round.  Our family loved this book and found it to be a fun and fascinating read.  Highly recommended!

Cassidy is an eleven year old girl who lives to prank and be a tomboy! She can't wait to play with her best friend, Jack. They can hang out, fish, and have the very best summer vacation ever!But all that comes to a quick halt when she's "gifted" a summer stuck in etiquette school in the will of her late great-grandmother.  What is she going to do now? All she wants to do is follow her dream of being a "Knight of the Road" and she certainly doesn't need proper etiquette for that! Right?  Cassidy is also noticing Jack doesn't seem to be interested in their usual fun and games. Not even their pranks!  He seems to be more interested in the new neighbor who is a teenage girl and the exact opposite of Cassidy.I thought Cassidy's Guide to Everyday Etiquette would be one story that would be a winner for me. Unfortunately, I liked it, laughed more than a few times, but I thought it was a middle grade story that had potential that never really shined. And while Cassidy may find herself with a little more etiquette, it comes a little too late without enough laughs for even the younger set. I think this one would be better borrowed.

Damage Done is about a school shooting; a crime that is getting more attention in today's news. Eleven were killed during the mass murder, but Julia Vann was one of the survivors.  So why is this normal teenage girl now attending a new school after moving to a little town in Northern California? Her whole family has changed. In her "new life", she's known as Lucy Black.The biggest thing that Julia/Lucy is trying to get over is the fact that her twin brother, Ryan committed suicide.  If you haven't figured out why, it's because Ryan was the shooter.  Before all of this happened, Julia and Ryan were inseparable, as close as a twin brother and sister could be.  How will she start over. Where will she begin?Damage Done is told by Julia/Lucy and you'll also find very important notes written by Dr. Spence, who is her twin brother Ryan's therapist. As the story moves on, Julia/Lucy begins telling you more and more information about the past. The fact that Her parent's were in such denial was simply unreal. But this creepy story which is full of twists and turns that will keep you glued. (As it did me)  Amanda Panitch is an amazing writer.  The pace is quick and easy to read.  The characters are all well-written and totally believable.As the story continues to quickly moves to the end, the story of the school shooting and the reality of what happened after is revealed.  The damage is done and can't be changed.  This is one book that not only YA lovers will want to read, but you can count suspense, thriller, and horror readers as well. Just about anyone who loves a dark mystery should have this one on their list of books to read. I will be looking forward to see what Amanda Panitch comes out with next!

Since I was young, I've had a slight incontinence problem that only got worse after having cancer twice and a few major surgeries.  I've tried all different kinds of incontinence panties. (ie Depend, Depend Silhouette, Tena, and Always).  My favorite have always been the Depends Silhouette Brand.  I used to wear the Depends Silhouette Maximum Strength all the time.  They have so many amazing details that still make me feel confident and beautiful.  I say this because I'm younger and sometimes I like to wear a something special and not have to worry about looking like I'm wearing a diaper.  The New Depend Underwear Silhouette Active Fit has all the things I love about the maximum strength panties but for daytime, they have even more things to love.At night, I still stick with the Depends Underwear Silhouette Maximum Strength just in case.  But now during the day, I have another choice to help me personally.  I am a tiny woman and I am only about 4'11" tall and approximately 100 pounds.  I wear the small/medium fit in any of the depends products and they fit perfectly.  Why do I love these?  It's so easy.*  They are made of a cotton-type fabric*  The look and feel just like cotton panties*  While I usually can only find beige in the Maximum Strength, these also come in black*  These are stretchy and fit snug so that you can wear your slinky maxi dress or jeans!*  The Depend Active Fit has a much lower rise than the regular Depend Silhouette Underwear*  They are super thin and comfortable*  Available in moderate absorbency*  The comfortable fit leaves you feeling confident no matter what you choose to wear*  Easy pull apart seams on either side just like the full maximum absorbency.I use the Depend Underwear Silhouette Active Fit strictly for my daytime use.  They keep me feeling confident that there will not be any kind of leak and the stretchy, snug fit is perfect for anything you want to wear.  You can't tell that these are incontinence panties under anything you choose to wear.  At night, I am confident in using the Depend Underwear Silhouette Maximum Strength.  I have grown to trust the Depend name over the years and their products keep getting better and better.I highly recommend the Depend Underwear Silhouette Active Fit (in black or beige) for the woman on the go who has a slight bladder problem and likes to stay active.  You can go dancing in your favorite dress, go to the gym, and do just about any activity that you can think of and love without there being a single problem.  Depend Silhouette's is my favorite brand and I just know you'll love them just as much as I do!

I'd like to note that I got these for my oldest son who goes golfing with his friends three to four times a week.  Callaway is a brand that he has grown to know and love and they are definitely his favorite brand.He's owned these shoes close to a month and is a size 12.  They are comfortable, light and run true to size.  The look of the Del Mar Zephyr by Callaway is quite stylish but despite the like sneaker--type look, they're very durable.When he first saw them, he thought that they made need a separate insole for comfort.  But after trying them on, he was surprised at how comfortable the Ortholite 3D insole was.  After playing about twelve rounds of golf, he still talks about how comfortable and light the Callaway Del Mar Zephyr's are.The Del Mar Zephyr by Callaway does not have a spiked sole.  The sole is rubber with some raised areas for traction.  I know my son plays in the mornings on occasion and hasn't complained about his socks getting wet.  I can't comment on total wetness or pouring rain because I haven't seen him go out to play in these conditions.  Especially as of late.The final verdict on the Callaway Del Maar Zephyr is that they are an absolute keeper!  My son loves his and from course to clubhouse, he wears these time and time again.
