He's even bought a couple of different colors to wear since he received these.  It's the lightness of the shoe mixed with support and comfort that make them unbeatable!  Highly recommended to anyone that loves to play golf.  Wether you're a seasoned golfer or a novice, you'll love and appreciate the design and style right out of the box.

Now that the nice, warm weather is here in New England and we've gotten rid of all of the snow, a day hike/picnic is just what we needed after being cooped up inside and doing activities that are indoor related due to weather.There is nothing worse for me than carrying a heavy pack.  I am a petite 4'11" and 100 pounds.  Anything too heavy makes me want to pack it up early and/ or have someone else carry my pack.  We have a Thule Bike Rack and I have been really excited to try some of their other items.  The bike rack is made well and has quality written all over it.  We haven't had a single problem with the rack.This is a light backpack that is meant to fit a woman's frame.  It's easily adjustable and comfortable to wear.  The Capstone 32 L Hiking Pack features it's MicroAdjust Suspension System that will let me adjust the torso length by 4" to get the perfect fit.,  The shoulder harness, torso, and hip belt system is specific to a woman's body structure.I love the built in rain cover that allows you to continue hiking without ruining the contents of the bag if a rain shower comes along.  There are also more storage spaces in this pack than you could ever need or want.  The top zippered pouch lets you hold things that you don't want to fall out but may need more often than some of the other things packed. It's suggested to hold your essentials. I used this for my water bottle and sunscreen.  There are also two hip belt pockets that are perfect for a cell phone or maybe a snack.  Finally you'll find a stretch fabric "shove-it" pocket that Thule suggests you put your gear that you'll need most often.I absolutely love my new Thule Women's capstone Hiking Pack (32 Liter, Jewel/Potion)!  After using this pack twice, I have yet to find anything that I do not like about the pack and if I do you'll be sure to see it right here updated at the bottom of my review!  It's an amazing pack and extremely light and comfortable.  Highly recommended.

Big News! (Emma is on the Air #1) is simply an adorable book!  Eight year old Emma Perez wants one thing more than anything! More than anything in the world Emma wants to be famous. She figures the best way to do that is to become a News Reporter.  With the help of Emma's father, who happens to be Journalist himself, he teaches Emma how to find a story, something everyone would want to know about, follow the clues, and write and report a fantastic story.Emma found her story After her friend Javier finds a worm in his hamburger; one from the cafeteria. She knew that she would have to get witnesses, investigate, and report the story!  I love that Emma's Spanish heritage is highlighted and that they use small Spanish words and phrases throughout the book.Young and young-at-heart will find Emma to be an intelligent girl with big dreams! They'll also find this fun and easy chapter book to be a perfect  summer read.  Our family loved Ida Siegal's new debut chapter book and can't wait to find out what Emma's up to next!

I absolutely agree that there are not enough books about WWII (or World War One for that matter) aimed at younger children. I thought that the Battle of the Bulge did a thorough job on some parts, maybe a little too thorough for ages 8-12 and then I thought other parts seemed scattered. As much as I'd like to have more history and non-fiction books for younger children, I don't think this one hits the mark.I found it too heavy and complicated for most children in even the higher of the age range. The Battle of the Bulge could possibly help as reference to a school report with the help of a parent or teacher but I just don't see this as leisure reading for even the youngest history buffs. The pictures and maps that are in this book may help set off the rich reading content for the younger set; I'm even unsure about that.There is no doubt that as an adult writer Rick Atkinson knows the subject he covers and turns out well-written books. For children, I don't agree that just taking pieces of his writing or even one portion of the war and adding smaller chapters, photographs and maps will make for understandable, easy literature for grammar school aged children.I found this book hard to follow.  What I found even harder were some of the questions that came from my little one.  I could tell he was confused by the look on his face.  This one was just not a win for us as a children's book.

While I was recovering from surgery this year, I watched the first to seasons of Moone Boy on Hulu with my real friend. I actually found Martin and his awesome imaginary friend Sean (who is played by played by co-writer and star of the show Chris O'Dowd) extremely funny and the first person I thought of was my oldest son. Not because he reminds me of either one of them, but because I thought he'd enjoy it too. Now my oldest son is above the middle school years so I wasn't concerned with the cursing or fighting or bullying.  This is not because I don't care but I know he's old enough to understand right from wrong.  I was right, he did find it funny and watched the two seasons as well. I'm also going to go ahead and say that I liked the BBC TV show more than I enjoyed the book. This is a rarity.  I'm normally a book over TV/movie person by far.  But here's why...The story has "footnotes" on almost every page. It really takes you out of the story and what's going on with Martin and Sean. You can try to wait to read the footnote until the end of each page or wherever they may pop-up, but you'll more than likely have to read it because they are mainly terms or things used in Ireland or Europe in general. I found those really annoying. I just didn't like the way the book was set up. I can only imagine how a pre-teen boy that may or may not be a reluctant reader would feel about this. However, if they can get past that, boys are going to be the main audience for this book. There is a lot of gross humor and the story does play up just how horrible sisters can be.  But being a sister to myself to a brother, I think they can definitely do their own share of damage in the stages while we grow up. It's simple sibling rivalry.  One day you're the best of friends and the next day you won't sit together in the same room with each other. Those of us that have siblings understand. Martin IS the only boy in the house.I found the television show to just flow better. I am even proof that more than middle grade boys can find this story humorous.  I think you definitely get much more of the humor when you see it being acted out. Especially when they show Sean in both his invisible friend state and visible state (to Martin only) while others look on. I think it's a very cute idea and it's not unbelievable for Martin to go looking for a male imaginary friend to help him through his daily adventures.  His for real friend is busy working the family farm for the summer.I thought I'd love the book because I liked the TV Show. I thought it was okay and I even laughed out loud through some of it. But I have to hold my ground and go with the TV Show over the book. I also think it's a little long and takes quite a while to get into the story for the average pre-teen boy.  It's just slow throughout the book with scattered funny parts.  I was really sad this wasn't a five star love for me.  But I would say that if you get a chance to watch the TV Show to definitely give it a try. It's worth it.

My little one loved book 1 in the TombQuest Series. So it was a given that Amulet Keepers, TombQuest Book 2 was on our reading list! This story has Alex and Ren off to London where people are missing, graves are being opened, and blood red rain is flowing through the streets. After a little research, Alex decides that they should look into the Highgate Cemetery where they find that an ancient Egyptian evil creature is behind all of the mystery going on.The Death Walker, who will suck your soul is very dangerous. In this book, we still loved Alex and Ren.  The Egyptian feel was a fun and fast-paced setting as well. The Amulet Keepers is an action packed book that kept my little one wanting me to read "just a little bit more" every time I tried to stop!  This is definitely one series we'll continue to follow.Some children may be interested in the computerized game that goes along with the book. I think it's a really creative feature. We would most definitely recommend Amulet Keepers and the TombQuest series to both the young and young at heart that love a mystery. The fast-paced Egyptian setting is pretty enticing too!

Marjorie Trumaine has gone through so much over the past few years.  She and her husband Hank used to run their farm together in North Dakota.  But Hark has had a very serious accident leaving him almost completely paralyzed and blind. Marjorie now cares for her husband and the farm with the help of her neighbors and friends. Marjorie is an avid reader and was able to take a class that now has her employed as an indexer. This keeps their bills paid and food on their table.One day when Sheriff Hilo Jenkins comes to the door and it isn't to have a visit with his close friend Hank, Marjorie is puzzled. Sheriff Jenkins informs her that their neighbor's Mr. and Mrs. Knudson have been murdered and an amulet was found clutched in Mr. Erik Knudson's hand. Sheriff Hilo Jenkins quietly asks Marjorie to help him investigate this amulet and find out as much about it as she possibly can.Because of her husband's close friendship with the sheriff and her worry of the murder being so close, she agrees to find out all she can.  But when she starts to feel like she's being watched, and more murders occur, she becomes more determined to help solve this mystery. What can these amulets mean? Who is killing the good people of their small town and why?Author Larry Sweazy had me up late two nights in row lost in his beautifully written mystery.  His writing made me feel like I was right there with Marjorie. I was thrilled with the twists and turns that were taken. It also made me realize what it was like to solve a murder and to take care of her ill husband without all of the new gadgets that we have today.  I highly recommend See Also Murder to anyone that loves a good old-fashioned mystery with a strong, intelligent heroine. This one will surely keep you up at night!

Stephen is forced to move away to his father's hometown of Spencer.  Having spent all of their money on his mom's medical bills and his father losing his job; they move in with his grandmother who never shows emotion and likes to keep everything tidy. Besides the move with his father, Stephen's mom in an Asylum because she's been seeing things and is a danger not only to herself, but others. Stephen isn't expecting the best summer.It isn't long before Stephen meets Cara and her thin brother Devon. Devon and his friends' hang out every night at the play ground. Which is actually the cemetery.  It's here where they meet and drink. I thought all of the characters were very well-written. They all spoke and acted like teenage children. Stephen was especially well-written. Spencer is a town that has their own superstitions and folk law about "the winged ones" who show up during dark and dangerous times.  The only way to bring good times back to the town is to keep "the winged ones" happy by having a sacrifice.  Or so everyone believes. Stephen finds comfort in Cara. He also happens to think she's hot. Devon's got to be a great friend, right? He invited Stephen to hang out at the cemetery with his friends when he didn't have to.But Stephen just wants to fit in. He wants to have new friends. But when Cara and Devon turn out to be anything but who Stephen thinks they are, he doesn't know what to do or what to believe.  Heather Brewer turns up the creepiness, mystery, and darkness throughout the entire story. I loved The Cemetery Boys!  It grabs you at page one and doesn't let go until the book has ended. And what an ending it is! I highly recommend The Cemetery Boys to anyone that likes a fantastic coming of age story mixed with suspense, twists, and turns!

At the beginning of Velvet, Caitlin's mother has just passed away from being ill. Because her father passed away quite a while ago, Caitlin is forced to move in with her aunt, uncle, and cousin she hardly knows.  I chose to read Velvet because I had taken a long break from vampire novels for a while. I took a chance, and I have to admit that I'm glad I did.Caitlin's neighbor Adrian has been keeping an eye on her. He's her bodyguard because she has a daemon after her. What better way to protect Caitlin than to pretend he's her boyfriend. But because Adrian is also a Vampire, he can't be in love with a human. Caitlin's pretend feelings definitely turn into real feelings.  Soon they're inseparable.The character's in this story made it a fun, fast read.  Their thoughts and things they said were funny and sweet.  Caitlin and Adrian made a very cute couple.  I also loved Caitlin's friend Kelly. The story was well-written and seemed to go by very quickly.  The ending is a cliffhanger and if you want to find out what's next, there's always that dreaded wait. I do recommend Temple West's "Velvet" and I'll certainly be picking up the next book in this series!

After finishing Broken Hearts, Fences, and Other Things to Mend, I had to fin out what happened at the end of that story. It was somewhat of a cliffhanger and I couldn't just leave Hallie and Gemma where they were. After Hallie knowing Gemma's true identity all summer and then stealing Gemma's boyfriend, I had to get right into Revenge, Ice Cream and Other Things Best Served Cold.Sophie comes to visit Gemma in the Hampton's where she's found a job scooping ice cream to pay back her father. But it isn't long before Gemma and Hallie are back at each other's throats and planning prank after prank to one up each other. In this book we get adorable Ford, Gemma's long time crush and his sister too. Gemma knows that she and Ford are good friends, but I can't help but to hope for a little more romance in the next book!Katie Finn has a well-written, easy to read sequel that is a fun, fast read. It's the perfect book to take with you on vacation, a long car trip, or to the beach!  I highly recommend Revenge, Ice Cream, and Other Things Best Served Cold. It will have you laughing out loud!

The Secrets We Keep by Trisha Leaver is a hauntingly beautiful. Two identical twin sisters Ella and Maddy love each other and are very close but they couldn't be more different. Maddy is the outgoing popular one with tons of friends and always looking for a way to be in the spotlight.  Ella is the quiet one with few friends and her favorite sketchbook. If anyone has ever been in her sister's shadow, it's Ella.One fateful night when Ella is driving Maddy's car, they get into a tragic car accident and one of twins dies and one of the twin's live.  When Ella wakes up in the hospital and everyone thinks she's Maddy, Ella decides to live her sister's life. I think mainly because she believes everyone loves Maddy while no one hardly ever notices Ella. So how could she be missed?  She takes on her sister's persona for her family and Maddy's friends.As the months go on, Ella learns many secrets that her sister has kept her sheltered from. There are amazing twists and turns that kept me turning pages way after my bedtime!  I thought about Maddy, Ella, and their story long after finishing the book.  I absolutely loved The Secrets We Keep and would highly recommend it to YA lovers, mystery lovers, just about anyone that loves a well-written story that will make you think. Trisha Leaver did a beautiful job with this story.

Material Girls by Elaine Dimopoulos was marketed as a dystopian type of "Divergent" mixed with "Project Runway".  I loved the Divergent series and I'm a total fashion lover.  So for me, I thought this would be something I'd absolutely love!  I liked it and the premise was interesting, but I couldn't really see what I'd call a "Divergent" type of story.What's interesting is that thirteen year olds await their "Tap". This is wether they'll stay in school for the lesser wanted jobs aka "adequates" or the more desired jobs where the teens control fashion, become judges on the court of what becomes popular, and of course super pop stardom.Marla has always had an eye for fashion and sits as a Judge of the court to decide what items become popular. She's received much praise and many accolades during her time on the Court. That is until some of the other judges start to disagree with what drafts Marla thinks will be popular. She's then demoted to the basement where she then has to start drafting fashion.Ivy is a super hot pop star.  Everything in her life is scripted. But when she steps out, what she's wearing is immediately popular. Ivy is a diva in every way and knows that most would have to struggle to wear the things she does. When Marla and Ivy meet, they start to talk about overthrowing all that they've ever known. Marla and some of the other drafters are planning on bringing back or recycling some of the older looks to make new looks and Ivy is going to wear them to make these clothes ultra popular.Loving fashion the way I do, I found this read to be fast and fun. But there was a lot missing with the background of "the government" and even the world that they lived in. I think Material Girls will have a certain following, but because the world and background are not really explained; it certainly will not be for everyone. If you're a fashionista, I'd recommend you give it a try.

The Disappearance of Emily H. is one of the cutest books I've read in a while.  Raine and her mother move to a new town when her grandmother dies. Raine lived with her grandmother until she was six.  Raine's grandmother could see hints of a living memory reading "sparkles".  Raine has the very same power.  She learns by reading the "sparkles" in her home that a girl named Emily Huvar is missing.When Raine goes to sign up for school, she meets a young girl that's right out of home-schooling named Shirlee. Shirlee and Raine are both being bullied by the mean girls - mainly Jennifer. The  two girls decide to use Jennifer's crush on a boy named Michael to get back at her for the way she's been treating them both.  It was very clever of both Raine and Shirlee to think of this (which is probably how a Middle School Child reading this would take it. But me, being an adult, I immediately stopped to wonder if bullying should be fought back with more bullying).All of the characters in this story were written perfectly for middle grade students. I just wanted more for the ending. I loved the story and the "sparkles". Those things kept me turning pages to find out what would happen next. I would love to see more of Raine and her power.  I think it could be just what middle school children need.There were a few things within the story that I immediately wondered about.  This is an example, but it's also a spoiler so please do not read the rest of this paragraph if you don't want to know anything about the story.  Now I'm not one to nit-pick stories for little holes and I almost never post a spoiler. But when a child has been missing, I believe the police would take her cell phone and her laptop.  That way they could monitor what she was doing online or whom she was speaking with. But that was not done. This is just one example. I'm not sure that children would think of this. But I bet parents' would.I loved The Disappearance of Emily H. and would highly recommend it to the young and young-at-heart.  It's a great read with some important messages. Put this on your child's summer reading list!  It was a lot of fun with a hint of paranormal!

Invasion of Privacy by Christopher Reich is an amazingly written thriller about all the privacy issues and cyber crimes we face today.  Mary Grant wants answers regarding the death of her FBI Agent, husband Joe. She needs answers not only for herself, but for their two daughters Jesse and Grace that she is now left to raise alone.  It doesn't seem that anyone has answers so Mary just may have to find them out herself.Christopher Reich has written a fast-paced thriller that will keep you turning pages until you reach the very end. I loved the story, the characters, and the haunting reality of the novel itself.  This has to be one of the best thrillers I've read in a while. I went to sleep reading this book and woke up the next morning and picked it up off the nightstand to take with me in the kitchen.This is a really fast read full of action and thrills that just do not stop.  I highly recommend Invasion of Privacy to anyone that loves a great thriller!

In The Truth According to us, it's 1938 and The Great Depression is making life hard for many.  Not Layla Beck. She's used to luxury being a daughter of a United States Senator.  That is until she refuses to marry a wealthy young suitor. This angers her father and he cuts off her allowance and demanding she find employment with the Federal Writers' Project. Within days she finds herself in a very different atmosphere from what she's used to. The tiny mill town of Macedonia.While there she boards with The Romeyn Family in their home.  It's here she meets Willa Romeyn.  While researching the town of Macedonia, they find more than they bargained for. Together they dig into the past of the Romeyn family and the secrets hidden within.  Layla meets many townspeople and family members. Her summer becomes anything but that dreaded spot of boredom she thought it would be.The Truth According to Us is filled with characters you're sure to fall in love with. The women are strong, beautiful, and are people you'd love to have as friends of your own.  The descriptive writing of the time period will get you lost in this amazingly written novel.  I loved this book from page one.  There was so much to learn about Macedonia, The Romeyn Family, and oneself.  Sometimes all that's needed is trust, love, and friendship.  I highly recommend The Truth According to Us. It would absolutely make a wonderful novel for book clubs. With so many different things to discuss.

When I read the blurb of "The Little Paris Bookshop", I knew I had to read it. To me, what's not to love about a tiny floating bookstore in France located on a barge in the Seine?  Especially one that has an owner that's there solely to help you find what you're missing in life through books!  That's right Monsieur Perdu isn't there to just sell the latest best sellers, but he has a knack for matching the right book with the right person.Monsieur Perdu is busy fixing everyone else's life but the one he can't seem to fix is his very own.  Left with only a letter from the love of his life he feels broken and sure he'll always be that way. Up to this point, the letter has remained sealed.  But he takes a chance and is soon on his own journey.Nina George touched my heart and soul with The Little Paris Bookshop.  I loved this book so much that I've read it twice this month. This is one of those books that you want to read slowly to savor each and every page. I highly recommend The Little Paris Romance.  It's the perfect book to take with you on summer vacation or to the beach!

In Letters to the Lost, Jess is on the run trying to escape her abusive boyfriend.  She finds shelter in an abandoned house. It's here she finds the letter of a dying man.  This letter is to the one and only love of his life.  Stella and Dan fall in love during WWII in London while her husband Charles is stationed in North Africa where he will be Chaplain.There is no denying the love between Stella and Dan as Jess reads their letters.  She becomes so involved that she has to find out what became of both Stella and Dan. Jess gets William involved to help her find the two lovebirds and soon they find themselves inseparable.Iona Grey writes a beautiful novel that I read in one sitting. I laughed, cried, and cheered on these unbelievably real characters.  If you're looking for an old fashioned love story, Letters to the Lost is for you!  I thought about these four characters long after I finished the book.  It touched my heart and it brought me to tears.  One of my favorites so far this year!  I absolutely loved it!

To say The Library at Mount Char is unique would probably be an understatement.  Here we have a man who's supposed to be like God who "adopts" twelve children.  They now call him father.  He keeps them living in his library like prisoners. They are each there to master a different skill.  The Library at Mount Char is a fantasy, science fiction book that I found terrifying, dark, and mysterious. It does contain some humor that is pretty much a necessity to break up everything else going on.At the beginning of the book, Father is missing and no one knows where he could be.  It's obvious that if he never comes back, someone new will need to lead them. But who would that be?  I thought that each of the twelve were thinking this but some were taking a more serious approach.  From the first page of this book, I was in disbelief.  I think that's what mainly kept the pages turning for me way past my bedtime.I just had to know what was going to happen next.  This book is just crazy.  Full of many unexpected twists and turns to keep you guessing. I would also like to mention that this book is NOT for the squeamish. It really shocked me in some places. I do recommend that you give The Library at Mount Char a chance if this is your type of story.  It's full of horror and imagination!

At the beginning of last summer I read and finished C. Robert Cargill's Dreams and Shadows. I loved the world building, the fact that Colby won the war of the Limestone Kingdom and ran the fairies out of Texas. I thought Colby went through so much and grew as a character in book one. But with the loss of his best friend, we see a different Colby in Queen of the Dark Things.I have been reading quite a bit of fantasy set in a place most of us would know rather than a totally made up place. I like to see where the author will take a place like Texas and make it his own. This book is full of magic and mystery like the first. But I did feel it drag in some places.  It took me longer than normal to finish this book. I kept putting it down and picking up something else. Then, when I finished that book, I would start again.Colby is depressed and clearly misses his best friend in Queen of the Dark Things. I did enjoy the book, but not as much as the first. I am hoping that book three will give us more on Colby and the many new characters introduced in this book that were there one minute and then seemed to be forgotten about the next.If you read the first book, I would recommend Queen of the Dark Things. That's just how I am. I like to see how a sequel continues on with the first book. I would also recommend this series to anyone who loves fantasy in a modern place. I did like Queen of the Dark Things but it wasn't what I expected.  I will be picking up the next installment because I like to see how everything comes together.  The only time I wouldn't would be if the first book just wasn't for me. I think this series will have many fans that will love it from start to finish.

When Sophie and her parents' are forced to move because of her father's job loss from Los Angeles to a farm they inherited from their late Great Uncle Jim, she's homesick and sure that she'll never fit in.I was so thrilled that Sophie is mixed heritage and brought some diversity to this children's book.  Unusual Chickens for the Exception Poultry Farmer is told mainly though letters to Sophie's Uncle Jim and beloved grandmother that have both passed. There are also quizzes, to-do lists, and even a Chicken-Care Correspondence Course.In the beginning Sophie doesn't think she'll be very good at raising chickens, button no time, she's got it under control. Well, as under control as possible when dealing with chickens that have super powers!When the town's resident chicken expert, Ms. Griegson is trying to steal the chickens, Sophie must protect them and find out why.Our family absolutely loved Unusual Chickens for the Exception Poultry Farmer!  It's fun, family oriented, and deals with trusting that everything isn't always what it seems.We highly recommend this book for both reading out loud and for alone time as well!  You'll love laughing along with this unusual group of chickens!

Memoirs are not my normal choice for reading preference. They can sometimes be drawn out, tell too much or too little, and sometimes never get to the part of that person's life that we really want to know about. Kate Betts' My Paris Dream is a beautifully written memoir. It takes us inside not only the life she worked so hard for, but the heart of fashion.Kate's mother told her to "Just Go" that "she could always come back"!  I found Kate's story one that just about anyone could relate to. We all have our Paris, we all have our dream, and so many times we never get to follow our dreams. One reason or another comes up and we forget about what we really wanted to do or be. Not Kate.She moved to France, rented a room, and learned the language. He first major break was working below John Fairchild at Women's Wear Day and from there she went to Vogue! How exciting to know all of the important designers that were shaping fashion! Kate was really living her dream. She wrote for Harper's Bazaar and even Time.If there ever was love letter written to Paris, Fashion, and one woman living her dreams, My Paris Dream is absolutely it!  I loved this book! Highly recommended!

Sisters of Blood and Spirit first drew me in with it's gorgeous cover and blurb. I know, I've heard it before - "don't judge a book by it's cover" - but sometimes...it's extremely hard.I really liked this one and am glad I'm stepping out of my comfort zone lately!  A thrilling ghost story that's action packed and has a great plot.  What's not to like? Tie in a smidgen of romance and there you have a nearly perfect YA Novel!Yes, I said nearly. Why? Well, I would love to know more about both Lark and Wren, their famil, and definitely the Shadowlands.  Lark is the "living twin" the one that actually took a breath here on earth and wasn't stillborn like her sister Wren. Lark's parent's basically disowned her and sent her to live with her grandparents. She can still see her sister Wren and even talk to her.But after a suicide attempt and the fact mostly everyone at school thinks she's crazy because she still talks to her sister; she feels like she belongs in the shadowlands more than her sister Wren does. The shadowlands is a place Wren goes when she feels she needs to be with the dead.This story is so very well-written and Kady Cross does a fantastic job at keeping the sisters completely opposite with their own voices.Eventually some of the students come to Lark for help (Wren too) with a problem they're having with a ghost themselves. Lark is tough and she has everything she needs to stay strong through anything.I was just surprised at how quickly this novel went by! I can't wait for the next installment and would highly recommend this book.

To me, Bounty Basic Paper Towels are absolutely above any other ordinary "bargain-brand paper towel".  For the price, they're a great value.  I love the wide variety of sizes and prints that they come in.  You definitely don't get that with many other bargain-brand paper towels.  But my favorite thing about these have to be the option to select-a-size.  You only take what you need.I honestly think these are stronger than any other bargain-brand.  When these get wet, it takes a lot to make them tear.  This way, you're not in the middle of cleaning and end up with torn towel and your hand in a mess.  For bigger spills or for messes the little ones make, I always find myself using extra paper towels just to make sure that everything is cleaned up and left sparkling clean.  That's a "me" thing, though.  It's not Bounty's fault I'm OCD when it comes to cleaning.These are a perfect choice for our family.  I find them to be strong and worth every penny.  It looks like I may be in the minority right now with other reviews that are listed.  But, I am only comparing these to other bargain-brand paper towels.  I'm not comparing them to the 2x absorbent or the extra strength paper-towels.  I think if you put them up against any of the others in this category, Bounty will definitely come out on top.  Realistically, unless there is a sale or coupon, I get what I pay for.Over the years, Bounty is a name that I've grown to love and trust.  I use their products on the most important people in my life, my family!  I highly recommend these Bounty Basic Paper Towels to anyone that may be a little budget conscious but still wants a super absorbent paper towel!  I love these!

Pantene is my favorite drug store shampoo.  I use this Pantene Pro-V Smooth and Sleek Conditioner with the matching Shampoo and I couldn't be happier with the results!  After having a Brazilian Blowout done to my hair, I have to be careful not to use any products that contain sulfur.  It reverses the straightening process much faster.Pantene Pro-V Smooth and Sleek is a thick and rich conditioner that makes a beautiful lather.  I can actually feel the difference when I use it.  My hair feels softer and looks really shiny even before I use any styling products!  It's perfect for the ends of my hair and isn't so heavy that it weighs my hair down.Even when using my straightening iron or curling wand, my hair remains moisture rich and not dry at all. I find that when I use a better shampoo and conditioner, I lose less hair and it's never dull.  I absolutely love the Pro-V Smooth and Sleek line. It's perfect for keeping my hair straight, shiny and smooth!

You can find Nick Cannon on television.  He's an actor and an all around entertainer.  My kids know him from Nickelodeon.  Now, you can also find him on the shelf at your nearest bookstore or library.  Just in time for poetry month, Mr. Cannon is putting out his new poetry book out there this April!  Neon Aliens Ate My Homework will help introduce poetry to younger children with a Hip Hop influence.  Nick is obviously proud that these two things have helped make him who he is today.There's a letter and biography of Nick Cannon at the beginning of the book.  Here, he definitely gives props to Shel Silverstein for helping him get into poetry.  I grew up on Shel Silverstein and I loved every book I've ever read that he's had published.  There's even a poem in Neon Aliens Ate My Homework that immediately took me back and reminded me of Shel's poem "Mrs. McTwitter The Babysitter".  It was really nice to be brought back to this much simpler time in my life.Nick does talk about all things gross, funny, and sure to make children laugh.  All of the poems are accompanied by amazing art done by six unbelievably talented street artists that you can learn about in each of their biographies in the book.I'm not one that listens to Hip Hop all the time.  Poetry isn't even my favorite genre.  Not even close.  But I did enjoy the time I spent reading Neon Aliens Ate My Homework and I know my children did as well.  It's a quick read and a lot of fun.  We definitely liked it.

First, let me just say that I love cookbooks.  I have been collecting them for years in order to gain experience in the kitchen and to make our meal time different.  We're far from the same old thing every single night. There's nothing worse than having to have the same things all the time because one (or more) of your children only like(s) certain foods.  Now, with that being said, I do understand that this happens, there are allergies, and just some foods that most children don't particularly like.  Unless maybe they're brought up on it.  I was definitely taken by surprise to find that the "tips and tricks" in this cookbook to getting children to eat adult foods or maybe a dish that may not be "kid friendly" is to simply cut down on the spices or make it a little bland.  I know this simply wouldn't work for my kids and I am not one to make three different things for dinner, lunch or even breakfast!Is this a beautiful cookbook? Yes! It absolutely is! There are bold, colorful pages and it's packed with one hundred recipes.  The problem? You probably won't find many recipes that you'll want to make as a part of your regular meal time.  I didn't, anyway.  This cookbook is definitely not for beginners.  I'll just say they weren't kidding when they titled this "The Gourmet Dad".  I feel that I am pretty advanced in the kitchen.  I've cooked for myself and my family for years.  I am always testing my skills with different classes and recipes and I found many of these recipes much too time consuming for the final results.There were a surprising amount of ingredients needed for quite a few of these recipes that I wouldn't just happen to have on hand waiting in my kitchen.  That's a really big problem.  I don't want to have to go hunting for ingredients before making dinner or while prepping.  My children also like to help with dinner and I would be a total liar if I didn't say that this is my favorite part as well.  But, In order for this to happen, the recipes need to be easy to follow.  Another problem was getting them interested in trying out one of the recipes.My final thoughts - I really wanted to love this cookbook and add it to my arsenal of everyday dinners.  To me, it's just not a "family cookbook".  The odd ingredients and types of food that are in this book are just not for my family.  I did like it for a possible "date night" alone without the kids.  I would have loved to see kid-friendly and fun recipes from "The Gourmet Dad" and so would have our kids.I would give "The Gourmet Dad" 3.5 to 4 stars.  Amazon considers three stars as -  "It's okay" and four stars are -  "I like it".  I would feel comfortable rating this cookbook between the two.  I think finding what's right for you and your family is a personal choice.  It's always hard to find the perfect cookbook.  Some are easier than others and some remind you of home.

We've been feeding our 2 year old Ori-Pei Royal Canin Mini since we brought her home.  At first, she would eat the entire bowl.  She loved it and looked forward to eating.  But we noticed that as time went on, she started eating less and less.  Our Veterinarian recommended we try Hill's Science Diet.We started off by mixing only a little with her "regular food" each day and increased it until the entire bowl was full with the "new food", the Hill's Science Diet.  She's back to eating all of her food and "cleaning her plate" again.I'm very happy with the results we received with the Hill's Science Diet.  Will she keep it up forever?  Only time will tell.  But I'm willing to stick it out and make sure she's happy any way I can.Charlotte is loved by our entire family.  If it's new food that she needs for her finicky palate, well then that's something we can totally do for her.  She's brought so much joy into all of our lives that it's a pleasure to bring that same joy back to her life.  We're all better for knowing, Charlotte.We highly recommend Hill's Science Diet and are fully satisfied with the reaction we received!

I absolutely love everything about the Mai Couture Trio, Like A Diamond.  It's convenient, ready to travel, and gives me just the right amount of touch up color!  I think this is a pretty amazing idea!  I mean, to me, there is so much to love about highlighter and two different blush colors that fit in one little book! You get 60 sheets, 20 of each color in a little gold booklet.  If you're wondering how to apply, they even give instructions in the back of the booklet.The three that I got to test were a highlighter in Crystal Cove, and two different blush colors one in Sunset Blvd. and the other in Studio City.  I love my daily makeup and wear way too much to use just this.  But, this does make the most perfect touch up packet.  I could also see myself using this during the summer if I just needed a light application.  Also, I've taken this with me to the gym!  It's simply the easiest application I've ever tried!  No brushes needed at all!The highlighter is a gorgeous sparkly white color.  It's perfect for highlighting your forehead, the bridge of your nose, and under your eyes (above the top of your cheekbones).  The two different colors of blush are soft and pretty.  Not too dark or really rosy.  More of a coral and a darker pink.  If you like a lot of color on your cheeks, you simply press harder with the paper and in a circular motion up your cheekbone.  If you prefer only a touch of color, use a lighter touch but still move in a circular motion.I like to contour and highlight.  My everyday blush color is a more "natural" shade than these.  I think these colors look best on me when I have a tan or a little color to my skin.I do have to say that I liked the convenience of these so much that I've purchased the foundation papers and the Mai Couture Papier Wallet to hold them in.  I highly recommend the Mai Couture Trio!  It's absolutely perfect for the warm summer months coming up when you don't want your makeup running off of your face.  These provide color and convenience!  Love!

I've been looking for a small printer to put in my son's bedroom.  This way he could have his own printer to use without using all of my ink,  Not to mention asking to be in the home office when I need to be doing things for the work that I do. Who would've thought that this small little machine could do so much? This "Small In One" does just about everything a much bigger "All In One" printer can do.This compact design is perfect for my son's room. It takes up very little space his desk. This alone would make it a perfect choice for a second computer or for use while living in a college dorm room.I'm not a computer tech by any means, but this printer/scanner/copier was easy enough for me to set up all by myself.  I did it wirelessly.  It found my network and I just put in our password.  I can't stress how simple this was!  You can also set up with a USB Cord. (Sold Separately)This prints beautiful pictures.  I mean really gorgeous.  The paper is fed in through the top back of the machine.  This does not automatically print double sided sheets.  It does however hold a nice amount of paper.  One hundred pages!We love the fact that we can print from our iPhones, iPad, iPad Air, and Kindle too. You can basically print from any smartphone or mobile device.  It's equipped for both IOS and Android.Another great little feature the XP-320 has is the built-in SD Slot.  Which is used for PC-free photo printing.  You can basically print from anywhere with this little printer with or without a network!The Epson XP-320 also will scan to Facebook and the cloud for easy photo sharing.  It also saves you money by letting you replace only the color of ink you need when it's run out.You simply can't beat the quality of the Epson XP-320 for the asking price.  It's a beautiful little printer/copier/scanner that will make your everyday tasks a little easier.  We love ours and simply can't say enough about it! Highly recommended!

I've been using Keratin Complex Keratin Color Care Shampoo and Conditioner for about six months now.  This set was recommended to me by my hair stylist.  She recommended them because I had a Brazilian Blowout after I had highlights done.  The Keratin Complex Shampoo and Conditioner are both sulfur free and have kept my hair sleek and shiny.The Keratin Complex has a light, fresh, and clean scent that makes my hair smell wonderful.  It keeps my style straight with no flyaway's even after I blow dry my hair.  I've noticed that my hair is strong and that there is no breakage despite me having the Brazilian Blowout.I wouldn't use anything else on my hair.  I absolutely love the Keratin Complex Shampoo and Conditioner.  It's so important to use the right products on your hair after having a Brazilian Blowout Treatment to make the results last as long as possible.  It may be a little pricey for shampoo and conditioner, but you only need a small amount to get a rich, thick lather.  I think Amazon has the best prices for this shampoo and conditioner hands down!  Amazon beats out my stylist and every other site I've checked to purchase these.I highly recommend the Keratin Complex Keratin Color Care Shampoo and Conditioner for anyone that has had their hair treated.  Including a Brazilian Blowout, Keratin Treatment, highlights, and color.  I know you'll love this shampoo and conditioner combo!

I chose this Remington XF8550 Smartedge Advanced Foil Shaver for my oldest son to use.  He has sensitive skin and has always had trouble finding the perfect shaver.  One that doesn't leave his face red and irritated.  He never uses manual razors; just electric shavers mainly due to this issue.  He's had several (Philips) Norelco Shavers and loved them. I'll have to admit that he was completely skeptical and even a little leery to change over to the Remington XF8550.  He thought for sure it wouldn't be able to get a close enough shave especially without needing to press harder than normal.  After trying it out, he had to admit that he couldn't have been more wrong!  He loves it and there are many reasons why.First of all the Remington XF8550 is aesthetically pleasing with it's sleek design and beautiful cobalt blue color. You charge this shaver in the included base for two hours and it gives you ninety minutes of use after a full charge.  But, if you're in a hurry, you can "quick charge" it for five minutes and you'll get enough use out of it for a full shaving session.  The Remington XF8550 can be used with or without shaving gel, dry or wet, and it can even be taken into the shower with you.  The rubber handle is a perfect fit for the hand and it will not slip.My son loved the pivoting head and how it does cling to the face. Especially around his chin, jaw, and neck. The Remington XF8550 gave an extremely close shave, neatly trimmed his beard and mustache perfectly.  The trimmer is a necessary feature for my son. It's creates precise lines and details and is great for sideburns or smaller areas that need a close shave like his goatee.If you do come across hair that doesn't shave off easily, you should never press down hard instead it helps to use moderate slow circular strokes. This will help you avoid irritated, red skin or even damage to your new shaver.Cleaning the Remington XF8550 is very easy.  It's suggested that you remove the foil head and rinse under running water.  Once inside is clean, simply replace the foil topper.  The outside of the shaver just can be wiped clean with warm water and a clean rag, no cleaning solution of any kind. Dry with a soft towel.  Remington notes that the teeth of the trimmer should be lubricated with  oil about every six months. Included with this shaver is a two year limited warranty.We highly recommend the Remington XF8550 Advanced Foil Shaver for a perfect, smooth shave every single time.  It's the quick and easy way to get the appearance you're looking for. It's small enough but extremely powerful and even comes with a carrying pouch that fits both the shaver and charging station. This makes the shaver a great choice for travel and for use at the gym. It would even make a wonderful gift for the man in your life or even for yourself!

Hanes Men's Ultimate X-Temp are my oldest son's absolute favorite socks.  He wears a size 13 shoe and these fit perfectly. They do not stretch too thin or fit tightly around the ankle. They're just the right length as well.The Ultimate X-Temp Socks do an excellent job of keeping your feet cool playing sports, running, and just while wearing them all day.These are the best no show socks and are a great value here on Amazon. James is a name our family grew up with. These are quality made, comfortably soft, and are good as new wash after wash.Highly recommended for a large range of sizes (even the larger ones).  Quality socks at a discount price!
Purchased for a friend who says it is delicious.  Arrived in timely manner.

Arrived in timely manner, packaged well.  It is a little bigger than I hoped, at least for using indoors in an RV anyway, but it works well.  We live full-time in an RV in central TX where gnats seem to be a constant most of the year, but this certainly takes care of them!  It is VERY bright at night in the confines of the RV, but if it means no gnats, we'll take it.
Fit perfectly, but took longer than expected to arrive.
Bought for my Mom, she loves Amway products.
Bought for a friend, she likes it a lot.
Bought for my Mom, she loves it.

I started to watch the TV series, but decided to read the books first.  I enjoyed this, it was intriguing, but with a creepy edge to it.  I did find myself hoping that subsequent books would resolve some of the questions I had about what was going on.
Purchased for a friend, she loved the style of it, but said it was hot on her head.

Easy to clean, but what we like best is it is easy to see the birds.  With our old feeder they were frequently hidden on the other side, but this feeder eliminates that problem, we can see them well no matter where they are at the feeder.When first putting it together, we noticed that the screw part of the long metal holder had something in the grooves of the screw that prevented it from screwing in properly.  My husband had to clean the grooves out really well, then it worked fine.Our only concern now, which remains to be seen, is that when the sugar water gets low, it looks like the birds won't be able to reach the nectar and we'll end up throwing a lot of nectar away when we take it down to clean and refill.

I bought this for my best friend because she likes "bling".  She loved it and I ordered another one for her in a second color.  The third time she wore it, the elastic completely gave out and it came apart.  Now she has to find someone to fix it for her.  Should not fall apart within 3 weeks of arriving new!

I listened to the Whispersync version and will say right away that I didn't care for the narrator's voice and intonations.  This may have caused me to be constantly distracted.  I enjoy "serial killer" stories, to a degree, and liked this one because they actually (finally) fleshed out the background of the killer and why he ended up the way he did.  I thought the storyline involving the dog was very good, it added an interesting dimension to the story.  I thought the name given to the killer was pretty dumb, and it irritated me every time I heard it.  I was also irritated that the killer, though never portrayed as being particularly sophisticated in terms of computers or investigation methods, always seemed to be way ahead of both Zoe and the cops.  By the time I was half way through, I just wanted to find out how it all ended and get it over with.

I started watching this, not realizing where the storyline came from.  I was interested in it at once, and even more so as it became obvious that it was from a book I had read and really enjoyed.  I'm in the same place with this as with Extant though...Done with Season 1 and anxiously awaiting the next season.  Soon.  Thank you.
I enjoyed this so much...can we move on to Season 2, please?  Immediately.

These are amazing for me.  I hate the effervescent stuff, I can't take pills and Tums do NOTHING for me.  These are highly chewable, don't taste bad at all and are not chalky, dissolve in your mouth pretty quickly and really do the job.  When I eat garlic,  there has not been a product yet that could end the pain, but this works immediately, most of the time with just 1, occasionally 2.  If Tums doesn't work that great for you, I recommend trying these.
Purchased as a gift, he loved it.
Actually saw this at the salon I go to and read a little while waiting.  Pretty entertaining, bought it on Kindle to share with my Mom.
The burners in the rental house we are in were just awful...all bent and twisted out of shape.  We ordered these and they fit and work perfectly.
The burners in the rental house we are in were just awful...all bent and twisted out of shape.  We ordered these and they fit and work perfectly.
Sounds like an interesting book, however, no Whispersync available, so I will pass.

I'm struggling to give this 3 stars.  I really hated this book.  At first it was interesting and kept me intrigued, but then it spiraled down into a dark hatefulness that made it difficult for me to even finish the book.  I have a strong tendency to "take on" the feelings of books I read while I am reading them, then it may take me a day or so to shake off those feelings.  This book left me feeling angry.  One thing is certain for me:  I will NOT watch the movie.

Well FIVE stars of course!  This is one of the best series I've ever watched.  I'll be so disappointed when it's over.  Love the storyline, the actors, and especially Anson Mount, a most interesting man.  I waited until it was done so I could watch it all the way through without having to go week-to-week. I recommend this series to anyone and everyone.
Got these for my Mom since she insists on taking B12.  She says they help her feel better.
Colors true to photo, really nice pillow.  Would like it to be a bit softer, but it goes beautifully with our decor and looks great on the sofa.

In spite of the price, we didn't expect this to really "do the job", but WOW were we surprised!  My husband and I both have lower back issues from time to time and have frequently had the electric stim at the chiropractor's, so that's what we're used to and didn't expect anything even close to that from this unit.Our first surprise was how tiny the unit is.  It's so little that we were sure we were going to be disappointed in what it could do.  Having had it a few weeks now and have both used it a number of times and we are VERY pleased.  We've tried all of the programs and we each have our favorites, but they all do a good job.Pros:  Small and portable, more powerful than expected, provides 3 sets of different pads, the pads are very nicely "sticky" and stick well while peeling off fairly easily. Easy to operate, easy to "get" what the programs do, variety of programs.Cons:  While they provide 3 sets of pads, we find that we both really only use one set and that is the large set.  We will order more of those, we've found the small ones to not be very useful for our purposes (back).  We also wish it came with a little pouch or holder that we could hang on our waistband when we have to move around with it.All in all, a very nice investment for us.  It has helped both of us a lot.
Look exactly like the photo, colors are lovely and go very well with our decor.  I'd like them to be just a bit "squishier", but they are nice.

I like these and they work just fine, but the color is a lot darker than it appears in the picture.  Where it looks kind of tan/brown, on mine it is actually VERY dark magenta and the blue is considerable darker.  Not exactly what I was expecting, but, they do the job they are supposed to.

Love this bag so much that after I got the first one, I ordered 3 more as gifts.  The color is exactly the way it looks in the picture.  I haven't used it a lot yet, but it is fairly roomy and the handle seems sturdy.  Only time will tell how well it holds up to everyday use, but it is a lovely tote.

This lamp is fabulous!  I've tried a lot of desk lamps over the years and this is the best one I've ever had.  I've only had it a week or so, but love it.  Small footprint, beautiful and elegant, minimal design, very responsive touch on/off and excellent lighting make this perfect for my workspace.  I am getting one for my husband's desk as well.I also received an email from the company following up to make sure it was delivered in excellent condition, and giving me contact information in the event that I needed to contact them for any reason.  This kind of customer service is so rare these days, that I must say I was impressed.So far, I highly recommend the lamp!

My Mom is staying with me, and she wanted some TastyKake Butterscotch Krimpets.  These were always a staple in our home outside of Philadelphia, when I was growing up and we all loved them.  They were moist, flavorful and thoroughly delcious BACK THEN.The ones we bought last week are just awful.  To start with, they are about HALF the size of the ones we grew up with, they are, as my husband said, "taste free", and I really mean that.  There is just no taste at all.  And, they are so dense and dry that you can barely choke them down.  I literally ate half of one and threw the rest away.We will not buy these again.  They are absolutely NOT the wonderful treats we grew up with.

LOVE.  Very convenient and give off just enough nice light.  I bought these as an extra night light for my elderly Mom's bathroom so she could see when going to the bathroom in the middle of the night.  These have an 8 hr timer that is SO convenient; I don't constantly have to worry about turning them off or having to replace batteries every few days.  Loved them so much that I bought a set for my bedroom.
I needed a second power cord for my Samsung computer, this is exactly like the original, and I am very happy with it.
This was a purchase that I made to be sent to someone else.  I understand it worked fine for it's purpose.

This is the best windshield suction NAV holder I've tried.  I put it on (in Texas in the heat) the day I left on a long trip.  Not once did it fall off or give me the slightest problem.  I have now been in Arizona (extreme heat daily) for more than 2 weeks, and it has not budged!  Adjusts easily, is very sturdy, doesn't bounce like some do, and doesn't drop off the windshield like every one I've had in the past has done.  Love this, encouraged my husband to get one for his truck.

I was excited to try this and see if it worked as well as some said it did.  I was disappointed with the outcome though.  I put it on exactly as directed, was pretty happy with the results, then very dismayed to see that after I took a shower that night, it was nearly all washed out.  I tried it again the next day, making sure that I didn't miss anything important in the directions, and experienced the same result.  Doesn't work for me, was a waste of time and money.

I found this coffee at our local HEB in Texas and fell in love with it.  Then...they didn't have it anymore, boo!  Thank goodness for Amazon and Prime...This has been my favorite coffee for more than 6 months now and my Mom just tried it and she's in love with it as well.  (I'm traveling right now and brought my mini Keurig and a bunch of boxes of French Market, that's how serious I am about this coffee, lol!)

I love how Wen makes my hair feel. I will admit though, that I wash my hair first with another favorite shampoo, then put the Wen on and work it in well, leave it on for about 3 or 4 minutes then rinse it out.  I ALWAYS get compliments on my hair since using this.  Now that I can buy it on Amazon and not get trapped into an "auto subscription", I will buy it.Edited to add this issue:OK, been using this a while...just finishing up my second bottle, and I am beginning to get large bumps on my scalp a lot of the time, kind of like big pimples!  I get them on the sides, top and occasionally on the back of my head.  I have done a lot of reading about this, and apparently a lot of people are experiencing the same thing.  I rinse very well, so that is not the issue.  If this continues, I will have to stop using this product.  I have 1 bottle left, and will try to use it, but just wanted to put this out there as kind of an "fyi".

I bought this to use to frame a sign for a friend's wedding.  It was exactly what I wanted (kind of shabby chic), and was lovely.  The bride loved it as well, and it blended well with the other frames used.

I love this bra so much!  The cups fit like they were custom made for me, the straps are perfect.  The only drawback to this bra, and all of the bras I have purchased from Chantelle, is that the back strap is ALWAYS way too small.  My back must be a lot bigger than whoever they make their bras for.  I bought a bunch of extenders and that solves the problem for me.I buy only Chantelle now, I have not found another bra company that has bras that fit so beautifully in the cups, and oh yes, their bras are beyond beautiful.

I loved the first 3 books, but I am surely finding it a challenge to get through this one and it is mostly the narration that is the problem.  The guy's voice is OK, I'm getting used to it, but the girl's voice....ACCKK...it's like sharp rocks scraping across my eardrums.  Her voice is sharp and unsettling, she reads in a very choppy manner, and the WORST is mispronouncing words that were pronounced differently in the first 3 books...it took me a while to figure out what she was talking about when she mentioned Clary's "steeley"...What???  It has previously been pronounced like "stel-lay";  and Idris has previously been pronounced, um...."Idris", duh....this girl pronounces it "EEdris".Yes, I know I'm nitpicking here, but good grief, can we stay with the same words for the entire series?  It really annoys me, lol, as if you can't tell that.

I actually liked this one better than the first.  The first one left way too many questions hanging, and this answered them, especially the ones I was most interested in.  I like the way the story played out in this too...I was never bored with it.  The fact that so many questions were answered does leave me wondering where they could possibly go with this series though...I guess I'll see.

I LOVE this thing!!  LOVE it I tell you!  I had it clamped to the top back of one of our leather sofas for a while and it was great...I could lay down on the sofa and have my Asus tablet at EXACTLY the angle I needed it without having to hold it...it's awesome!  Problem is...the clamp that attaches it eventually loosened up a bit and cut into the leather.  Took it off of there and moved it to the bedroom in our RV (where we live full time).  We attached it above my side of the bed to the inside/outside of the small cabinet above the bed (cabinet door lifts straight up & had to stay open, but wow it was so worth it).  It was PERFECT right there.  I could lay in bed and watch tv/netflix, whatever and it would easily adjust to any angle I needed, and I could easily push it out of the way when I was preparing to go to sleep.  Tonight we discovered that again, the clamp had loosened up and had slid down a bit a gouged a big gash into the cabinetry.  NOT happy about that, but we are trying to figure out a way to reattach and avoid damage.  We think a small piece of wood as a buffer will work.  Will try to fix it tomorrow.  My husband is probably going to get one if we can figure out how to keep it from damaging stuff.  This is an awesome little thing, but you really have to think through where to attach it and it REALLY needs a buffer of some type to keep it from damaging things.  I still give it 5 stars because of its awesomeness.

Gift for my Mom and she loved it.  Said it fit fine and she really liked the color.  Don't know why it says "Plus Size", it wasn't.  She said it was nice quality and perfect for relaxing around the house.

...I can really tell a difference when I DON'T take it.  I took this twice daily for a couple of months and ran out.  Didn't really worry about getting more, just figured whenever I got around to it.  Within a week, I felt like I had lost energy and just didn't feel like doing anything.  I didn't even think about it being this...until I ordered more and started taking it again.  Within DAYS I felt good, and energetic again.  I take this with L-Carnitine daily, so the same thing applies to the L-Carnitine.

...I can really tell a difference when I DON'T take it.  I took this twice daily for a couple of months and ran out.  Didn't really worry about getting more, just figured whenever I got around to it.  Within a week, I felt like I had lost energy and just didn't feel like doing anything.  I didn't even think about it being this...until I ordered more and started taking it again.  Within DAYS I felt good, and energetic again.  I take this with D-Ribose daily, so the same thing applies to the D-Ribose.

Didn't really worry about getting more, just figured whenever I got around to it.  Within a week, I felt like I had lost energy and just didn't feel like doing anything.  I didn't even think about it being this...until I ordered more and started taking it again.  Within DAYS I felt good, and energetic again.  I take this with D-Ribose daily, so the same thing applies to the D-Ribose.

I do not like to take pills, so I thought these would be great; and they are!  However, I ordered them for myself, for my Mom and for my niece and ALL of them arrived with the gummies all melted together in a big ball of gummy,  My Mom ended up throwing hers away, and I tried to take most of mine by pulling pieces off the big blob.  Would not buy these again through mail...only in person somewhere to make sure they were not like that.

I used this quite regularly and really don't know if there is a difference in my appearance at all.  A couple of the products have a weird "fishy" smell to them that I find a bit off-putting, but it's not horrible.  When I take into account the expense of the products, I just don't know if they are worth it.  My research lately tells me that Perricone is one of the few product lines that is good for the skin as opposed to stripping it of natural oils, so may look at trying some of his other products.  Just can't say that the Cold Plasma facial products produce any results.
We have a 2007 Fleetwood 5th wheel and needed this part for our hot water heater.  My husband said it was the right part and fit and works fine.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Hell on Wheels.  Probably my favorite show ever.  EVER.  I love Anson Mount, I love his character, and honestly a lot of the other characters/actors are pretty darned good too.  Love the story, love the show.  Hope this show is around for awhile.

I  bought this because so many of the reviews raved about it.  I've been using it quite regularly for nearly 3 weeks and haven't seen ANY change at all to the dark age spots on my face.  NO change.  Would not buy this again.  For goodness sake...don't get this stuff ANYWHERE near your eyes!  It'll make your eyes burn like crazy.

Bought these for my husband to replace his older ones.  He says the sound quality is excellent and they are very comfortable, but he hasn't had a chance to use them with his phone yet.  Will update when he does.

From the outset I was addicted to this show, though I really didn't think I would be.  With all the binge drinking and smoking I thought it would be off-putting, but the characters are so well done that I just can't stop watching.

...and can't wait for it to return!  This is one of those shows that I wish I could just wait for the season to be over so I could "consume it" all at once, but alas, I find I cannot wait...as soon as I get a show, I have to watch it!
I actually really enjoy this game...and I like the neon better than the regular Flow game, just looks kind of cool.  Fun game, but I only play the free version, so can't speak to the premium stuff.

My old cord went belly up and I knew I wanted to replace it with a longer cord.  This is perfect...I can use my tablet while plugged in with no problem now.  Probably will order another one.  Be aware that the OEM cord had white text on one side of the plug that plugs into the tablet, so I always knew which way to turn it to plug it in...this one is black on both sides, I finally put a mark on one side to make it more convenient.

These have come in very handy, and not just for photography related stuff!  I actually got some with my Think Tank Airport bag, but figured it couldn't hurt to have more and I was right.  Will definitely be getting more of them.

I really love this bag already.  It is easy to handle, get in and out of the car and it moves beautifully when being pulled along.  I moved my gear from a quite large wedding photog's bag to this and though it didn't ALL fit, all the important stuff did.  It is compact and with a little readjustment, the dividers worked out nicely for me.  I can see that I may redo the dividers at some point, but for now they are fine.It's kind of nice to have all my "must have" gear in one neat bag and I stowed the rest in the old bag, which now has room for all manner of accessories that were previously laying around the house.This is my 4th large camera bag, my first Think Tank, and by far the best buy.  For quick airline trips, I can fit the minimum of gear, a couple clothes changes and my tablet, which makes it very convenient.If I had to take a trip that required ALL of my gear, this would not work, but then again...I'd just drive, lol.

I have fasted before and was honestly skeptical about a book about fasting, but this was recommended by a dear friend that I trust in these things, so I decided to go ahead and read it and I am glad that I did.  From the beginning it got me so excited about fasting as a form of worship!  Before I was halfway through I was mentally planning out fasts and making lists of things that I wanted to fast FOR.  I love the whole idea of fasting as an integral part of worship and had never thought of it that way before.  This book definitely motivated me to be more intentional about fasting.
I haven't missed a single episode of this series, and always look forward to them.  Sexy, funny, and smart as well as mean and spiteful...they do it all.  Really enjoy this show a lot.

My husband likes to drink hot chocolate sometimes in the evening before going to bed, and he has tried it all!  This is the only hot chocolate he will drink now.  He likes this MUCH better than their Dark Chocolate, but I like them both.
Having just finished Seasons 1 through 4, I'd have to say this is one of my favorite series ever.  I adore Raylan and anxiously await more of his cavalier attitude in Season 5.

...and probably all because of Timothy Olyphant.  I just love his character and the way he is.  Even as I write this...I JUST finished Season 4, (blew through Seasons 1 through 4 in very short order) and now anxiously await the DVR'ing of Season 5.
Couldn't wait for this show to come back on and now the wait between episodes seems painfully long.  I love everything about the show.
I love Revenge and find most episodes to be deserving of at least 3 or 4 stars.  Ready for it to be done though.

I wanted something that would calm my mind down at night and help me relax enough to fall asleep.  This isn't it.  I enjoy the music and a lot of the sounds, but birds REALLY don't make noise constantly and loudly as they do in this...every time I start to relax, a freaking loud, sharp chirping sound shocks me awake.This sounds like someone just took random "nature" sounds and kept looping them over and over in short bursts...it doesn't sound or feel natural to me at all, and it certainly doesn't relax me.
Fell in love with this from the theme song on Haven and had to have it.  I listen to it frequently and love it.

4:01 MinsFINALLY!!  A dryer brush that works as good as, or better, than my old one!  I just got this today and couldn't wait to try it out.  The reviews indicated that it was worth the purchase, and it IS.4 years ago my trusty old conair dryer brush fell apart.  I've been through 3 dryer brushes since then, none of which worked worth a darn, and didn't hold out much hope of finding one at all that would work with my thick longish hair.Well...my hair looks fabulous...BETTER than when I get it done at the salon.  Seems no one at the salon ever listens to me and does my hair *exactly* the way I like it.  Don't have to worry about that anymore.  I can go back to doing it myself, and it looks just the way I want it.  My hair is slightly curly and when left to air dry, it gets frizzy...and if they don't dry it COMPLETELY at the salon...it gets frizzy.  No worries with this - I dry it until it slips through the bristles like silk and I know it's perfect.  The bristles on this brush are really great with my hair.  Most of the ones I've tried in the past few years have "hair type bristles" that will not go all the way through my hair and are a real pain.  The bristles on this are a combination of hair and hard plastic bristles...exactly what is needed for thick hair...they work great.I saw where several people complained about the controls...I didn't find that to be a problem for me at all.  They are right at the perfect place where I can easily slide it from low to high or to cool.  I usually only use high anyway, but I didn't think it was an issue.I will post a video review when I get time.LOVE this product!*ADDED COMMENT*  January 15, 2015: I am still using this dryer brush and still love it!  I am purchasing one for my Mom, in fact.  I would love to add a couple of before/after pics, but cannot figure out how to do that.  This is the only drying tool I use, and 98% of the time, except for heat protectant,  I don't use mousse or any other product to make my hair behave, and it's always perfect.

I LOVE this balsamic vinegar.  I do prefer it in the bottle with the snap on/off lid, but have trouble finding it.  I usually buy a regular bottle and pour it into the other bottle.I tend to use balsamic vinegar on many things...salads (both leafy green and fruit salads), I sometimes make lettuce (or endive) wrap "sandwiches" and use it on those, I pour it over meat and seafood and use it as a marinade frequently.I recently made grilled brussel sprout halves, and after placing them on the plate to serve, I drizzled this balsamic over them lightly and everyone raved about them.  It added a really nice little kick to them.I've tried A LOT of balsamic vinegars and NONE comes close to this.  I keep extra bottles on hand so that I never run out.We just had simple salad of fresh spinach with fresh sliced heirloom tomatoes drizzled with this and it is awesome...you don't need anything else added to the salad to make it delicious!The taste of this balsamic is deep, rich and complex...satisfies with both a delicious sweetness and a bold sourness that is perfectly balanced.
Bought this for a friend after her Dad died.  It's a song she really loves, and I thought it was a pretty good song.
Bought this for as friend after her Dad died since the song described what her Dad was like.  She really liked the song a lot, I thought it was OK, not my style I guess.

This is the second book in the Bruno Chief of Police series. I was given the first book as a gift and I was hooked. This second book is just as good as the first. I love the setting - St. Denis, France in the Dordogne district. Bruno Coureges is a wonderful protagonist. He's a policeman who knows his community, and he understands human nature. He is smart, compassionate, warm and kind. These books have wonderful secondary characters too and I'm beginning to get to know the whole of community of St. Denis after only two books. There's always a lot of French history in the books (for example the Resistance in the second WW). In this book Bruno is called out early in the morning to a barn fire, and has he investigates he realizes it's arson. The best part of the books though is the descriptions of the characters tasting the great wines of the region, and sampling what sounds like wonderful food. Both of these things would have me sold on their own, but the books are well-written. The plots are tight, the setting is delicious and Bruno is so very likeable. I can't wait to read Book 3.

Sara Paretsky proves once again that she is one of the best mystery writers out there.  This book is a real wild ride.  I read through the book at breakneck pace.  The tension never lets up from the first page right up to the very end where Ms. Paretsky treats us to such a menacing ending.  What she does best is her characterization.  Her bad guys are really bad guys and VI always finds herself on the wrong side of them and she's quite often in the unenviable place of being on the outs with Chicago's finest at the same time.  In this book we get a good look at VI's young growing up years in the rough south end of Chicago.  An old flame asks for her help to gather information to help get an exoneration for his mother who has just served 25 years in prison for killing her daughter who was Frank's sister. It goes against everything VI wants to do.  She does not want to dredge up all the memories of her childhood when her mother and father were both alive, but she is forced into helping when some old acquaintances start bad -mouthing her family and herself. At great risk to herself ,she sets out to clear the name of her famous cousin Boom Boom Warshawski who was a stellar hockey player for the Chicago Blackhawks.  I love VI.  She's such a champion of the truth and will do anything to help people who come to her for help.  Non-stop action, and the developing relationship between VI and her musician boyfriend Jake were what kept me flipping pages in this book.  I highly recommend it.

As it turns out, she can get herself into all kinds of trouble -  certainly more than her absent-minded father can even imagine.  This series is a delight and we are treated to the most unique sleuth you'll find in the mystery genre.  For those that don't know Flavia, she's an 11 year old precocious girl who loves chemistry, poisons and loves solving puzzles.  The book is set in England in the 50's and mostly around Flavia's remote English village and her crumbling pile of a home called Buckshaw.  We have her two evil sisters Feely and Daffy who enjoy nothing more than making Flavia's life a torment.  In this book Flavia visits an old gypsy woman to get her fortune told at the parish fair, and due to an accident that Flavia caused, she becomes involved in the gypsy woman's life.  When the gypsy is found beaten in her trailer, Flavia is on the trail of the person who did it.  Then another body turns up and she's in full sleuth mode.  She and her trusty Gladys (Flavia's bicycle) are seen peddling all over the county. These books are a true delight and Flavia is a wonderful protagonist.  The mysteries are tricky and the characters wonderful. This a great series for mystery lovers who enjoy their mysteries a little offbeat.

This book has been on my to read list for a long time and I finally got to it.  This book is a wonderful portrayal of life, hope, learning to live with past mistakes and it's also a wonderful place to meet truly great characters.  Harold Fry is a 60 year old man living in retirement in Devon, UK with his wife Maureen.  He has led a very small life just trying to earn enough money to support his wife and son David.  He had worked for many years at a local brewery. Then 20 years before this book was set, a terrible personal event occurred which changed his life and his marriage forever.  One morning he receives a letter from an old colleague that he used to work with.  Queenie Hennessey has written to him after 20 years to tell him that she is dying of cancer.
