It was pretty short which I actually liked and the writing was crisp and to the point with just enough humor thrown in to make this realistic versus delivering me a bunch of teenagers ready for the butchers block.The story starts of right away, four teens on the verge of adulthood are cruising through the woods on a short trip to their friends cabin in order to help with clean up for new potential buyers. Trevor, Sarah, Amy and Kincaid have all the necessities; cleaning supplies and party supplies as well in forms of beer and smokes. Serenity is broken when they finally get to the cabin only to discover a gristly scene, their grandmother passed away so they didnt expect any signs of life but the disarray alone with bodies of dismembered animals throw them into a loop. Once the shock passes they decide to throw out all the icky bits and get down to cleaning eerie how that comes back to haunt them later. Just when they think that stuff is under control terror strikes them, someone or something is out there observing their every move and it wont leave until the cabin is restored to its former bloody glory.Even though Im a horror lover I was surprised with the authors ease when it came to hacking away at his characters, it was pretty awesome even though I had high hopes for a high survival rate, oh well cant have it all :P This is freaky, gutsy and merciless and certainly an entertaining way to spend a Sunday not to mention how conductive lake, wood and island places are to a good scary story, great stuff.- Kasia S.

I happened to find this single by chance, and by chance I mean by putting "Two Steps From Hell" into my Amazon search every few days and desperately scanning the site in hope of some new music. For those who don't know, Thomas Bergersen, the composer of "Autumn Love" is in TSFH with Nick Phoenix, another brilliant musical genius. There is nothing like music from them, nothing. I'm always trying to find something similar when I crave more but it's never as good, it comes close-ish but it's not what these guys can offer so anytime there's a single I quickly buy it without even listening. Then it goes on repeat until I love it forever."Autumn Love" is luscious piano piece with some string instruments that reminds me of music from his 2011 "Illusions" album (formerly called Nemesis II)  it's in that flavor vein. There is a lot of movement that makes me picture light sparkling though amber colored leaves swaying on a tree only to sweetly transforms into a gentle gallop with a depth that gives me goose bumps, it almost sounds like throbbing cellos in the core of the piano until it lifts off effervescently into silence once it's over. This is quiet and richly brooding at the same time, a real heart squeezer. Perfect for writing or reading as it will bring out your creative juices. I always smile when I read in reviews that this music helps people do their creative work because it has certainly kept me going the last few years.Kasia S.This single is in two different spots on Amazon that aren't linked review wise, so I'm posting same review for both. Song are identical.

For those who don't know, Thomas Bergersen, the composer of "Autumn Love" is in TSFH with Nick Phoenix, another brilliant musical genius. There is nothing like music from them, nothing. I'm always trying to find something similar when I crave more but it's never as good, it comes close-ish but it's not what these guys can offer so anytime there's a single I quickly buy it without even listening. One of my longtime friends at work, well my boss now, is a longtime big fan of Betsey Johnson so every once in a while I get her a piece as a gift for the holidays or on her birthday with few other things. She hasnt been disappointed yet but she certainly has a very cool style and can pull it off, she makes this fun zany stuff look great. I was excited to see it in person after I placed my order because I was both curious and worried as it was a gift, when I get things for myself its somehow less pressure to deliver perfection. Well, this bracelet was so cute that I instantly wanted it for myself so I knew it was a nice present. Fun statement pieces dont have to be expensive but its best when they look solid and this looks great, good heft and really well set with the black and white enamel, right type of shiny and beautiful. The ballet pink heart crystal in the bows center isnt gaudy and it gives it a fun edge and a sparkle of contrasting color. I tried it on when it arrived because of the reviews that had issues with this bracelet and that is common for all the styles, not just this bow one, few of the hinge style bracelet buyers were unfortunately disappointed. Luckily I didnt have any issues, it snapped in place great. My friend wore it right away and didnt have any issues either, Im guessing that quality control is to blame; some pieces seem to come out perfect while other people get a bad batch perhaps. Boo not nice.Johnson is quite eccentric and this makes for awesome jewelry, I have friends who worked for her as were all in the apparel business and shes a glass of champagne in human form lol, bubbly and then some! Next time Im getting a piece for myself, each series and collection has some special pieces that can perk up even the coziest simple outfit of tank and jeans or what not.- Kasia S.

I got this for my boyfriend for the holidays as we're both huge Fringe fans and Walter is our favorite character, I always joke that I want to be him when I grow up, we're both book, food and science obsessed!This is a simple clean looking mug with a witty message that is from the actual show, sometimes Walter gets too preoccupied with his discoveries either in form of strawberry souffle or by opening a wormhole into a parallel universe to bother with people like things such as pants. It's such a random thing to pick, the man is dresses 99% of the time that it made me chuckle, had to get it.. Walter Bishop is someone who makes you want to be a better version of yourself, what a better way to celebrate that than with a morning cup of java? Drink up :)

This face cream has the most luscious soft creamy cloud like texture and it spreads wonderfully on the skin. Its almost gilded looking as its tinted from the red tea but wont show on the face as anything but healthy. Im addicted, well its my first time using the African Red Tea line even though Ive been a fan of Ole for the past ten years, and I absolutely love it. In the winter my skin feels extra dry and this makes it relaxed and soft with just one easy layer after washing my face and adding either some Fresh Seaberry oil or the Boscia Tsubaki oil, this on top makes for the best cold skin winter treat. I use this in the PM only and a rich day cream from Avene in the day, I need moisture but this cream seems to do so well at night as I sleep that I reserve it for the time it can truly be potent, its not cheap so stretching it is nice.The scent is also shocking to some, to me it smells exactly like an old favorite, The Body Shops Beer shampoo, man it smelled like candied citrus drowned in a luxe souffl like cake, just delish.- Kasia S.

I really love this tub, it's filled to the brim with great quality organic extra virgin coconut oil and it smells divine by the way. Fragrance wise it shouldn't be confused with fresh juicy coconut as this is slightly smoky,  the oil has a delicate toffee like caramel coco tone that only lingers for a bit and doesn't clash with perfume, if anything those lipids will give it extra staying power. When the weather cools this solidifies but I just scoop it out and honestly this rarely leaves my bathroom. My favorite way of using it is after a shower or a bath, a nice thin layer of this oil scooped out and smoothed between the hands all over, it makes for the most luxurious skin treatment that leaves me feeling very relaxed, it's great in the morning if I'm not in a rush, it might take few minutes to skin in but it's especially wonderful at night. After using it I ooze into my bed and sleep deliciously, it's very soothing and spa like, my muscles always feel warm and pampered and it makes for the softest skin, even pricier creams don't work this well, I guess it's the nature and not chemical processes doing all the hard work.This is definitely edible, I know that I tend to use it more as a beauty treatment but many people take coconut oil as a supplement as well , I have cooked curries with it; Thai and Indian types, very tasty but not to be over heated as it can separate. For some reason the Viva labs brand feels better on my skin and hair, I have used the Nature's Way brand and it was good but this feel superior when used on the skin, something about it if beyond soothing and leaves the skin extra smooth, I'm going through a very hard cold winter in NY now and I use this oil in the am and pm after showering, my skin feels beyond soft, a real saver in bad weather when lotions aren't enough. This oil also makes for the best hair treatment, rub some in for a few hours and then shampoo out for the glossiest locks.- Kasia S.

Knorr Fix Spaghetti Bolognese might come in the form of a slim little packet but when finished it's a rich, luscious meaty sauce with a blanket of savory tomato gravy specked with piquant oils in teeny tiny pools here and there. Might sound weird but it's so hearty and mouth licking good that just writing this review makes me want to eat some right now, I have to order it since it's tough to find. My mom used to make this for me once in a while as a treat when we lived in Poland so when we moved to America when I was twelve I was very happy to find its own version of it here. It almost tastes the same, few of the options on Amazon come from Germany, that's the last one I tried and it was almost that very same taste I remember.Kudos for mom for finding this, she's a total organic health nut but this she likes and I don't usually cook too much from pre-mixed packets and boxed dinner mixes, frozen veggies and canned legumes is the usual stretch for me but this sauce, oh man, spectacular! Anything can be used for this, ground meat or tofu for veggie lovers with some water and the mix, then it goes over pasta of any shape, Spaghetti noodles being my first choice or even rice or baked potato this will make for a very tasty meal.- Kasia S.

I must say that I am pretty happy with this indoor/outdoor electric grill. Cooking on it is a snap and it does produce excellent results.  I do use a meat thermometer when using it as I do with both my charcoal and gas grill but I use one if I am preparing meat in the oven or on the stove so this is not big deal.There are a couple of downsides to this grill from my point of view.  They are as follows:The grill plates are not removable so cleaning is more of a chore than it really should be.  I personally simply place my grill by my sink and use plenty of paper towels, warm soapy water and elbow grease.  Again, this is not all that bad and I am not really complaining...just noting.The grill has a very short chord which I suppose was used for safety reasons.  My home, both indoor and outdoor is not wired to cover such short chords which necessitated my using an extension chord...must be a three pronged chord.Other than that all is well.This is an attractive grill and I use it on my screened in back porch, side patio and indeed, even my kitchen at times.  Like I said in the beginning, this thing cooks meat well and is extremely easy to use.Storage is no problem; again, I use the back porch where it is out of the elements.  The grill is easy to assemble out of the box.All in all a very fine product.

This kitchen machine pretty well works as the product page says.  I will admit right from the start that I am not a big fan of Black & Decker products in general (I really, really dislike most of their tools), but I must admit that I was quite impressed with this slicer and dicer.  It does the job it was meant to perform.My kitchen is filled with different countertop appliances and indeed, I have two different machine which perform the same function as this B&D.  The thing is that these machines, both quite expensive, really perform no better than the one being reviewed here.We eat a tremendous amount of salads and do a lot of entertaining in our home.  This dicer prepares fruits and vegetables perfectly for salad preparation and vegetables for stews, fried potatoes, turnips, beats, etc.  It can prepare very large batches with very little effort and it is an absolute snap when it comes to prepping salads meant for two.I suppose the major features of this machine is that it is much, much easier to clean than other brands and models I have used in the past.  I also like the fact that a separate container comes to store the blades.  Many like machines do not have this feature and the blades are a pure pain to store.Now as to blades...hey folks, these things are SHARP!  Do take great care in handling them as they can deal you out a very series injury if you are not careful.The motor on this unit is extremely strong and the machine is very well built...more so than many other B&D products I have been unfortunate enough to purchase and use over the years.  I am thinking the motor on this one should last a long, long time.The cost here on Amazon is extremely competitive compared to what they are asking locally.I am extremely happy with this thing and as each day and week goes by I am finding more and more uses for it.

Since I do not wear a beard nor do I have to shave my face (thank goodness)...yet, I passed this one along to a brother-in-law whom I am rather fond of...hey, he married my closest sister.  Anyway, He has been delighted with this shaver.  According to him, via a face to face report, the shaver gives him a fast, comfortable and very close shave.  He does have extremely sensitive skin and I did not hear one word of whining pass his lips.He was impressed with the ease in which this thing can e cleaned.  He also liked the fact that it worked equally well as both a wet and dry shaver.  He was also very impressed with the battery life which has been far greater than any model he has ever owned or used.Now I say he did not whine, but I have to tell you that he did mumble something about the replacement heads costing more than several of his beloved birddogs.  I assured him that when the time came that I would take out a loan and cover the cost for him.  That sort of shamed him and I heard no more complaining.Overall his is quite happy with this shaver and since he is not a shy person as to voicing complaints I am content that he is pleased with this shaver which , in turn, pleases me and pleases my sister.

I have absolutely no problem with the ingredients in these things.  They are not made in China, which for me is a big, bug plus.Now as to likeability...or the dogs point of view; one of my dogs loves these things...a Boston terrier, and the other is sort of unenthusiastic...will eat them but does not go wild over them and about half the time I find the buried in my bed.Overall I like these and will probably add them to the line-up to toss them a treat now and then.

Being single and childless, you would think I had no use for scissors such as these, particularly in this quantity.  Not so!  I am the only single sister in a very large family and I have nieces and nephews in and out of my house on a daily basis...translate that into the family's free baby sitter.  I have a large store of craft projects ready to go on instant notice and am constantly adding.But that is not where these particular scissors will be going.  No, these will be used by my sister-in-law in her school room.  She has been teaching first grade for a number of years now and is in great need of supplies for her students.  Our local schools system is under the gun as far as budget cuts go, as are many, and my sister-in-law spends quite a lot of money out of her own pocket each year keeping `her kids' in supplies.We did test these scissors and they are quite good...as good as or better than anything else on the market.  They cut well, can be used by left and right handed students, are easy and comfortable to use.  They are very well built and should lat quite some time despite the abuse the will surely be subjected to.This is an excellent set and I can and do recommend them highly.

One of my brothers, who happens to be an English professor and in his spare time teaches and coaches young men and women who are having difficulties in reading (High School kids), directed me toward these books quite a number of years ago.  He uses them (among many others) as books to entice reluctant readers.  He maintains reading is a habit and that the more you read, not unlike sports, the better you will become and the better you become the more you will read.  (I took his advice and applied it to my golf game years ago and hey, it works).Anyway, this book, `Pawn of Prophecy' is the first book in a series which actually includes ten books divided into two series, "The Belgariad," and "The Malloreon."  All ten books are one continuous story and to be frank, they need to be read in order to make any sense out of them.This book and this series, is a traditional quest story.  You have several primary characters and a number of characters who show up time and again as the core characters travel a mythological world fighting an ultimate evil.Now these books are not complicated as far as plot goes and there are a lot of repetitions.  Indeed, through the ten books the astute reader will find numerous flaws in the plot (I read one review here where some guy, as a hobby, has identified over 200 plot flaws...actually, blatant errors on the part of the author.  To be honest though, I found this to be part of the charm of these books; that and the verbally duels between characters.Wizardry and magic is involved as are some very unlikely situations.  It simply must be remember though that these books are meant to be FUN TO READ!  If you want serious and bind bending plots look to Martin or one of his ilk.  No, Eddings is simply telling a fun tell to be enjoyed by all.At the core of the story is Garion, a boy raised on a farm who through trial, error and much guidance from his aunt, Polgaria the Sorceress and her father Belgarath (Garion's ultimate grandfather who is 7,000 years old,  becomes...well, King of just about everything.Now these books are good reads for both boys and girls (or men and women) due to the fact that this is one of the first S&S books which featured a dominate female character.The stories are well written, flaws and all, and will keep the pages turning.  I realize that hard core readers of this genre, such as Martin fans, take exception to these books (Hey, I love Martin's work also) but these predated works such as this and I really don't feel their goal was to compete.  These books canoot be classified as "high literature," and indeed, this is yet another part of chair charm.Now keep in mind, the plot in these stories are pretty predictable as are the actions of most of the characters...most of the time.  That is okay though...as I said...these books are meant to be fun and to entertain.Over the years I have given this series multiple readings and still read all ten cover to cover about every two years or so.

Being the only single sister in a very, very large family my home is normally filled with children ages 8 months to 13 years.  The reason for this is that I am the designated `free baby sitter."  That is okay with me though since I dearly love all my nieces and nephews and would rather see them at my place rather than a day care center or something like that.The latest member of `my gang' is an 8 month old girl.  I have had to restock toys for wee one and this little work table, i.e. baby entertainment center, is a wonderful addition.  I was raised with Fisher Price toys and therefore am a long time fan.My new niece loves this thing.  She is starting to take her first steps now and as soon as she hits the floor when she comes here she heads straight for this thing...makes me sort of jealous being passed by for a table!Noises, flashing lights, strange sounds, and music...what aunt can compete with that.I have found this play table to be quite well made.  It was very easy to set up and after VERY CAREFUL examination I found no dangerous elements to fret about.  My niece loves turning the pages of the little book attached to the top and for some reason is fascinated with the three balls available.  I am trying to teach her to throw already as I plan a future as a pitcher one day soon.Three AA batteries are needed to run some of the elements of this toy but they are easy to change and very secure.  Unlike some, I have had no problems with her sliding the table all over the place.  The only problem I do have is that my three Boston terriers think that the balls belong to them...I have some more training to do it would seem.This is a wonderful toy and my niece, who like most wee one her age has the attention span of a ferret on coffee, stay with this one for great lengths of time.

I have to admit to being one of those people who have a `thing' for soaps; the more the better and I am constantly trying new flavors.  I must say that this bar being reviewed here is quite good and I have been very impressed with it.It lathers very nicely...I do love lots of suds and these have a very nice silky feeling to them.The scent is not overwhelming in my opinion but I do have to agree with a couple of the other reviewers here that this one could be used by either men or women since it dose have a slightly masculine scent to it.  In my case though, this is the sort of scent I prefer so I am fine with it.Now it may seem to some that this soap is a bit pricy but I can assure you that there are many, many soaps out there that are much more expensive than this one, and in my opinion, not as nice or effective.I feel quite clean after using this soapI have no complaints.

As the only single female or male in a rather large family of brothers and sisters my house is normally filled with wee ones (translate that into the families' free baby sitter) which range in ages from five months to 12 years.  My home is pretty well baby ready and kids ready at any given time.  The newest member of the hoard is a delightful little girl of only 4 months.  And yes, in addition to everything else, I even have a pretty good nursery set up in the corner of one of the bedrooms - the room next to mine.This Tiny Love crib toy is a delight.  The baby loves it.  It an be used on either the crib side or over head or can be placed beside her on the floor.  It runs of 3 AA batteries, something I purchase by the case.This is an eye and ear catcher for the little one.  The toy is easy to use, well made and I was unable to find, after EXTREMELY close examination, any safety issues what so ever.This is truly a neat item.

Having had a grandfather and a great uncle who served and fought in the Korean War, (My great uncle was killed during the Chosen (Hosen) Breakout), I have, since a little girl been pretty well indoctrinated with facts and stories of this horrible conflict.  I know that reading stories of war are not normally a `girl thing' but I have been devouring books on this subject since I was about thirteen.I was familiar with the particular event which is the center portion of this book, i.e. the amazing attempted rescues of a downed pilot by another as I not only have read about it, but listen to it during family discussions.This is truly an inspirational work.  Not only does it show our American warriors at their best, it also gives is a great and detailed account of the life and death of Jesse Brown who was our first NAVY combat pilot and carrier pilot.  That story alone is worth the read of this work.In addition to the above though, the author has given us a good `starter' book as to the outbreak of the Korean War; a subject I find that most young people know little of these days.  This is one of the most brutal wars we have ever been involved in and between wretched government decisions and just plain poor leadership, we almost lost our Marine Corps.While the causes of this war and indeed, accounts of the ground battle are a bit elementary in this work it never the less is a great starting place.More importantly though, this is the story of what bravery under fire and devotion actually is and should be a must read. This tell the story; a well researched story, that Americans need to know of.

This is a well designed and well made instrument.  It is light, compact and reliable.  The whole thing  instrument, lanyard, cover and pouch  is good quality.It monitors pulse rate and oxygen levels.  It has a belt loop, so you could wear it while jogging, etc and take readings at intervals.The instructions give you no help on interpreting the readings.  You'll need to research that online.  Pulse rate I knew about, but I had no clue regarding SpO2.From what I've seen, it's somewhat pricier than other products with similar functionality, but I suspect that this product is top range.I received a free sample of this product in return for an honest review, which is the only kind I give anyway.

Stylish and attractive, and the displays are very clear.Set up is fairly straightforward, though not trivial.  You need to read the manual carefully first.  Use is also simple, but if you program more than one user's data into it, it could get a little complicated.  With one user, you just step on and your values are displayed.Some scales require a tap before you step on.  I hate that.  This is a simple step-on-and-read scale.The weight, Body Mass Index calculation and the readings for Body Fat and Body Water are useful for monitoring your health and fitness, and the manual contains tables to help you interpret those readings.The manual tells you virtually nothing about how to interpret the Muscle Mass and Bone Mass readings.  You need to go online to research that.  In fact, it seems that the figures themselves don't mean very much, but you might want to monitor how they change over time.All in all, attractive, good quality scales for the fitness-conscious from a reliable manufacturer.I received a free sample of this product in return for an honest review, which is the only kind I give anyway.

If you find it useful to carry a small, lightweight flashlight around with you, this is a great choice.  It is sturdy and robust, looking as if it would tolerate some rough handling.  The light is very good for a flashlight of this size.  The nylon pouch is also good quality and has a belt loop.It includes a charger.  If you really need to, you can also buy a replacement battery (Streamlight brand 3.7V 660 mAh rechargeable lithium ion battery) made especially for this penlight.  The carrying pouch is just large enough to carry the penlight and a spare battery, as a snug fit.

Barilla pasta is consistently good in my experience, and these orecchiette are no exception.  They work especially well with a chunky sauce, where they serve to hold the chunks of tomato, etc.They do however have a tendency to stick, to nest one inside another, so you have to do a lot of stirring to prevent this.I still think elbow macaroni hold a cheese sauce better.  "Orecchiette cheese" would not work so well.  But this is a good pasta that would add some variety to your dishes.

As a heavy tea drinker, I have owned a great many electric kettles and tend to get through them quickly.  This one is about par for the course, and has all the features needed, including a water level window.  The quality seems good and the price is reasonable.The filter in the spout is removable and replaceable.  It fits in very firmly, so don't be afraid to give it a hard tug when removing it.My only issue with it is that the handle design is not as ergonomic as it could be.  You tend to hold it at too great an angle, making it feel heavier than it should.  If you are elderly or infirm, this might be a problem.

It's interesting that these towels are marketed as "decorative bath accessories".  They are really for show, and little else.  They are very attractive and would go well in a half-bathroom (just toilet and wash basin) where you need something to dry your hands and possibly your face.They are embossed (the word they use is "embellished") with an attractive design.  This makes them both more aesthetically appealing and less practical.One oddity is that the two larger items (billed as bath towel and hand towel) have a decorative strip sewn along one edge.  The odd thing is that the bottom of the strip is not sewn on, thus forming a sort of pouch.  Quite why they did this I do not know.Anyway, if you want to add a touch of elegance to your rest room, you should consider these.

These made-in-India, 100% cotton napkins have a quality look and feel to them.  Really, very nice.Washed and dried according to instructions, there was a shrinkage of nearly an inch each way, and they came out of the dryer very wrinkled, and required ironing.If that sounds practical enough for you, and you want the quality, these are a good choice.

I have used several MeasuPro products and the quality is consistently good.  This is no exception.  It is accurate and durable.It has an IPX-7 waterproof standard, meaning it is protected against water immersion for 30 minutes at a depth of 1 meter.  It is machine washable, but personally I feel safer just wiping it clean.I admit to having some trouble understanding how to use the pen-holder sleeve as an extendible handle.  The instructions say, "Slide the clip of the thermometer cover to the metal holder on the thermometer".  I eventually figured out what that meant and I can see that it would be useful.  A diagram would have been nice.  Using the pen-holder sleeve to keep the thermometer in a pocket is problematic because it is so top heavy.  That's not a problem for me because I would never carry it around.I received a free sample of this product in return for an honest review, which is the only kind I give anyway.

Thick, durable and attractive placemats, in a rich, pleasing color.  They are a good size and it is useful that they come in sets of 6 and not just 4.The washing instructions are not on a sewn-on label but on a removable sticker.  I washed them, following the instructions closely.  There was no color loss, but there was noticeable shrinkage.  Also, they crumpled up and needed to be stretched out.  The only way to do it would be to steam iron them flat.  For me, that's a deal breaker, as place mats are likely to get soiled often and need to be easy to launder.

I have used Cascade Dishwasher Detergent Action Pacs for some time now and am very pleased with them.  They are clean and convenient and do a good job.  I usually use the Complete version and I have to say I think they do a somewhat better job than these.Take care to keep the contents dry, otherwise you start them dissolving.  Also keep the pacs away from toddlers, because they may be attractive to little hands and mouths.
